Go to the documentation of this file.

10const gsc_GenOptions GSC_BASIC_OPT = {
11 .will_name_offspring = GSC_FALSE,
12 .offspring_name_prefix = NULL,
13 .family_size = 1,
14 .will_track_pedigree = GSC_FALSE,
15 .will_allocate_ids = GSC_TRUE,
16 .filename_prefix = NULL,
17 .will_save_pedigree_to_file = GSC_FALSE,
18 .will_save_bvs_to_file = GSC_NO_EFFECTSET,
19 .will_save_alleles_to_file = GSC_FALSE,
20 //.will_save_recombinations_to_file = GSC_FALSE,
21 .will_save_to_simdata = GSC_TRUE
22};
23
34static void* gsc_malloc_wrap(const size_t size, char exitonfail) {
35 if (size == 0) {
36 fprintf(stderr, "0 memory allocation requested.\n");
37 return NULL;
38 }
39 void* v = GSC_MALLOC(size);
40 if (v == NULL) {
41 if (exitonfail) {
42 fprintf(stderr, "Memory allocation failed. Exiting.\n"); exit(2);
43 } else {
44 fprintf(stderr, "Memory allocation failed.\n");
45 }
46 }
47 return v;
48}
49
62gsc_AlleleMatrix* gsc_create_empty_allelematrix(const GSC_GENOLEN_T n_markers,
63 const GSC_ID_T n_labels,
64 const int* labelDefaults,
65 const GSC_LOCALX_T n_genotypes) {
66 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_AlleleMatrix),GSC_TRUE);
67
68 m->n_genotypes = n_genotypes;
69 m->n_markers = n_markers;
70 m->n_labels = n_labels;
71 //m->alleles = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char*) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
72 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < n_genotypes; ++i) {
73 m->alleles[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * (n_markers<<1),GSC_TRUE);
74 memset(m->alleles[i], 0, sizeof(char) * (n_markers<<1));
75 //m->ids[i] = 0;
76 }
77 memset(m->alleles + n_genotypes, 0, sizeof(char*) * (CONTIG_WIDTH - n_genotypes)); // setting the pointers to NULL
78
79 if (n_labels > 0) {
80 m->labels = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int*) * n_labels,GSC_TRUE);
81 for (GSC_ID_T i = 0; i < n_labels; ++i) {
82 m->labels[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * CONTIG_WIDTH,GSC_TRUE);
83 for (GSC_LOCALX_T j = 0; j < CONTIG_WIDTH; ++j) {
84 m->labels[i][j] = labelDefaults[i];
85 }
86 }
87 } else if (n_labels == 0) {
88 m->labels = NULL;
89 } else {
90 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid negative number of labels provided to gsc_create_empty_allelematrix");
91 m->labels = NULL;
92 }
93
94 memset(m->ids, 0, sizeof(gsc_PedigreeID) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
95 memset(m->pedigrees[0], 0, sizeof(gsc_PedigreeID) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
96 memset(m->pedigrees[1], 0, sizeof(gsc_PedigreeID) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
97 memset(m->groups, 0, sizeof(gsc_GroupNum) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
98 memset(m->names, 0, sizeof(char*) * CONTIG_WIDTH); // setting the pointers to NULL
99
100 m->next = NULL;
101
102 return m;
103}
104
112gsc_SimData* gsc_create_empty_simdata(RND_U32 RNGseed) {
113 gsc_SimData* d = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_SimData),GSC_TRUE);
114 d->n_labels = 0;
115 d->label_ids = NULL;
116 d->label_defaults = NULL;
117 d->genome.n_markers = 0;
118 d->genome.marker_names = NULL;
119 d->genome.names_alphabetical = NULL;
120 d->genome.n_maps = 0;
121 d->genome.map_ids = NULL;
122 d->genome.maps = NULL;
123 d->m = NULL;
124 d->n_eff_sets = 0;
125 d->e = NULL;
126 rnd_pcg_seed( &d->rng, RNGseed );
127 d->current_id = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
128 d->n_groups = 0;
129 return d;
130}
131
142void gsc_clear_simdata(gsc_SimData* d) {
143 // Free label defaults
144 if (d->n_labels > 0) {
145 if (d->label_ids != NULL) {
146 GSC_FREE(d->label_ids);
147 }
148 if (d->label_defaults != NULL) {
149 GSC_FREE(d->label_defaults);
150 }
151 }
152
153 // Free other details
154 gsc_delete_genome(&(d->genome));
155 for (GSC_ID_T i = 0; i < d->n_eff_sets; ++i) {
156 gsc_delete_effect_matrix(&(d->e[i]));
157 }
158 if (d->n_eff_sets > 0) {
159 GSC_FREE(d->eff_set_ids);
160 GSC_FREE(d->e);
161 }
162 gsc_delete_allele_matrix(d->m);
163
164 // Clear all values
165 d->n_labels = 0;
166 d->label_ids = NULL;
167 d->label_defaults = NULL;
168 d->genome.n_markers = 0;
169 d->genome.marker_names = NULL;
170 d->genome.n_maps = 0;
171 d->genome.map_ids = NULL;
172 d->genome.maps = NULL;
173 d->m = NULL;
174 d->n_eff_sets = 0;
175 d->e = NULL;
176 d->current_id = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
177 d->n_groups = 0;
178}
179
180/*-------------------------Random generators---------------------------------*/
181
182/* https://www.everything2.com/title/Generating+random+numbers+with+a+Poisson+distribution
183https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poisson_distribution#Generating_Poisson-distributed_random_variables
184*/
195int gsc_randpoi(rnd_pcg_t* rng, double lambda) {
196 if (lambda <= 0) { // invalid parameter.
197 //In this case we use the function to generate number of crossovers
198 // so if parameter/length passed in is invalid, we just want no crossovers
199 return 0;
200 }
201
202 int k = 0;
203 double target = exp(-lambda);
204 double p = rnd_pcg_nextf(rng);
205 while (p > target) {
206 k += 1;
207 p *= rnd_pcg_nextf(rng);
208 }
209 return k;
210}
211
212/*end random generators*/
213
214/*------------------------Supporter Functions--------------------------------*/
215
234struct gsc_TableSize gsc_get_file_dimensions(const char* filename, const char sep) {
235 struct gsc_TableSize details;
236 details.num_columns = 0;
237 details.num_rows = 0;
238
239 FILE* fp;
240 int c; // this is used to store the output of fgetc i.e. the next character in the file
241 if ((fp = fopen(filename, "r")) == NULL) {
242 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s.\n", filename); exit(1);
243 }
244 c = fgetc(fp);
245
246 while (c != EOF && c != '\n') {
247 //RPACKINSERT R_CheckUserInterrupt();
248 if (c == sep) {
249 details.num_columns += 1; // add count for columns of form [colname]sep
250 }
251 c = fgetc(fp);
252 }
253
254 details.num_columns += 1; // add another column that was bounded by sep[colname][EOF or \n]
255 details.num_rows = 1; // we successfully got the first row
256
257 // now get all the rows. What we care about in the rows is the number of them
258 c = fgetc(fp);
259 int sep_count = 0; // for each row, count the columns to make sure they match and the file is valid
260 int has_length = GSC_FALSE;
261 while (c != EOF) {
262 //RPACKINSERT R_CheckUserInterrupt();
263 if (c == '\n') {
264 details.num_rows += 1; // add count for columns of form [colname]sep
265
266 // check we have right number of columns and reset counter
267 if (has_length && sep_count != details.num_columns-1) {
268 // we have a bad number of columns
269 details.num_columns = 0;
270 fclose(fp);
271 fprintf(stderr, "Bad columns on row %d\n", details.num_rows + 1); exit(1);
272 }
273 sep_count = 0;
274 has_length = GSC_FALSE;
275
276 } else if (c == sep) {
277 sep_count += 1;
278 } else if (has_length == GSC_FALSE) {
279 has_length = GSC_TRUE;
280 }
281 c = fgetc(fp);
282 }
283 if (has_length) {
284 details.num_rows += 1; // for the last row before EOF
285 }
286
287 fclose(fp);
288 return details;
289}
290
312/*int gsc_get_from_ordered_uint_list(const unsigned int target,
313 const unsigned int listLen,
314 const unsigned int* list) {
315 unsigned int first = 0, last = listLen - 1;
316 int index = (first + last) / 2;
317 while (list[index] != target && first <= last) {
318 if (list[index] == 0) {
319 int lookahead = 1;
320 while(1) {
321 if (index+lookahead <= last && list[index+lookahead] != 0) {
322 if (list[index+lookahead] == target) {
323 return index+lookahead;
324 } else if (list[index+lookahead] < target) {
325 first = index+lookahead + 1;
326 break;
327 } else {
328 last = index - 1;
329 break;
330 }
331 } else if (index-lookahead <= last && list[index-lookahead] != 0) {
332 if (list[index-lookahead] == target) {
333 return index-lookahead;
334 } else if (list[index-lookahead] < target) {
335 first = index + 1;
336 break;
337 } else {
338 last = index-lookahead - 1;
339 break;
340 }
341 }
342 ++lookahead;
343 if (index+lookahead <= last || index-lookahead >= first) {
344 // failed to find any nonzeros between first and last
345 return -1;
346 }
347 }
348
349 } else { // No need to dodge 0. Normal binary search.
350 if (list[index] == target) {
351 return index;
352 } else if (list[index] < target) {
353 first = index + 1;
354 } else {
355 last = index - 1;
356 }
357
358 }
359 // index has been updated, no matter the branch.
360 index = (first + last) / 2;
361 }
362
363 if (first > last) {
364 return -1;
365 }
366 return index;
367}*/
368
390GSC_LOCALX_T gsc_get_from_ordered_pedigree_list(const gsc_PedigreeID target,
391 const GSC_LOCALX_T listLen,
392 const gsc_PedigreeID* list) {
393 GSC_LOCALX_T first = 0, last = listLen - 1;
394 GSC_LOCALX_T index = (first + last) / 2;
395 while (list[index].id != target.id && first <= last) {
396 if (list[index].id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
397 int lookahead = 1;
398 while(1) {
399 if (index+lookahead <= last && list[index+lookahead].id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
400 if (list[index+lookahead].id == target.id) {
401 return index+lookahead;
402 } else if (list[index+lookahead].id < target.id) {
403 first = index+lookahead + 1;
404 break;
405 } else {
406 last = index - 1;
407 break;
408 }
409 } else if (index-lookahead <= last && list[index-lookahead].id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
410 if (list[index-lookahead].id == target.id) {
411 return index-lookahead;
412 } else if (list[index-lookahead].id < target.id) {
413 first = index + 1;
414 break;
415 } else {
416 last = index-lookahead - 1;
417 break;
418 }
419 }
420 ++lookahead;
421 if (index+lookahead <= last || index-lookahead >= first) {
422 // failed to find any nonzeros between first and last
423 return GSC_NA_LOCALX;
424 }
425 }
426
427 } else { // No need to dodge 0. Normal binary search.
428 if (list[index].id == target.id) {
429 return index;
430 } else if (list[index].id < target.id) {
431 first = index + 1;
432 } else {
433 last = index - 1;
434 }
435
436 }
437 // index has been updated, no matter the branch.
438 index = (first + last) / 2;
439 }
440
441 if (first > last) {
442 return GSC_NA_LOCALX;
443 }
444 return index;
445}
446
463size_t gsc_get_from_unordered_str_list(const char* target,
464 const size_t listLen,
465 const char** list) {
466 for (size_t i = 0; i < listLen; ++i) {
467 if (strcmp(list[i], target) == 0) {
468 return i;
469 }
470 }
471 return SIZE_MAX; // did not find a match.
472}
473
490size_t gsc_get_from_ordered_str_list(const char* target,
491 const size_t listLen,
492 const char** list) {
493 size_t first = 0, last = listLen - 1;
494 size_t index = (first + last) / 2;
495 int comparison = strcmp(target,list[index]);
496 while (comparison != 0 && first <= last) {
497 if (comparison == 0) {
498 return index;
499 } else if (comparison < 0) {
500 first = index + 1;
501 } else {
502 last = index - 1;
503 }
504
505 // index has been updated, no matter the branch.
506 index = (first + last) / 2;
507 comparison = strcmp(target, list[index]);
508 }
509
510 if (first > last) {
511 return SIZE_MAX;
512 }
513 return index;
514}
515
516
530void gsc_shuffle_up_to(rnd_pcg_t* rng,
531 GSC_GLOBALX_T* sequence,
532 const size_t total_n,
533 const size_t n_to_shuffle) {
534 if (n_to_shuffle > 1) {
535 size_t maxi = total_n > n_to_shuffle ? n_to_shuffle - 1 : total_n - 1;
536 size_t i;
537 for (i = 0; i < maxi; ++i) {
538 // items before i are already shuffled
539 size_t j = i + rnd_pcg_range(rng,0,total_n - i - 1);
540
541 // add the next chosen value to the end of the shuffle
542 GSC_GLOBALX_T t = sequence[j];
543 sequence[j] = sequence[i];
544 sequence[i] = t;
545 }
546 }
547}
548
563static void gsc_set_names(gsc_AlleleMatrix* a,
564 const char* prefix,
565 const int suffix,
566 const GSC_LOCALX_T from_index) {
567 char sname[NAME_LENGTH];
568 char format[NAME_LENGTH];
569 if (prefix == NULL) {
570 // make it an empty string instead, so it is not displayed as (null)
571 prefix = "";
572 }
573 // use sname to save the number of digits to pad by:
574 sprintf(sname, "%%0%dd", gsc_get_integer_digits(a->n_genotypes - from_index)); // Creates: %0[n]d
575 sprintf(format, "%s%s", prefix, sname);
576
577 int livingsuffix = suffix;
578 ++livingsuffix;
579 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = from_index; i < a->n_genotypes; ++i) {
580 // clear name if it's pre-existing
581 if (a->names[i] != NULL) {
582 GSC_FREE(a->names[i]);
583 }
584
585 // save new name
586 sprintf(sname, format, livingsuffix);
587 a->names[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * (strlen(sname) + 1),GSC_TRUE);
588 strcpy(a->names[i], sname);
589
590 ++livingsuffix;
591 }
592}
593
605gsc_LabelID gsc_create_new_label(gsc_SimData* d, const int setTo) {
606 // Add new label default
607 if (d->n_labels == 0) {
608 d->label_ids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_LabelID) * 1,GSC_TRUE);
609 d->label_ids[0] = (gsc_LabelID){.id=1};
610
611 d->label_defaults = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * 1,GSC_TRUE);
612 d->label_defaults[0] = setTo;
613
614 } else if (d->n_labels > 0) {
615
616 gsc_LabelID* new_label_ids;
617 if (d->label_ids != NULL) {
618 new_label_ids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_LabelID) * (d->n_labels + 1),GSC_TRUE);
619 memcpy(new_label_ids,d->label_ids,sizeof(gsc_LabelID)*d->n_labels);
620 new_label_ids[d->n_labels] = gsc_get_new_label_id(d);
621 GSC_FREE(d->label_ids);
622
623 } else { // d->label_ids == NULL
624 // If the other labels do not have identifiers, they're corrupted and
625 // deserve to be destroyed.
626 new_label_ids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_LabelID) * 1,GSC_TRUE);
627 d->n_labels = 0;
628 new_label_ids[d->n_labels] = gsc_get_new_label_id(d);
629 }
630 d->label_ids = new_label_ids;
631
632 int* new_label_defaults = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * (d->n_labels + 1),GSC_TRUE);
633 if (d->label_defaults != NULL) {
634 for (GSC_ID_T i = 0; i < d->n_labels; ++i) {
635 new_label_defaults[i] = d->label_defaults[i];
636 }
637 GSC_FREE(d->label_defaults);
638 } else if (d->n_labels > 0) {
639 memset(new_label_defaults, 0, sizeof(int) * d->n_labels);
640 }
641 new_label_defaults[d->n_labels] = setTo;
642 d->label_defaults = new_label_defaults;
643
644 } else {
645 fprintf(stderr, "Labels malformed; gsc_SimData may be corrupted\n");
646 return (gsc_LabelID){.id=GSC_NA_ID};
647 }
648 d->n_labels += 1;
649
650 // Set all values of that label to the default
651 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
652 int warned = GSC_FALSE;
653 do {
654 // Do we need to destroy the extant label table? happens if label_ids were missing and we discarded them
655 if (m->n_labels != d->n_labels - 1 && m->labels != NULL) {
656 for (GSC_ID_T i = 0; i < m->n_labels; ++i) {
657 GSC_FREE(m->labels[i]);
658 }
659 GSC_FREE(m->labels);
660 m->labels = NULL;
661 }
662
663 m->n_labels = d->n_labels;
664
665 // Consider the case when we need to expand the label list
666 if (m->n_labels > 1 && m->labels != NULL) {
667 GSC_ID_T newLabel = m->n_labels - 1;
668
669 // Create label list
670 int** oldLabelList = m->labels;
671 m->labels = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int*) * m->n_labels,GSC_TRUE);
672 for (GSC_ID_T i = 0; i < m->n_labels - 1; ++i) {
673 m->labels[i] = oldLabelList[i];
674 }
675 m->labels[newLabel] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * CONTIG_WIDTH,GSC_TRUE);
676 GSC_FREE(oldLabelList);
677
678 // Set labels
679 if (setTo == 0) {
680 memset(m->labels[newLabel], 0, sizeof(int) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
681 } else {
682 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < CONTIG_WIDTH; ++i) {
683 m->labels[newLabel][i] = setTo;
684 }
685 }
686
687 // Consider the case we need to initialise the label list
688 } else if (m->n_labels == 1 && m->labels == NULL) {
689 // Create the label list
690 m->labels = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int*) * 1,GSC_TRUE);
691 m->labels[0] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * CONTIG_WIDTH,GSC_TRUE);
692
693 // Set labels
694 if (setTo == 0) {
695 memset(m->labels[0], 0, sizeof(int) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
696 } else {
697 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < CONTIG_WIDTH; ++i) {
698 m->labels[0][i] = setTo;
699 }
700 }
701
702 } else if (!warned) {
703 fprintf(stderr, "Unable to create new label for all genotypes; gsc_SimData may be corrupted\n");
704 warned = GSC_TRUE;
705 }
706
707 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
708 return d->label_ids[d->n_labels - 1];
709}
710
722void gsc_change_label_default(gsc_SimData* d,
723 const gsc_LabelID whichLabel,
724 const int newDefault) {
725 GSC_ID_T labelIndex;
726 if (whichLabel.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (labelIndex = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, whichLabel)) == GSC_NA_IDX) {
727 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %lu\n", (long unsigned int) whichLabel.id);
728 return;
729 }
730 d->label_defaults[labelIndex] = newDefault;
731}
732
748void gsc_change_label_to(gsc_SimData* d,
749 const gsc_GroupNum whichGroup,
750 const gsc_LabelID whichLabel,
751 const int setTo) {
752 GSC_ID_T labelIndex;
753 if (whichLabel.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (labelIndex = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, whichLabel)) == GSC_NA_IDX) {
754 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %lu\n", (long unsigned int) whichLabel.id);
755 return;
756 }
757 // Risks: if m->labels or m->labels[i] don't exist for labels where they should,
758 // will get some out of bounds accesses.
759
760 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
761 if (whichGroup.num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) { // set the labels of group members
762 do {
763
764 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
765 if (m->groups[i].num == whichGroup.num) {
766 m->labels[labelIndex][i] = setTo;
767 }
768 }
769
770 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
771
772 } else { // whichGroup == 0 so set the labels of all genotypes
773 do {
774
775 if (setTo == 0) {
776 memset(m->labels[labelIndex], 0, sizeof(int) * m->n_genotypes);
777 } else {
778 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
779 m->labels[labelIndex][i] = setTo;
780 }
781 }
782
783 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
784 }
785}
786
804void gsc_change_label_by_amount(gsc_SimData* d,
805 const gsc_GroupNum whichGroup,
806 const gsc_LabelID whichLabel,
807 const int byValue) {
808 GSC_ID_T labelIndex;
809 if (whichLabel.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (labelIndex = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, whichLabel)) == GSC_NA_IDX) {
810 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %lu\n", (long unsigned int) whichLabel.id);
811 return;
812 }
813 // Risks: if m->labels or m->labels[i] don't exist for labels where they should,
814 // will get some out of bounds accesses.
815
816 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
817 if (whichGroup.num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) { // set the labels of group members
818 do {
819
820 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
821 if (m->groups[i].num == whichGroup.num) {
822 m->labels[labelIndex][i] += byValue;
823 }
824 }
825
826 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
827
828 } else { // whichGroup == 0 so set the labels of all genotypes
829 do {
830
831 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
832 m->labels[labelIndex][i] += byValue;
833 }
834
835 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
836 }
837
838}
839
863void gsc_change_label_to_values(gsc_SimData* d,
864 const gsc_GroupNum whichGroup,
865 const GSC_GLOBALX_T startIndex,
866 const gsc_LabelID whichLabel,
867 const size_t n_values,
868 const int* values) {
869 GSC_ID_T labelIndex;
870 if (whichLabel.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (labelIndex = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, whichLabel)) == GSC_NA_IDX) {
871 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %lu\n", (long unsigned int) whichLabel.id);
872 return;
873 }
874
875 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
876 GSC_GLOBALX_T currentIndex = 0;
877 if (whichGroup.num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) { // set the labels of group members
878 // First scan through to find firstIndex
879 do {
880
881 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
882 if (m->groups[i].num == whichGroup.num) {
883 // Update label if it is between startIndex and startIndex + n_values
884 if (currentIndex >= startIndex) {
885 m->labels[labelIndex][i] = values[currentIndex - startIndex];
886 }
887 currentIndex++;
888 if (currentIndex > startIndex && currentIndex - startIndex >= n_values) {
889 return;
890 }
891 }
892 }
893
894 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
895
896 } else { // whichGroup == 0 so set the labels of all genotypes
897 do {
898
899 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
900 // Update label if it is between startIndex and startIndex + n_values
901 if (currentIndex >= startIndex) {
902 m->labels[labelIndex][i] = values[currentIndex - startIndex];
903 }
904 currentIndex++;
905 if (currentIndex > startIndex && currentIndex - startIndex >= n_values) {
906 return;
907 }
908 }
909
910 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
911 }
912}
913
941void gsc_change_names_to_values(gsc_SimData* d,
942 const gsc_GroupNum whichGroup,
943 const GSC_GLOBALX_T startIndex,
944 const size_t n_values,
945 const char** values) {
946 // this will be much improved once we can hash our names.
947
948 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
949 GSC_GLOBALX_T currentIndex = 0;
950 if (whichGroup.num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) { // set the names of group members
951 // First scan through to find firstIndex
952 do {
953
954 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
955 if (m->groups[i].num == whichGroup.num) {
956 // Update name if index is between startIndex and startIndex + n_values
957 if (currentIndex >= startIndex) {
958 // clear name if it's pre-existing
959 if (m->names[i] != NULL) {
960 GSC_FREE(m->names[i]);
961 }
962
963 // save new name
964 const GSC_GLOBALX_T whichName = currentIndex - startIndex;
965 m->names[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * (strlen(values[whichName]) + 1),GSC_TRUE);
966 strcpy(m->names[i], values[whichName]);
967 }
968 currentIndex++;
969 if (currentIndex > n_values) {
970 return;
971 }
972 }
973 }
974
975 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
976
977 } else { // whichGroup == 0 so set the names of all genotypes
978 do {
979
980 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
981 // Update name if it is between startIndex and startIndex + n_values
982 if (currentIndex >= startIndex) {
983 // clear name if it's pre-existing
984 if (m->names[i] != NULL) {
985 GSC_FREE(m->names[i]);
986 }
987
988 // save new name
989 const GSC_GLOBALX_T whichName = currentIndex - startIndex;
990 const int nameLen = strlen(values[whichName]);
991 m->names[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * (nameLen + 1),GSC_TRUE);
992 strncpy(m->names[i], values[whichName], nameLen);
993 }
994 currentIndex++;
995 if (currentIndex > n_values) {
996 return;
997 }
998 }
999
1000 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
1001 }
1002}
1003
1024void gsc_change_allele_symbol(gsc_SimData* d,
1025 const char* which_marker,
1026 const char from,
1027 const char to) {
1028 GSC_GENOLEN_T nmarkers = 0;
1029 GSC_GLOBALX_T ngenos = 0;
1030 unsigned int nalleles = 0;
1031
1032 GSC_GENOLEN_T markeri;
1033 if (which_marker == NULL) {
1034 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,NO_GROUP);
1035 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(&it);
1036
1037 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
1038 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T m = 0; m < d->genome.n_markers; ++m) {
1039 if (from == loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][m << 1]) {
1040 loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][m << 1] = to;
1041 ++nalleles;
1042 ++ngenos;
1043 }
1044 if (from == loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][(m << 1) + 1]) {
1045 loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][(m << 1) + 1] = to;
1046 ++nalleles;
1047 if (loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][m << 1] !=
1048 loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][(m << 1) + 1]) {
1049 ++ngenos;
1050 }
1051 }
1052 }
1053
1054 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
1055 }
1056
1057 gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
1058
1059
1060 } else if (gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(which_marker, d->genome, &markeri)) {
1061 nmarkers = 1;
1062 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,NO_GROUP);
1063 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(&it);
1064 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
1065 if (from == loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][markeri << 1]) {
1066 loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][markeri << 1] = to;
1067 ++nalleles;
1068 ++ngenos;
1069 }
1070 if (from == loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][(markeri << 1) + 1]) {
1071 loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][(markeri << 1) + 1] = to;
1072 ++nalleles;
1073 if (loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][markeri << 1] !=
1074 loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][(markeri << 1) + 1]) {
1075 ++ngenos;
1076 }
1077 }
1078
1079 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
1080 }
1081
1082 gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
1083
1084 } else {
1085 nmarkers = 0;
1086 ngenos = 0;
1087 }
1088
1089 printf("Changed allele %c to %c %lu times across %lu markers and %lu genotypes\n",
1090 from, to, (long unsigned int)nalleles, (long unsigned int)nmarkers, (long unsigned int)ngenos);
1091}
1092
1098int gsc_get_integer_digits(const int i) {
1099 int digits = 0, ii = i;
1100 while (ii != 0) {
1101 ii = ii / 10;
1102 digits ++;
1103 }
1104 return digits;
1105}
1106
1114static int gsc_helper_descending_pdouble_comparer(const void* pp0, const void* pp1) {
1115 double d0 = **(double **)pp0;
1116 double d1 = **(double **)pp1;
1117 if (d0 > d1) {
1118 return -1;
1119 } else {
1120 return (d0 < d1); // 0 if equal, 1 if d0 is smaller
1121 }
1122}
1123
1130static int gsc_helper_ascending_double_comparer(const void* pp0, const void* pp1) {
1131 double d0 = *(double *)pp0;
1132 double d1 = *(double *)pp1;
1133 if (d0 < d1) {
1134 return -1;
1135 } else {
1136 return (d0 > d1); // 0 if equal, 1 if d0 is smaller
1137 }
1138}
1139
1147static int gsc_helper_ascending_pdouble_comparer(const void* pp0, const void* pp1) {
1148 double d0 = **(double **)pp0;
1149 double d1 = **(double **)pp1;
1150 if (d0 < d1) {
1151 return -1;
1152 } else {
1153 return (d0 > d1); // 0 if equal, 1 if d0 is smaller
1154 }
1155}
1156
1160static int gsc_helper_indirect_alphabetical_str_comparer(const void* p0, const void* p1) {
1161 char* str1 = **(char***)p0;
1162 char* str2 = **(char***)p1;
1163 return strcmp(str1,str2);
1164}
1165
1169static int gsc_helper_mapfileunit_ascending_chr_comparer(const void* p0, const void* p1) {
1170 struct gsc_MapfileUnit s0 = *(struct gsc_MapfileUnit*)p0;
1171 struct gsc_MapfileUnit s1 = *(struct gsc_MapfileUnit*)p1;
1172 //return s0.ul - s1.ul;
1173 return (s0.chr < s1.chr) ? -1 : (s0.chr > s1.chr);
1174}
1175
1179static int gsc_helper_mapfileunit_ascending_d_comparer(const void* p0, const void* p1) {
1180 struct gsc_MapfileUnit s0 = *(struct gsc_MapfileUnit*)p0;
1181 struct gsc_MapfileUnit s1 = *(struct gsc_MapfileUnit*)p1;
1182 return (s0.pos < s1.pos) ? -1 : (s0.pos > s1.pos);
1183}
1184
1200void gsc_move_genotype(gsc_GenoLocation from,
1201 gsc_GenoLocation to,
1202 int* label_defaults) {
1203 if (to.localAM == from.localAM && to.localPos == from.localPos) {
1204 return;
1205 }
1206 if (to.localAM->groups[to.localPos].num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1207 fprintf(stderr,"In moving a genotype from %p:%lu to %p:%lu, the genotype at %p:%lu will be overwritten\n",
1208 from.localAM, (long unsigned int)from.localPos, to.localAM, (long unsigned int)to.localPos,
1209 to.localAM, (long unsigned int)to.localPos);
1210 --to.localAM->n_genotypes;
1211 }
1212 to.localAM->alleles[to.localPos] = from.localAM->alleles[from.localPos];
1213 from.localAM->alleles[from.localPos] = NULL;
1214
1215 to.localAM->names[to.localPos] = from.localAM->names[from.localPos];
1216 from.localAM->names[from.localPos] = NULL;
1217
1218 to.localAM->ids[to.localPos] = from.localAM->ids[from.localPos];
1219 from.localAM->ids[from.localPos] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
1220
1221 to.localAM->pedigrees[0][to.localPos] = from.localAM->pedigrees[0][from.localPos];
1222 from.localAM->pedigrees[0][from.localPos] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
1223 to.localAM->pedigrees[1][to.localPos] = from.localAM->pedigrees[1][from.localPos];
1224 from.localAM->pedigrees[1][from.localPos] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
1225
1226 to.localAM->groups[to.localPos] = from.localAM->groups[from.localPos];
1227 from.localAM->groups[from.localPos] = GSC_NO_GROUP;
1228
1229 if (to.localAM->n_labels != from.localAM->n_labels) {
1230 fprintf(stderr,"Origin and destination when copying genotype do not have the same number of custom"
1231 " labels (n_labels). The genotype now at %p:%lu will have lost its label data\n",
1232 to.localAM, (long unsigned int)to.localPos);
1233 } else if (to.localAM->n_labels != 0 && label_defaults == NULL) {
1234 fprintf(stderr,"Label defaults must be supplied to gsc_move_genotypes or there is risk of "
1235 "corrupted label values in further use of the simulation");
1236 } else {
1237 for (GSC_ID_T i = 0; i < to.localAM->n_labels; ++i) {
1238 to.localAM->labels[i][to.localPos] = from.localAM->labels[i][from.localPos];
1239 from.localAM->labels[i][from.localPos] = label_defaults[i];
1240 }
1241 }
1242
1243 if (from.localAM != to.localAM) {
1244 --from.localAM->n_genotypes;
1245 ++to.localAM->n_genotypes;
1246 }
1247}
1248
1254static gsc_GenoLocation gsc_nextgappy_valid_pos(struct gsc_GappyIterator* it) {
1255 if (it->cursor.localAM == NULL) {
1256 it->cursor = GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1257 } else if (it->cursor.localPos >= CONTIG_WIDTH) {
1258 it->cursor.localPos = 0;
1259 it->cursor.localAM = it->cursor.localAM->next;
1260 ++it->cursorAMIndex;
1261 if (it->cursor.localAM == NULL) {
1262 it->cursor = GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1263 }
1264 }
1265 return it->cursor;
1266}
1267
1274static gsc_GenoLocation gsc_nextgappy_get_gap(struct gsc_GappyIterator* it) {
1275 if (!GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(gsc_nextgappy_valid_pos(it))) {
1276 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1277 }
1278
1279 while (it->cursor.localAM->groups[it->cursor.localPos].num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1280
1281 // Trusts that n_genotypes is correct.
1282 if (it->cursor.localAM->n_genotypes == CONTIG_WIDTH) { // work-saver: skip this gsc_AlleleMatrix if it is already known to be full.
1283 it->cursor.localAM = it->cursor.localAM->next;
1284 ++it->cursorAMIndex;
1285 } else {
1286 ++it->cursor.localPos;
1287 }
1288
1289 if (!GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(gsc_nextgappy_valid_pos(it))) {
1290 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1291 }
1292 }
1293
1294 return it->cursor;
1295}
1296
1303static gsc_GenoLocation gsc_nextgappy_get_nongap(struct gsc_GappyIterator* it) {
1304 if (!GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(gsc_nextgappy_valid_pos(it))) {
1305 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1306 }
1307
1308 while (it->cursor.localAM->groups[it->cursor.localPos].num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1309 ++it->cursor.localPos;
1310 if (!GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(gsc_nextgappy_valid_pos(it))) {
1311 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1312 }
1313 }
1314
1315 return it->cursor;
1316}
1317
1318
1343void gsc_condense_allele_matrix(gsc_SimData* d) {
1344 // Find the first gap
1345 struct gsc_GappyIterator filler = {.cursor=(gsc_GenoLocation){.localAM=d->m, .localPos=0},
1346 .cursorAMIndex=0};
1347 gsc_nextgappy_get_gap(&filler);
1348
1349 if (!GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(filler.cursor)) {
1350 return; // no gaps found
1351 }
1352
1353 struct gsc_GappyIterator checker = filler; // copy filler
1354 ++checker.cursor.localPos;
1355 gsc_nextgappy_get_nongap(&checker);
1356
1357 // Shuffle all candidates back
1358 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(filler.cursor) && GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(checker.cursor)) {
1359 gsc_move_genotype(checker.cursor, filler.cursor, d->label_defaults);
1360
1361 ++filler.cursor.localPos;
1362 gsc_nextgappy_get_gap(&filler);
1363
1364 ++checker.cursor.localPos;
1365 gsc_nextgappy_get_nongap(&checker);
1366 }
1367
1368 // Then, free any other pre-allocated space
1369 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(filler.cursor)) {
1370 if (filler.cursor.localAM->n_genotypes == 0) {
1371 // no genotypes after this point
1372 AlleleMatrix* previous = gsc_get_nth_AlleleMatrix(d->m, filler.cursorAMIndex - 1);
1373 if (previous != NULL) {
1374 previous->next = NULL;
1375 gsc_delete_allele_matrix(filler.cursor.localAM);
1376 }
1377 filler.cursor.localAM = NULL;
1378
1379 } else {
1380 // If this gap has allocated space, clear it.
1381 if (gsc_get_alleles(filler.cursor) != NULL) {
1382 GSC_FREE(gsc_get_alleles(filler.cursor));
1383 filler.cursor.localAM->alleles[filler.cursor.localPos] = NULL;
1384 }
1385 if (gsc_get_name(filler.cursor) != NULL) {
1386 GSC_FREE(gsc_get_name(filler.cursor));
1387 filler.cursor.localAM->names[filler.cursor.localPos] = NULL;
1388 }
1389 filler.cursor.localAM->ids[filler.cursor.localPos] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
1390 filler.cursor.localAM->pedigrees[0][filler.cursor.localPos] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
1391 filler.cursor.localAM->pedigrees[1][filler.cursor.localPos] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
1392 filler.cursor.localAM->groups[filler.cursor.localPos] = GSC_NO_GROUP;
1393
1394 ++filler.cursor.localPos;
1395 gsc_nextgappy_get_gap(&filler);
1396 }
1397 }
1398}
1399
1400
1401
1402/*----------------------------------Locators---------------------------------*/
1403
1404
1427gsc_BidirectionalIterator gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(gsc_SimData* d,
1428 const gsc_GroupNum group) {
1429 return gsc_create_bidirectional_iter_fromAM(d->m, group);
1430}
1431
1432gsc_BidirectionalIterator gsc_create_bidirectional_iter_fromAM(gsc_AlleleMatrix* am,
1433 const gsc_GroupNum group) {
1434 return (gsc_BidirectionalIterator) {
1435 .am = am,
1436 .group = group,
1437 .localPos = GSC_NA_LOCALX,
1438
1439 .cachedAM = am,
1440 .cachedAMIndex = 0,
1441
1442 .atStart = 0,
1443 .atEnd = 0
1444 };
1445}
1446
1474gsc_RandomAccessIterator gsc_create_randomaccess_iter( gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group) {
1475 GSC_LOCALX_T first = 0;
1476 gsc_AlleleMatrix* firstAM = d->m;
1477 _Bool anyExist = 1;
1478
1479 // Want to know:
1480 // - is this group empty? (randomAccess should know if group size is 0)
1481 // - what is the first genotype index in this group?
1482
1483 if (group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) { // scanning all genotypes
1484 while (firstAM->n_genotypes == 0) {
1485 if (firstAM->next == NULL) {
1486 // gsc_SimData is empty. Nowhere to go.
1487 anyExist = 0;
1488 } else { // Keep moving forwards through the list. Not polite enough to clean up the blank AM.
1489 firstAM = firstAM->next;
1490 }
1491 }
1492
1493 } else { // scanning a specific group
1494 _Bool exitNow = 0;
1495 while (!exitNow) {
1496
1497 // Set first, firstAM, firstAMIndex if appropriate
1498 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < firstAM->n_genotypes; ++i) {
1499 if (firstAM->groups[i].num == group.num) {
1500 first = i;
1501 exitNow = 1;
1502 break;
1503 }
1504 }
1505
1506 // Move along and set anyExist if appropriate
1507 if (!exitNow) {
1508 firstAM = firstAM->next;
1509 if (firstAM == NULL) {
1510 anyExist = 0;
1511 exitNow = 1;
1512 }
1513 }
1514 }
1515 }
1516
1517 gsc_GenoLocation* cache = NULL;
1518 GSC_GLOBALX_T cacheSize = 0;
1519 if (anyExist) {
1520 cacheSize = 50;
1521 cache = gsc_malloc_wrap((sizeof(gsc_GenoLocation)*cacheSize),GSC_TRUE);
1522 cache[0] = (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1523 .localAM= firstAM,
1524 .localPos = first,
1525 };
1526 for (GSC_GLOBALX_T i = 1; i < cacheSize; ++i) {
1527 cache[i] = GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1528 }
1529
1530 }
1531
1532 return (gsc_RandomAccessIterator) {
1533 .d = d,
1534 .group = group,
1535
1536 .largestCached = anyExist ? 0 : GSC_NA_GLOBALX,
1537 .groupSize = anyExist ? GSC_NA_GLOBALX : 0, // NA represents unknown, 0 represents empty
1538 .cacheSize = cacheSize,
1539 .cache = cache
1540 };
1541}
1542
1552gsc_AlleleMatrix* gsc_get_nth_AlleleMatrix(gsc_AlleleMatrix* listStart, const unsigned int n) {
1553 unsigned int currentIndex = 0;
1554 gsc_AlleleMatrix* am = listStart;
1555 while (currentIndex < n) {
1556 if (am->next == NULL) {
1557 return NULL;
1558 } else {
1559 am = am->next;
1560 currentIndex++;
1561 }
1562 }
1563 return am;
1564}
1565
1576gsc_GenoLocation gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(gsc_BidirectionalIterator* it) {
1577 GSC_LOCALX_T first = 0;
1578 gsc_AlleleMatrix* firstAM = it->am;
1579 unsigned int firstAMIndex = 0;
1580 _Bool anyExist = 1;
1581
1582 // Want to know:
1583 // - is this group empty? (iterator should know if it is at the end as well as at the start)
1584 // - what is the first genotype index in this group?
1585
1586 if (it->group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1587 while (firstAM->n_genotypes == 0) {
1588 if (firstAM->next == NULL) {
1589 anyExist = 0; // gsc_SimData is empty.
1590
1591 } else { // (Not polite enough to clean up the blank AM.)
1592 firstAM = firstAM->next;
1593 firstAMIndex++;
1594 // first += 0;
1595 }
1596 }
1597
1598 // After this runs we have set firstAM, first, firstAMIndex, anyExist appropriately
1599
1600 } else { // scanning a specific group
1601
1602 _Bool exitNow = 0;
1603 while (!exitNow) {
1604
1605 // Set first, firstAM, firstAMIndex if appropriate
1606 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < firstAM->n_genotypes; ++i) {
1607 if (firstAM->groups[i].num == it->group.num) {
1608 first = i;
1609 exitNow = 1;
1610 break;
1611 }
1612 }
1613
1614 // Move along and set anyExist if appropriate
1615 if (!exitNow) {
1616 firstAM = firstAM->next;
1617 firstAMIndex++;
1618 if (firstAM == NULL) {
1619 first = GSC_NA_LOCALX;
1620 anyExist = 0;
1621 exitNow = 1;
1622 }
1623 }
1624 }
1625 }
1626
1627 it->localPos = first;
1628 if (anyExist) {
1629 it->atStart = 1;
1630 it->atEnd = 0;
1631 } else { // fail immediately on all further accesses. The group is empty.
1632 it->atStart = 1;
1633 it->atEnd = 1;
1634 }
1635 it->cachedAM = firstAM;
1636 it->cachedAMIndex = firstAMIndex;
1637
1638 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1639 .localAM = firstAM,
1640 .localPos = first
1641 };
1642}
1643
1654gsc_GenoLocation gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_end(gsc_BidirectionalIterator* it) {
1655 GSC_LOCALX_T last = 0;
1656 gsc_AlleleMatrix* lastAM = it->am;
1657 unsigned int lastAMIndex = 0;
1658 _Bool anyExist = 1;
1659
1660 // Want to know:
1661 // - is this group empty? (iterator should know if it is at the end as well as at the start)
1662 // - what is the first genotype index in this group?
1663
1664 if (it->group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1665 while (lastAM->next != NULL && lastAM->next->n_genotypes != 0) {
1666 lastAM = lastAM->next;
1667 lastAMIndex++;
1668 }
1669 if (lastAMIndex > 0 || lastAM->n_genotypes > 0) {
1670 last = lastAM->n_genotypes - 1;
1671 } else {
1672 anyExist = 0;
1673 }
1674
1675 } else { // scanning a specific group
1676
1677 // Find last AM
1678 while (lastAM->next != NULL && lastAM->next->n_genotypes != 0) {
1679 lastAM = lastAM->next;
1680 lastAMIndex++;
1681 }
1682
1683 _Bool exitNow = 0;
1684 while (!exitNow) {
1685
1686 // Set first, firstAM, firstAMIndex if appropriate
1687 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = lastAM->n_genotypes - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
1688 if (lastAM->groups[i].num == it->group.num) {
1689 last = i;
1690 exitNow = 1;
1691 break;
1692 }
1693 }
1694
1695 // Move along and set anyExist if appropriate
1696 if (!exitNow) {
1697 --lastAMIndex;
1698 lastAM = gsc_get_nth_AlleleMatrix(it->am, lastAMIndex);
1699 if (lastAM->n_genotypes == 0) {
1700 last = GSC_NA_LOCALX;
1701 anyExist = 0;
1702 exitNow = 1;
1703 }
1704 }
1705 }
1706 }
1707
1708 it->localPos = last;
1709 if (anyExist) {
1710 it->atStart = 0;
1711 it->atEnd = 1;
1712 } else { // group is empty: fail immediately on any further accesses
1713 it->atStart = 1;
1714 it->atEnd = 1;
1715 }
1716 it->cachedAM = lastAM;
1717 it->cachedAMIndex = lastAMIndex;
1718
1719 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1720 .localAM = lastAM,
1721 .localPos = last
1722 };
1723}
1724
1725
1745gsc_GenoLocation gsc_next_forwards(gsc_BidirectionalIterator* it) {
1746 if (it->localPos == GSC_NA_LOCALX) {
1747 return gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(it);
1748 }
1749
1750 if (it->atEnd) { // || validate_bidirectional_cache(it) == GSC_FALSE) { // can't use this because what if our iterator user is modifying group allocations?
1751 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1752 }
1753
1754 if (it->group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1755
1756 // Search for the next value.
1757 if (it->localPos + 1 < it->cachedAM->n_genotypes) {
1758 // The next value is in the same gsc_AlleleMatrix
1759 it->localPos++;
1760 it->atStart = 0;
1761 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1762 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1763 .localPos = it->localPos
1764 };
1765
1766 } else {
1767 // The next value is in the next gsc_AlleleMatrix
1768 gsc_AlleleMatrix* nextAM = it->cachedAM;
1769 int nextAMIndex = it->cachedAMIndex;
1770 do {
1771 nextAM = nextAM->next;
1772 nextAMIndex++;
1773 } while (nextAM != NULL && nextAM->n_genotypes == 0);
1774
1775 if (nextAM == NULL) {
1776 // There is no further gsc_AlleleMatrix; we are at the end of the iterator.
1777 it->atEnd = 1;
1778 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1779 } else {
1780 it->cachedAM = nextAM;
1781 it->cachedAMIndex = nextAMIndex;
1782 it->localPos = 0;
1783 it->atStart = 0;
1784 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1785 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1786 .localPos = 0
1787 };
1788 }
1789 }
1790
1791 } else { // We are iterating through a specific group
1792
1793 // Search for the next value
1794 while(1) {
1795 if (it->localPos + 1 < it->cachedAM->n_genotypes) {
1796 for (++it->localPos; it->localPos < it->cachedAM->n_genotypes; ++it->localPos) {
1797 if (it->cachedAM->groups[it->localPos].num == it->group.num) {
1798 it->atStart = 0;
1799 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1800 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1801 .localPos = it->localPos
1802 };
1803 }
1804 }
1805 }
1806
1807 gsc_AlleleMatrix* nextAM = it->cachedAM;
1808 int nextAMIndex = it->cachedAMIndex;
1809 do {
1810 nextAM = nextAM->next;
1811 nextAMIndex++;
1812 } while (nextAM != NULL && nextAM->n_genotypes == 0);
1813
1814 if (nextAM == NULL) {
1815 // There is no further gsc_AlleleMatrix; we are at the end of the iterator.
1816 it->atEnd = 1;
1817 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1818 } else {
1819 it->cachedAM = nextAM;
1820 it->cachedAMIndex = nextAMIndex;
1821 it->localPos = 0;
1822 if (it->cachedAM->groups[it->localPos].num == it->group.num) {
1823 it->atStart = 0;
1824 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1825 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1826 .localPos = it->localPos
1827 };
1828 }
1829 }
1830 }
1831
1832 }
1833}
1834
1835
1859gsc_GenoLocation gsc_next_backwards(gsc_BidirectionalIterator* it) {
1860 if (it->localPos == GSC_NA_LOCALX) {
1861 return gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_end(it);
1862 }
1863
1864 if (it->atStart) { //|| validate_bidirectional_cache(it) == GSC_FALSE) {
1865 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1866 }
1867
1868 if (it->group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1869
1870 // Search for the previous value.
1871 if (it->localPos > 0) {
1872 // The previous value is in the same gsc_AlleleMatrix
1873 it->localPos--;
1874 it->atEnd = 0;
1875 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1876 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1877 .localPos = it->localPos
1878 };
1879
1880 } else {
1881 // The previous value is in the previous gsc_AlleleMatrix
1882 if (it->cachedAMIndex == 0) {
1883 it->atStart = 1;
1884 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1885 } else {
1886 gsc_AlleleMatrix* nextAM = it->cachedAM;
1887 int nextAMIndex = it->cachedAMIndex;
1888 do {
1889 nextAMIndex--;
1890 nextAM = gsc_get_nth_AlleleMatrix(it->am, nextAMIndex);
1891 } while (nextAM != NULL && nextAM->n_genotypes == 0);
1892
1893 if (nextAM == NULL) {
1894 it->atStart = 1;
1895 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1896 } else {
1897 it->cachedAM = nextAM;
1898 it->cachedAMIndex = nextAMIndex;
1899 it->localPos = it->cachedAM->n_genotypes - 1;
1900 it->atEnd = 0;
1901 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1902 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1903 .localPos = it->localPos
1904 };
1905 }
1906 }
1907 }
1908
1909 } else { // We are iterating through a specific group
1910
1911 // Search for the next value
1912 while(1) {
1913 if (it->localPos > 0) {
1914 for (--it->localPos; it->localPos >= 0; --it->localPos) {
1915 if (it->cachedAM->groups[it->localPos].num == it->group.num) {
1916 it->atEnd = 0;
1917 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1918 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1919 .localPos = it->localPos
1920 };
1921 }
1922 }
1923 }
1924
1925 if (it->cachedAMIndex == 0) {
1926 it->atStart = 1;
1927 it->localPos = 0;
1928 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1929 } else {
1930 gsc_AlleleMatrix* nextAM = it->cachedAM;
1931 int nextAMIndex = it->cachedAMIndex;
1932 do {
1933 nextAMIndex--;
1934 nextAM = gsc_get_nth_AlleleMatrix(it->am, nextAMIndex);
1935 } while (nextAM != NULL && nextAM->n_genotypes == 0);
1936
1937 if (nextAM == NULL) {
1938 it->atStart = 1;
1939 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1940 } else {
1941 it->cachedAM = nextAM;
1942 it->cachedAMIndex = nextAMIndex;
1943 it->localPos = it->cachedAM->n_genotypes - 1;
1944 if (it->cachedAM->groups[it->localPos].num == it->group.num) {
1945 it->atEnd = 0;
1946 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1947 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1948 .localPos = it->localPos
1949 };
1950 }
1951 }
1952 }
1953 }
1954 }
1955}
1956
1957
1980gsc_GenoLocation gsc_next_get_nth(gsc_RandomAccessIterator* it, const GSC_GLOBALX_T n) {
1981 // Step 0: First check n is in our group index range as far as we know it
1982 // (If it->groupSize is 0 then the group is empty)
1983 if (it->groupSize == 0 ||
1984 (it->groupSize != GSC_NA_GLOBALX && it->groupSize <= n)) {
1985 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1986 }
1987
1988 // Step 1: Check if we have it in the cache.
1989 if (n < it->cacheSize) {
1990 // 'n' is less than or equal to our current furthest cached group member.
1991
1992 if (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(it->cache[n])) {
1993 return it->cache[n];
1994 }
1995
1996 // Otherwise we do not have it cached, but we will enter it into the cache in the next section
1997
1998 } else {
1999 // We need to expand the cache to fit it.
2000 GSC_GLOBALX_T newCacheSize = it->cacheSize;
2001 if (it->cacheSize == 0) {
2002 newCacheSize = 50;
2003 }
2004 while (newCacheSize < n+1) {
2005 newCacheSize = newCacheSize << 1;
2006 }
2007 gsc_GenoLocation* newCache = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_GenoLocation)*newCacheSize,GSC_TRUE);
2008 GSC_GLOBALX_T i = 0;
2009 for (; i < it->cacheSize; ++i) {
2010 newCache[i] = it->cache[i];
2011 }
2012 for (; i < newCacheSize; ++i) {
2013 newCache[i] = GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
2014 }
2015 GSC_FREE(it->cache);
2016 it->cacheSize = newCacheSize;
2017 it->cache = newCache;
2018 }
2019
2020 // Validity checks for a random access iterator: largestCached must exist,
2021 // is indeed cached and belongs to the same group
2022 if (it->largestCached == GSC_NA_GLOBALX ||
2023 (!GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(it->cache[it->largestCached]) &&
2024 (it->group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num ||
2025 it->group.num != gsc_get_group(it->cache[it->largestCached]).num))) {
2026 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
2027 }
2028
2029 // Step 2: Actually finding the nth group member.
2030 if (it->group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
2031 // Assuming all non-end gsc_AlleleMatrix are filled to CONTIG_WIDTH
2032 gsc_GenoLocation expectedLocation = {
2033 .localAM = gsc_get_nth_AlleleMatrix(it->d->m, n / CONTIG_WIDTH),
2034 .localPos = n % CONTIG_WIDTH
2035 };
2036 // Check n was not too large
2037 if (expectedLocation.localAM == NULL ||
2038 expectedLocation.localAM->n_genotypes <= expectedLocation.localPos) {
2039 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
2040 }
2041 return expectedLocation;
2042
2043 } else { // searching for a particular group
2044
2045 gsc_AlleleMatrix* currentAM;
2046 GSC_GLOBALX_T groupN;
2047 GSC_LOCALX_T localPos;
2048 if (it->largestCached < n) {
2049 // Search forwards from largestCached
2050 currentAM = it->cache[it->largestCached].localAM;
2051 groupN = it->largestCached;
2052 localPos = it->cache[it->largestCached].localPos + 1;
2053 while (1) {
2054 for (; localPos < currentAM->n_genotypes; ++localPos) {
2055 // If we found a group member, cache it and count upwards towards n
2056 if (currentAM->groups[localPos].num == it->group.num) {
2057 it->largestCached = ++groupN;
2058 it->cache[groupN] = (gsc_GenoLocation) {
2059 .localAM = currentAM,
2060 .localPos = localPos
2061 };
2062 if (groupN == n) {
2063 return it->cache[n];
2064 }
2065 }
2066 }
2067
2068 if (currentAM->next == NULL || currentAM->next->n_genotypes == 0) {
2069 // We are at the end of the iterator and have not found n
2070 it->groupSize = groupN + 1;
2071 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
2072 } else {
2073 currentAM = currentAM->next;
2074 localPos = 0;
2075 }
2076
2077 }
2078
2079 } else {
2080 // With current method of filling cache, this branch will never be taken
2081
2082 // Search backwards from largestCached for one gsc_AlleleMatrix, to take advantage of that pointer
2083 if (it->cache[it->largestCached].localAM != it->d->m) {
2084 currentAM = it->cache[it->largestCached].localAM;
2085 groupN = it->largestCached;
2086 localPos = it->cache[it->largestCached].localPos;
2087 for (; localPos >= 0; --localPos) {
2088 // If we found a group member, cache it and count down towards n
2089 if (currentAM->groups[localPos].num == it->group.num) {
2090 --groupN;
2091 it->cache[groupN] = (gsc_GenoLocation) {
2092 .localAM = currentAM,
2093 .localPos = localPos
2094 };
2095 if (groupN == n) {
2096 return it->cache[n];
2097 }
2098 }
2099 }
2100 }
2101
2102 // Then search forwards from start
2103 currentAM = it->d->m;
2104 localPos = 0;
2105 groupN = -1; // overwrite everything
2106 while (currentAM != it->cache[it->largestCached].localAM) {
2107 for (; localPos < currentAM->n_genotypes; ++localPos) {
2108 // If we found a group member, cache it and count upwards towards n
2109 if (currentAM->groups[localPos].num == it->group.num) {
2110 ++groupN;
2111 it->cache[groupN] = (gsc_GenoLocation) {
2112 .localAM = currentAM,
2113 .localPos = localPos
2114 };
2115 if (groupN == n) {
2116 return it->cache[n];
2117 }
2118 }
2119 }
2120
2121 if (currentAM->next == NULL || currentAM->next->n_genotypes == 0) {
2122 // We are at the end of the iterator and have not found n. Also we didn't reach
2123 // 'largestCached' yet. Something is wrong with the iterator
2124 it->groupSize = groupN + 1;
2125 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
2126 } else {
2127 currentAM = currentAM->next;
2128 localPos = 0;
2129 }
2130 }
2131
2132 // We were somehow unable to find the nth group member. Something is probably wrong
2133 // with the iterator
2134 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
2135
2136 }
2137 }
2138}
2139
2160char* gsc_get_name_of_id(const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start, const gsc_PedigreeID id) {
2161 if (id.id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
2162 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid ID %lu\n", (long unsigned int)id.id);
2163 return NULL;
2164 }
2165 if (start == NULL) {
2166 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid nonexistent allelematrix\n"); exit(1);
2167 }
2168 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = start;
2169
2170 while (1) {
2171 // try to find our id. Does this AM potentially have the right range for it?
2172 // If we're not sure, because either of the endpoints does not have its ID tracked,
2173 // check anyway
2174 if (m->n_genotypes != 0 && (id.id >= m->ids[0].id || m->ids[0].id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) &&
2175 (id.id <= m->ids[m->n_genotypes - 1].id || m->ids[m->n_genotypes - 1].id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id)) {
2176
2177 GSC_LOCALX_T index = gsc_get_from_ordered_pedigree_list(id, m->n_genotypes, m->ids);
2178
2179 if (index > m->n_genotypes) {
2180 // search failed
2181 if (m->next == NULL) {
2182 fprintf(stderr, "Could not find the ID %lu: did you prematurely delete this genotype?\n", (long unsigned int)id.id);
2183 return NULL;
2184 } else {
2185 m = m->next;
2186 continue;
2187 }
2188 }
2189
2190 return m->names[index];
2191
2192 }
2193
2194 if (m->next == NULL) {
2195 fprintf(stderr, "Could not find the ID %lu: did you prematurely delete this genotype?\n", (long unsigned int)id.id);
2196 return NULL;
2197 } else {
2198 m = m->next;
2199 }
2200 }
2201}
2202
2226int gsc_get_parents_of_id(const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start,
2227 const gsc_PedigreeID id,
2228 gsc_PedigreeID output[static 2]) {
2229 if (id.id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
2230 return 1;
2231 }
2232 if (start == NULL) {
2233 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid nonexistent allelematrix\n"); exit(1);
2234 }
2235 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = start;
2236 while (1) {
2237 // try to find our id. Does this AM have the right range for it?
2238 if (m->n_genotypes != 0 && id.id >= m->ids[0].id && id.id <= m->ids[m->n_genotypes - 1].id) {
2239 // perform binary search to find the exact index.
2240 GSC_LOCALX_T index = gsc_get_from_ordered_pedigree_list(id, m->n_genotypes, m->ids);
2241
2242 if (index == GSC_NA_LOCALX) {
2243 // search failed
2244 /*if (m->next == NULL) {
2245 fprintf(stderr, "Unable to locate ID %d in simulation memory (genotype has likely been deleted): pedigree past this point cannot be determined\n", id.id);
2246 return 2;
2247 } else {
2248 m = m->next;
2249 }*/
2250 continue;
2251 } else {
2252
2253 if (m->pedigrees[0][index].id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id || m->pedigrees[1][index].id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
2254 output[0] = m->pedigrees[0][index];
2255 output[1] = m->pedigrees[1][index];
2256 return 0;
2257 }
2258 return 1; // if neither parent's id is known
2259 }
2260
2261 }
2262
2263 if (m->next == NULL) {
2264 fprintf(stderr, "Unable to locate ID %lu in simulation memory (genotype has likely been deleted): pedigree past this point cannot be determined\n", (long unsigned int)id.id);
2265 return 2;
2266 } else {
2267 m = m->next;
2268 }
2269 }
2270}
2271
2287void gsc_get_ids_of_names(const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start,
2288 const size_t n_names,
2289 const char** names,
2290 gsc_PedigreeID* output) {
2291 if (start == NULL || (start->n_genotypes <= 0 && start->next == NULL)) {
2292 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid start parameter: gsc_AlleleMatrix* `start` must exist\n");
2293 return;
2294 }
2295 if (n_names < 1) {
2296 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid n_names parameter: Search list length must be positive\n");
2297 return;
2298 }
2299
2300 _Bool found;
2301 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m;
2302
2303 for (size_t i = 0; i < n_names; ++i) {
2304 found = 0;
2305 output[i] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
2306 m = start;
2307 while (1) {
2308 // try to identify the name in this AM
2309 for (GSC_LOCALX_T j = 0; j < m->n_genotypes; ++j) {
2310 if (strcmp(m->names[j], names[i]) == 0) {
2311 found = 1;
2312 output[i] = m->ids[j];
2313 break;
2314 }
2315 }
2316
2317 if (found) {
2318 break;
2319 }
2320 if ((m = m->next) == NULL) {
2321 fprintf(stderr, "Didn't find the name %s\n", names[i]);
2322 }
2323 }
2324 }
2325}
2326
2341GSC_GLOBALX_T gsc_get_index_of_child(const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start,
2342 const gsc_PedigreeID parent1id,
2343 const gsc_PedigreeID parent2id) {
2344 if (start == NULL || (start->n_genotypes <= 0 && start->next == NULL)) {
2345 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid start parameter: gsc_AlleleMatrix* `start` must exist\n");
2346 return GSC_NA_GLOBALX;
2347 }
2348 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = start;
2349 GSC_GLOBALX_T total_j = 0;
2350
2351 while (1) {
2352 // try to identify the child in this AM
2353 for (GSC_LOCALX_T j = 0; j < m->n_genotypes; ++j, ++total_j) {
2354 if ((parent1id.id == m->pedigrees[0][j].id && parent2id.id == m->pedigrees[1][j].id) ||
2355 (parent1id.id == m->pedigrees[1][j].id && parent2id.id == m->pedigrees[0][j].id)) {
2356 return total_j;
2357 }
2358 }
2359
2360 if ((m = m->next) == NULL) {
2361 fprintf(stderr, "Didn't find the child of %lu & %lu\n",
2362 (long unsigned int)parent1id.id, (long unsigned int)parent2id.id);
2363 return GSC_NA_GLOBALX;
2364 }
2365 }
2366}
2367
2381GSC_GLOBALX_T gsc_get_index_of_name(const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start, const char* name) {
2382 if (name == NULL) {
2383 return GSC_NA_GLOBALX;
2384 }
2385 if (start == NULL || (start->n_genotypes <= 0 && start->next == NULL)) {
2386 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid start parameter: gsc_AlleleMatrix* `start` must exist\n");
2387 return GSC_NA_GLOBALX;
2388 }
2389 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = start;
2390 GSC_GLOBALX_T total_j = 0;
2391
2392 while (1) {
2393 // try to identify the child in this AM
2394 for (GSC_LOCALX_T j = 0; j < m->n_genotypes; ++j, ++total_j) {
2395 if (m->names[j] != NULL && strcmp(m->names[j], name) == 0) {
2396 return total_j;
2397 }
2398 }
2399
2400 if ((m = m->next) == NULL) {
2401 fprintf(stderr, "Didn't find the name %s\n", name);
2402 return GSC_NA_GLOBALX;
2403 }
2404 }
2405}
2406
2418gsc_PedigreeID gsc_get_id_of_index(const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start,
2419 const GSC_GLOBALX_T index) {
2420 if (start == NULL) {
2421 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid start parameter: gsc_AlleleMatrix* `start` must exist\n");
2422 return GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
2423 }
2424 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = start;
2425 GSC_GLOBALX_T total_j = 0;
2426
2427 while (1) {
2428 if (total_j == index) {
2429 return m->ids[0];
2430 } else if (total_j < index && total_j + m->n_genotypes > index) {
2431 return m->ids[index - total_j];
2432 }
2433 total_j += m->n_genotypes;
2434
2435 if ((m = m->next) == NULL) {
2436 fprintf(stderr, "Didn't find the index %lu\n", (long unsigned int) index);
2437 return GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
2438 }
2439 }
2440}
2441
2457char* gsc_get_genes_of_index(const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start,
2458 const GSC_GLOBALX_T index) {
2459 if (start == NULL) {
2460 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid nonexistent allelematrix\n");
2461 return NULL;
2462 }
2463 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = start;
2464 GSC_GLOBALX_T total_j = 0;
2465
2466 while (1) {
2467 if (total_j == index) {
2468 return m->alleles[0];
2469 } else if (total_j < index && total_j + m->n_genotypes > index) {
2470 return m->alleles[index - total_j];
2471 }
2472 total_j += m->n_genotypes;
2473
2474 if ((m = m->next) == NULL) {
2475 fprintf(stderr, "Didn't find the index %lu\n", (long unsigned int) index);
2476 return NULL;
2477 }
2478 }
2479}
2480
2481
2482
2483/*-----------------------------------Groups----------------------------------*/
2484
2498gsc_GroupNum gsc_combine_groups(gsc_SimData* d,
2499 const size_t list_len,
2500 const gsc_GroupNum* grouplist) {
2501
2502 // Find the first group in the list that exists. In most use cases this will be the
2503 // first group in the list, so not too much of a performance penalty.
2504 gsc_GroupNum outGroup = GSC_NO_GROUP;
2505 size_t i = 0;
2506 for (; i < list_len; ++i) {
2507 gsc_GroupNum candidate = grouplist[i];
2508 gsc_BidirectionalIterator testit = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,candidate);
2509 gsc_GenoLocation testloc = gsc_next_forwards(&testit);
2510 gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(&testit);
2511 if (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(testloc)) {
2512 outGroup = candidate;
2513 break;
2514 }
2515 }
2516
2517 int remaininglistlen = list_len - i;
2518 if (remaininglistlen < 2) {
2519 return outGroup;
2520 } else if (remaininglistlen == 2) {
2521 if (grouplist[i].num == grouplist[i+1].num) {
2522 return outGroup;
2523 }
2524 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,grouplist[i+1]);
2525 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2526 int anyFound = GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc);
2527
2528 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2529 gsc_set_group(loc,outGroup);
2530 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2531 }
2532
2533 if (anyFound) {
2534 d->n_groups--;
2535 }
2536 gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
2537 return outGroup;
2538
2539 } else {
2540 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(isDuplicate,_Bool,remaininglistlen);
2541 memset(isDuplicate, 0, sizeof(_Bool)*remaininglistlen);
2542 for (size_t ii = i; ii < list_len; ++ii) {
2543 for (size_t jj = ii+1; jj < list_len; ++jj) {
2544 if (grouplist[ii].num == grouplist[jj].num) {
2545 isDuplicate[jj-i] = 1;
2546 }
2547 }
2548 }
2549
2550 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(anyFound,_Bool,remaininglistlen);
2551 memset(anyFound, 0, sizeof(_Bool)*remaininglistlen);
2552
2553 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,GSC_NO_GROUP);
2554 gsc_GroupNum cachedgroup = GSC_NO_GROUP; // just for speedier lookups. Groups tend to be stored contiguous in most simulations.
2555 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2556
2557 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2558 if (gsc_get_group(loc).num == cachedgroup.num) {
2559 gsc_set_group(loc,outGroup);
2560 } else {
2561 for (size_t k = i+1; k < list_len; ++k) {
2562 if (gsc_get_group(loc).num == grouplist[k].num) {
2563 gsc_set_group(loc,outGroup);
2564 cachedgroup = grouplist[k];
2565 anyFound[k-i] = 1;
2566 break;
2567 }
2568 }
2569 }
2570
2571 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2572 }
2573
2574 size_t groupsgone = 0;
2575 for (size_t j = 0; j < remaininglistlen; ++j) {
2576 if (!isDuplicate[j] && anyFound[j]) {
2577 groupsgone++;
2578 }
2579 }
2580 d->n_groups -= groupsgone;
2581 gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
2582 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(anyFound);
2583 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(isDuplicate);
2584 return outGroup;
2585 }
2586}
2587
2604gsc_GroupNum gsc_make_group_from(gsc_SimData* d,
2605 const size_t index_list_len,
2606 const GSC_GLOBALX_T* genotype_indexes) {
2607 if (index_list_len < 1) {
2608 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid index_list_len value: length of allocation list must be at least 1\n");
2609 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2610 }
2611
2612 gsc_GroupNum newGroup = gsc_get_new_group_num(d);
2613 gsc_RandomAccessIterator it = gsc_create_randomaccess_iter(d, GSC_NO_GROUP);
2614 size_t invalidLocations = 0;
2615 for (size_t i = 0; i < index_list_len; ++i) {
2616 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_get_nth(&it, genotype_indexes[i]);
2617 if (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2618 gsc_set_group(loc,newGroup);
2619 } else {
2620 invalidLocations++;
2621 }
2622 }
2623
2624 if (invalidLocations > 0) {
2625 fprintf(stderr,"%lu indexes were invalid\n",(long unsigned int)invalidLocations);
2626 }
2627 if (invalidLocations < index_list_len) {
2628 d->n_groups++;
2629 }
2630
2631 gsc_delete_randomaccess_iter(&it);
2632 return newGroup;
2633}
2634
2656gsc_GroupNum gsc_split_by_label_value(gsc_SimData* d,
2657 const gsc_GroupNum group,
2658 const gsc_LabelID whichLabel,
2659 const int valueToSplit) {
2660 GSC_ID_T labelix;
2661 if (whichLabel.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (labelix = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, whichLabel)) == GSC_NA_IDX) {
2662 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %lu\n", (long unsigned int)whichLabel.id);
2663 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2664 }
2665
2666 gsc_GroupNum newGroup = gsc_get_new_group_num(d);
2667 _Bool anyFound = 0;
2668
2669 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d, group);
2670 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2671 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2672 if (gsc_get_label_value(loc,labelix) == valueToSplit) {
2673 gsc_set_group(loc,newGroup);
2674 anyFound = 1;
2675 }
2676
2677 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2678 }
2679
2680 if (anyFound) {
2681 d->n_groups++;
2682 return newGroup;
2683 } else {
2684 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2685 }
2686
2687}
2688
2712gsc_GroupNum gsc_split_by_label_range(gsc_SimData* d,
2713 const gsc_GroupNum group,
2714 const gsc_LabelID whichLabel,
2715 const int valueLowBound,
2716 const int valueHighBound) {
2717 GSC_ID_T labelix;
2718 if (whichLabel.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (labelix = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, whichLabel)) == GSC_NA_IDX) {
2719 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %lu\n", (long unsigned int)whichLabel.id);
2720 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2721 }
2722 if (valueLowBound > valueHighBound) {
2723 fprintf(stderr, "Empty range %d to %d: no group created\n", valueLowBound, valueHighBound);
2724 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2725 }
2726
2727 gsc_GroupNum newGroup = gsc_get_new_group_num(d);
2728 _Bool anyFound = 0;
2729
2730 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d, group);
2731 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2732 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2733 if (gsc_get_label_value(loc,labelix) >= valueLowBound &&
2734 gsc_get_label_value(loc,labelix) <= valueHighBound) {
2735 gsc_set_group(loc,newGroup);
2736 anyFound = 1;
2737 }
2738
2739 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2740 }
2741
2742 if (anyFound) {
2743 d->n_groups++;
2744 return newGroup;
2745 } else {
2746 return GSC_NO_GROUP; // no values with that label
2747 }
2748}
2749
2750
2772size_t gsc_scaffold_split_by_somequality(gsc_SimData* d,
2773 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
2774 void* somequality_data,
2775 gsc_GroupNum (*somequality_tester)(gsc_GenoLocation,
2776 void*,
2777 size_t,
2778 size_t,
2779 gsc_GroupNum*),
2780 size_t maxentries_results,
2781 gsc_GroupNum* results) {
2782 // Access existing groups (to be used to find unused group numbers,
2783 // and to find maximum number of groups we'd be able to create)
2784 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(currentgroups,gsc_GroupNum,d->n_groups);
2785 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(currentsizes,GSC_GLOBALX_T,d->n_groups);
2786 size_t n_groups = gsc_get_existing_group_counts(d, currentgroups, currentsizes);
2787 size_t bookmark = 0;
2788 gsc_GroupNum nextgroup = GSC_NO_GROUP;
2789
2790 // splitgroupsize is size_t not GLOBALX_T because it will be used as the maximum number of output
2791 // groups that could be produced, not used to operate on candidates in the group. (By default though
2792 // GSC_GLOBALX_T is an alias of size_t so it makes no difference).
2793 size_t splitgroupsize = 0;
2794 for (size_t i = 0; i < n_groups; ++i) {
2795 if (currentgroups[i].num == group_id.num) {
2796 splitgroupsize = currentsizes[i];
2797 //GSC_FREE(currentsizes);
2798 break;
2799 }
2800 }
2801 if (splitgroupsize == 0) {
2802 return 0;
2803 }
2804
2805 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(currentsizes);
2806 size_t subgroupsfound = 0;
2807 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(outgroups,gsc_GroupNum,splitgroupsize);
2808
2809 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,group_id);
2810 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2811 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2812 // Return group number if it should be assigned to an already-extant group. Otherwise return GSC_NO_GROUP and this generic caller function will allocated it one.
2813 gsc_GroupNum assignedgroup = somequality_tester(loc, somequality_data,
2814 splitgroupsize, subgroupsfound, outgroups);
2815
2816 if (assignedgroup.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
2817 nextgroup = gsc_get_next_free_group_num(n_groups,currentgroups,&bookmark,nextgroup);
2818 assignedgroup = nextgroup;
2819 outgroups[subgroupsfound] = nextgroup;
2820 subgroupsfound++;
2821 }
2822
2823 gsc_set_group(loc,assignedgroup);
2824
2825 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2826 }
2827
2828 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(currentgroups);
2829 d->n_groups += subgroupsfound - 1;
2830
2831 if (maxentries_results < subgroupsfound) {
2832 memcpy(results,outgroups,sizeof(gsc_GroupNum)*maxentries_results);
2833 fprintf(stderr,"Output vector size is not large enough to hold all created groups: "
2834 " output list of gsc_GroupNums has been truncated\n");
2835 } else {
2836 memcpy(results,outgroups,sizeof(gsc_GroupNum)*subgroupsfound);
2837 }
2838 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(outgroups);
2839 return subgroupsfound;
2840}
2841
2842static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsibtemplate(gsc_GenoLocation loc,
2843 void* datastore,
2844 size_t maxgroups,
2845 size_t groupsfound,
2846 gsc_GroupNum* results,
2847 gsc_PedigreeID (*getparent)(gsc_GenoLocation)) {
2848 gsc_PedigreeID* familyidentities = (gsc_PedigreeID*) datastore;
2849
2850 for (size_t j = 0; j < groupsfound; ++j) {
2851 if (getparent(loc).id == familyidentities[j].id) {
2852 return results[j];
2853 }
2854 }
2855
2856 if (groupsfound > maxgroups) {
2857 fprintf(stderr, "Attempted to split into more groups than caller deemed possible. "
2858 "There is a bug in the simulation tool if you can reach this state.");
2859 return results[maxgroups-1]; // allocate all to the last group, possibly incorrectly.
2860 }
2861
2862 familyidentities[groupsfound] = getparent(loc);
2863 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2864}
2865
2866static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsib1(gsc_GenoLocation loc,
2867 void* datastore,
2868 size_t maxgroups,
2869 size_t groupsfound,
2870 gsc_GroupNum* results) {
2871 return gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsibtemplate(loc,datastore,maxgroups,groupsfound,results,
2872 gsc_get_first_parent);
2873}
2874
2875static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsib2(gsc_GenoLocation loc,
2876 void* datastore,
2877 size_t maxgroups,
2878 size_t groupsfound,
2879 gsc_GroupNum* results) {
2880 return gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsibtemplate(loc,datastore,maxgroups,groupsfound,results,
2881 gsc_get_second_parent);
2882}
2883
2917size_t gsc_split_into_halfsib_families(gsc_SimData* d,
2918 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
2919 const int parent,
2920 size_t maxentries_results,
2921 gsc_GroupNum* results) {
2922 if (!(parent == 1 || parent == 2)) {
2923 fprintf(stderr, "Value error: `parent` must be 1 or 2.");
2924 results = NULL;
2925 return 0;
2926 }
2927
2928 //gsc_PedigreeID* familyidentities = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_PedigreeID)*maxgroups);
2929 GSC_GLOBALX_T maxgroups = gsc_get_group_size(d, group_id); // sadinefficient we have to do this
2930 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(familyidentities,gsc_PedigreeID,maxgroups);
2931
2932 size_t gcount;
2933 if (parent == 1) {
2934 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_somequality(d, group_id, (void*)familyidentities,
2935 gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsib1,
2936 maxentries_results, results);
2937 } else {
2938 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_somequality(d, group_id, (void*)familyidentities,
2939 gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsib2,
2940 maxentries_results, results);
2941 }
2942
2943 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(familyidentities);
2944 return gcount;
2945}
2946
2947static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_quality_family(gsc_GenoLocation loc,
2948 void* datastore,
2949 size_t maxgroups,
2950 size_t groupsfound,
2951 gsc_GroupNum* results) {
2952 gsc_PedigreeID** familyidentities = (gsc_PedigreeID**) datastore;
2953
2954 for (size_t j = 0; j < groupsfound; ++j) {
2955 if (gsc_get_first_parent(loc).id == familyidentities[0][j].id &&
2956 gsc_get_second_parent(loc).id == familyidentities[1][j].id) {
2957 return results[j];
2958 }
2959 }
2960
2961 if (groupsfound > maxgroups) {
2962 fprintf(stderr, "Attempted to split into more groups than caller deemed possible. "
2963 "There is a bug in the simulation tool if you can reach this state.");
2964 return results[maxgroups-1]; // allocate all to the last group, possibly incorrectly.
2965 }
2966
2967 familyidentities[0][groupsfound] = gsc_get_first_parent(loc);
2968 familyidentities[1][groupsfound] = gsc_get_second_parent(loc);
2969 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2970}
2971
2999size_t gsc_split_into_families(gsc_SimData* d,
3000 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
3001 size_t maxentries_results,
3002 gsc_GroupNum* results) {
3003 gsc_PedigreeID* familyidentities[2];
3004 GSC_GLOBALX_T maxgroups = gsc_get_group_size(d, group_id); // sadinefficient we have to do this
3005 if (maxgroups < 2) {
3006 return 0;
3007 }
3008
3009 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(p1identity,gsc_PedigreeID,maxgroups);
3010 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(p2identity,gsc_PedigreeID,maxgroups);
3011 familyidentities[0] = p1identity;
3012 familyidentities[1] = p2identity;
3013
3014 size_t out = gsc_scaffold_split_by_somequality(d, group_id, (void*)familyidentities,
3015 gsc_helper_split_by_quality_family,
3016 maxentries_results, results);
3017
3018 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(p1identity);
3019 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(p2identity);
3020
3021 return out;
3022}
3023
3024static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_quality_individuate(gsc_GenoLocation loc,
3025 void* datastore,
3026 size_t maxgroups,
3027 size_t groupsfound,
3028 gsc_GroupNum* results) {
3029 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
3030}
3031
3056size_t gsc_split_into_individuals(gsc_SimData* d,
3057 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
3058 size_t maxentries_results,
3059 gsc_GroupNum* results) {
3060 // **individuate** (verb): to make individuals of.
3061 // yeah sorry.
3062 return gsc_scaffold_split_by_somequality(d, group_id, NULL,
3063 gsc_helper_split_by_quality_individuate,
3064 maxentries_results, results);
3065}
3066
3067
3090gsc_GroupNum gsc_split_evenly_into_two(gsc_SimData* d,
3091 const gsc_GroupNum group_id) {
3092 // get the shuffle to be our even allocations
3093 GSC_GLOBALX_T size = gsc_get_group_size(d, group_id);
3094 if (size < 2) {
3095 if (size < 1) {
3096 fprintf(stderr,"Group %lu does not exist\n", (long unsigned int) group_id.num);
3097 } else {
3098 fprintf(stderr,"Group %lu has only one member so can't be split\n", (long unsigned int) group_id.num);
3099 }
3100 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
3101 }
3102
3103 GSC_GLOBALX_T even_half = size / 2;
3104 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(allocations,GSC_GLOBALX_T,size);
3105 for (GSC_GLOBALX_T i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
3106 allocations[i] = i;
3107 }
3108 gsc_shuffle_up_to(&d->rng, allocations, size, even_half);
3109
3110 gsc_GroupNum new_group = gsc_get_new_group_num(d);
3111
3112 gsc_RandomAccessIterator it = gsc_create_randomaccess_iter(d,group_id);
3113 for (GSC_GLOBALX_T i = 0; i < even_half; ++i) {
3114 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_get_nth(&it,allocations[i]);
3115 if (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
3116 gsc_set_group(loc,new_group);
3117 }
3118 }
3119
3120 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(allocations);
3121 gsc_delete_randomaccess_iter(&it);
3122
3123 d->n_groups++;
3124 return new_group;
3125}
3126
3127
3145size_t gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(gsc_SimData* d,
3146 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
3147 void* someallocator_data,
3148 gsc_GroupNum (*someallocator)(gsc_GenoLocation,
3149 gsc_SimData*,
3150 void*,
3151 size_t,
3152 size_t*,
3153 gsc_GroupNum*),
3154 size_t n_outgroups,
3155 gsc_GroupNum* outgroups) {
3156
3157 // get the n group numbers
3158 gsc_get_n_new_group_nums(d, n_outgroups, outgroups);
3159
3160 size_t subgroupsfound = 0;
3161 GSC_GLOBALX_T allocationfailures = 0;
3162
3163 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,group_id);
3164 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
3165 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
3166 gsc_GroupNum assignedgroup = someallocator(loc, d, someallocator_data,
3167 n_outgroups, &subgroupsfound, outgroups);
3168 if (assignedgroup.num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
3169 gsc_set_group(loc,assignedgroup);
3170 } else {
3171 allocationfailures++;
3172 }
3173
3174 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
3175 }
3176
3177 if (subgroupsfound > 1) {
3178 d->n_groups += subgroupsfound - 1;
3179 }
3180 if (allocationfailures > 0) {
3181 fprintf(stderr,"While splitting group %lu, %lu allocations to new groups failed so they remain"
3182 " in the original group\n",
3183 (long unsigned int) group_id.num, (long unsigned int) allocationfailures);
3184 }
3185 return subgroupsfound;
3186
3187}
3188
3189
3190static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_knowncounts(gsc_GenoLocation loc,
3191 gsc_SimData* d,
3192 void* datastore,
3193 size_t n_outgroups,
3194 size_t* subgroupsfound,
3195 gsc_GroupNum* outgroups) {
3196 GSC_GLOBALX_T* cumulative_counts = (GSC_GLOBALX_T*) datastore;
3197 *subgroupsfound = n_outgroups;
3198 // type note: may misbehave with large numbers because is just designed for ints
3199 int randpos = rnd_pcg_range(&d->rng,0,cumulative_counts[n_outgroups-1] - 1);
3200
3201 gsc_GroupNum chosengroup = GSC_NO_GROUP;
3202 size_t j = 0;
3203 for (; j < n_outgroups; ++j) {
3204 if (randpos < cumulative_counts[j]) {
3205 chosengroup = outgroups[j];
3206 break;
3207 }
3208 }
3209 for (; j < n_outgroups; ++j) {
3210 cumulative_counts[j]--;
3211 }
3212 return chosengroup;
3213}
3214
3236size_t gsc_split_evenly_into_n(gsc_SimData* d,
3237 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
3238 const size_t n,
3239 gsc_GroupNum* results) {
3240 if (n <= 1) {
3241 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid n value: number of fractions into which to split group must be at least 2\n");
3242 return 0;
3243 }
3244
3245 GSC_GLOBALX_T size = gsc_get_group_size(d, group_id); // sadinefficient we have to do this.
3246
3247 // get the shuffle to be our even allocations
3248 GSC_GLOBALX_T each_size = size / n;
3249 GSC_GLOBALX_T extra = size % n;
3250 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(boxes,GSC_GLOBALX_T,n);
3251 for (size_t i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
3252 boxes[i] = each_size;
3253 if (i < extra) {
3254 boxes[i]++;
3255 }
3256 if (i > 0) {
3257 boxes[i] += boxes[i-1];
3258 }
3259 }
3260
3261 size_t out;
3262 if (results == NULL) {
3263 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(outgroups,gsc_GroupNum, n);
3264 out = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, (void*) boxes,
3265 gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_knowncounts,
3266 n, outgroups);
3267 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(outgroups);
3268 } else {
3269 out = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, (void*) boxes,
3270 gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_knowncounts,
3271 n, results);
3272 }
3273 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(boxes);
3274 return out;
3275}
3276
3313size_t gsc_split_into_buckets(gsc_SimData* d,
3314 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
3315 const size_t n,
3316 const GSC_GLOBALX_T* counts,
3317 gsc_GroupNum* results) {
3318 if (n <= 1) {
3319 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid n value: number of fractions into which to split group must be at least 2\n");
3320 return 0;
3321 }
3322
3323 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(cumulative_counts,GSC_GLOBALX_T,n);
3324 cumulative_counts[n-1] = gsc_get_group_size(d, group_id);
3325 GSC_GLOBALX_T sum = 0;
3326 for (size_t j = 0; j < n - 1; ++j) {
3327 sum += counts[j];
3328 cumulative_counts[j] = sum;
3329 }
3330 if (cumulative_counts[n-2] > cumulative_counts[n-1]) {
3331 fprintf(stderr, "Provided capacities are larger than actual group: some buckets will not be filled\n");
3332 }
3333
3334 size_t gcount;
3335 if (results == NULL) {
3336 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(outgroups,gsc_GroupNum,n);
3337 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, (void*) cumulative_counts,
3338 gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_knowncounts,
3339 n, outgroups);
3340 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(outgroups);
3341 } else {
3342 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, (void*) cumulative_counts,
3343 gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_knowncounts,
3344 n, results);
3345 }
3346
3347 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(cumulative_counts);
3348 return gcount;
3349}
3350
3372gsc_GroupNum gsc_split_randomly_into_two(gsc_SimData* d,
3373 const gsc_GroupNum group_id) {
3374 gsc_GroupNum outGroup = gsc_get_new_group_num(d);
3375 _Bool anyFound = 0;
3376
3377 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d, group_id);
3378 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
3379 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
3380 anyFound = 1;
3381 if (rnd_pcg_range(&d->rng,0,1)) {
3382 gsc_set_group(loc,outGroup);
3383 }
3384 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
3385 }
3386 gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
3387
3388 if (anyFound) {
3389 d->n_groups++;
3390 return outGroup;
3391 } else {
3392 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
3393 }
3394}
3395
3396
3397static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_equalprob(gsc_GenoLocation loc,
3398 gsc_SimData* d,
3399 void* datastore,
3400 size_t n_outgroups,
3401 size_t* subgroupsfound,
3402 gsc_GroupNum* outgroups) {
3403 // consideration: will be an issue in C version if n_outgroups > INT_MAX.
3404 size_t randgroup = rnd_pcg_range(&d->rng,0,n_outgroups-1);
3405 if (randgroup < *subgroupsfound) {
3406 return outgroups[randgroup];
3407 } else {
3408 (*subgroupsfound)++;
3409 return outgroups[*subgroupsfound-1];
3410 }
3411}
3412
3437size_t gsc_split_randomly_into_n(gsc_SimData* d,
3438 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
3439 const size_t n,
3440 gsc_GroupNum* results) {
3441 if (n <= 1) {
3442 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid n value: number of fractions in which to split group must be at least 2\n");
3443 return 0;
3444 }
3445
3446 size_t gcount;
3447 if (results == NULL) {
3448 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(outgroups,gsc_GroupNum,n);
3449 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, NULL,
3450 gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_equalprob,
3451 n, outgroups);
3452 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(outgroups);
3453 } else {
3454 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, NULL,
3455 gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_equalprob,
3456 n, results);
3457 }
3458 return gcount;
3459}
3460
3461
3462static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_unequalprob(gsc_GenoLocation loc,
3463 gsc_SimData* d,
3464 void* datastore,
3465 size_t n_outgroups,
3466 size_t* subgroupsfound,
3467 gsc_GroupNum* outgroups) {
3468 double* cumulative_probs = (double*) datastore;
3469 *subgroupsfound = n_outgroups;
3470 double randdraw = rnd_pcg_nextf(&d->rng);
3471 for (size_t j = 0; j < n_outgroups; ++j) {
3472 if (randdraw < cumulative_probs[j]) {
3473 return outgroups[j];
3474 }
3475 }
3476 // This should not happen if cumulative probs are valid
3477 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
3478}
3479
3512size_t gsc_split_by_probabilities(gsc_SimData* d,
3513 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
3514 const size_t n,
3515 const double* probs,
3516 gsc_GroupNum* results) {
3517 if (n <= 1) {
3518 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid n value: number of fractions in which to split group must be at least 2\n");
3519 return 0;
3520 }
3521
3522 // Check the probabilities
3523 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(cumulative_probs,double,n);
3524 cumulative_probs[n-1] = 1.0;
3525 double sum = 0;
3526 for (size_t j = 0; j < n-1; ++j) {
3527 sum += probs[j];
3528 cumulative_probs[j] = sum;
3529 if (cumulative_probs[j] >= 1) {
3530 fprintf(stderr, "Provided probabilities add up to 1 or more: some buckets will not be filled\n");
3531 for (; j < n-1; ++j) {
3532 cumulative_probs[j] = 1;
3533 }
3534 //don't bother to calculate more
3535 break;
3536 }
3537 }
3538
3539 size_t gcount;
3540 if (results == NULL) {
