3541 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(outgroups,gsc_GroupNum,n);
3542 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, (void*) cumulative_probs,
3543 gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_unequalprob,
3544 n, outgroups);
3545 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(outgroups);
3546 } else {
3547 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, (void*) cumulative_probs,
3548 gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_unequalprob,
3549 n, results);
3550 }
3551
3552 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(cumulative_probs);
3553 return gcount;
3554}
3555
3556
3578size_t gsc_get_existing_groups(gsc_SimData* d, gsc_GroupNum* output) {
3579 return gsc_get_existing_group_counts(d, output, NULL);
3580}
3581
3598size_t gsc_get_existing_group_counts( gsc_SimData* d, gsc_GroupNum* out_groups, GSC_GLOBALX_T* out_sizes) {
3599 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(buckets,GSC_GLOBALX_T,d->n_groups+1); // this also creates bucketscap, initalised to d->n_groups+1.
3600 memset(buckets,0,sizeof(GSC_GLOBALX_T)*bucketscap);
3601 size_t filledbuckets = 0;
3602
3603 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d, GSC_NO_GROUP);
3604 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
3605 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
3606 gsc_GroupNum g = gsc_get_group(loc);
3607 // Unless all group numbers are consecutive starting at 1, the buckets array will need to be resized at some point.
3608 if (g.num >= bucketscap) {
3609 size_t oldcap = bucketscap;
3610 size_t newbucketcapacity = bucketscap;
3611 while (g.num >= newbucketcapacity) {
3612 newbucketcapacity *= 2;
3613 }
3614 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(buckets,newbucketcapacity);
3615 if (g.num >= bucketscap) {
3616 fprintf(stderr,"Memory allocation failed. Not all groups found\n");
3617 break;
3618 }
3619 memset(buckets+oldcap,0,sizeof(GSC_GLOBALX_T)*(bucketscap-oldcap));
3620
3621 }
3622
3623 buckets[g.num] += 1;
3624 if (buckets[g.num] == 1) {
3625 ++filledbuckets;
3626 }
3627
3628 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
3629 }
3630
3631 // Now save to output and sort.
3632 size_t capacity = filledbuckets;
3633 if (capacity > d->n_groups) {
3634 fprintf(stderr,"Found more groups than expected - gsc_SimData.n_groups is outdated somewhere."
3635 " Trimming output of get_existing_group_ to avoid a crash: not all groups may be shown\n");
3636 capacity = d->n_groups;
3637 }
3638 size_t g_index = 0;
3639 for (size_t i = 1; i < bucketscap; ++i) {
3640 if (buckets[i]) {
3641 /*if (g_index >= capacity) {
3642 fprintf(stderr,"Found more groups than just a moment ago.");
3643 --g_index;
3644 break;
3645 }*/
3646
3647 if (out_groups != NULL) {
3648 out_groups[g_index] = (gsc_GroupNum){.num=i};
3649 }
3650 if (out_sizes != NULL) {
3651 out_sizes[g_index] = buckets[i];
3652 }
3653 ++g_index;
3654 }
3655 }
3656
3657 //qsort(*out_groups, g_index, sizeof(gsc_GroupNum), gsc_helper_ascending_gsc_GroupNum_comparer);
3658 /*for (int i = 0; i < g_index; ++i) {
3659 (*out_sizes)[i] = buckets[(*out_groups)[i].num];
3660 }*/
3661 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(buckets);
3662 d->n_groups = g_index;
3663
3664 return g_index;
3665}
3666
3667
3691gsc_GroupNum gsc_get_next_free_group_num(const size_t n_existing_groups,
3692 const gsc_GroupNum* existing_groups,
3693 size_t* cursor,
3694 gsc_GroupNum previous) {
3695 if (existing_groups == NULL) return GSC_NO_GROUP;
3696
3697 gsc_GroupNum nextgroup = (gsc_GroupNum){.num=previous.num+1};
3698 // a check here in case previous seems invalid. We need previous so we don't get stuck in a loop
3699 // of giving the same next 'free' number, but we know what a lower bound on its number should be
3700 // based on where the cursor is.
3701 if (*cursor > 0 && nextgroup.num <= existing_groups[(*cursor) - 1].num) {
3702 nextgroup.num = existing_groups[(*cursor) - 1].num + 1;
3703 }
3704
3705 while (*cursor < n_existing_groups) {
3706 if (nextgroup.num < existing_groups[*cursor].num) {
3707 break;
3708 }
3709
3710 ++(*cursor);
3711 ++nextgroup.num;
3712 }
3713 return nextgroup;
3714}
3715
3729gsc_GroupNum gsc_get_new_group_num(gsc_SimData* d) {
3730 // Make sure we get all existing groups
3731 if (d->m == NULL || (d->m->n_genotypes == 0 && d->m->next == NULL)) {
3732 return (gsc_GroupNum){.num=1};
3733 }
3734
3735 size_t n_groups = (d->n_groups > 0) ? d->n_groups : 5;
3736 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(existing_groups,gsc_GroupNum,n_groups);
3737 n_groups = gsc_get_existing_groups(d, existing_groups);
3738
3739 size_t i = 0;
3740 GSC_ID_T gn = 1;
3741
3742 while (i < n_groups) {
3743 if (gn < existing_groups[i].num) {
3744 break;
3745 }
3746
3747 ++i;
3748 ++gn;
3749 }
3750 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(existing_groups);
3751 return (gsc_GroupNum){.num=gn};
3752}
3753
3754
3763void gsc_get_n_new_group_nums(gsc_SimData* d,
3764 const size_t n,
3765 gsc_GroupNum* result) {
3766 // Make sure we get all existing groups
3767 size_t n_groups;
3768 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(existing_groups,gsc_GroupNum,d->n_groups);
3769 n_groups = gsc_get_existing_groups(d, existing_groups);
3770
3771 size_t existingi = 0;
3772 GSC_ID_T gn = 0;
3773
3774 // i: current index of `results` (the array of currently empty group numbers)
3775 // gn: group number being checked against existing_groups. if not in there is added to
3776 // the list of results
3777 // existingi: current index of existing_groups
3778 for (size_t i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
3779 ++gn;
3780 while (existingi < n_groups) {
3781 if (gn < existing_groups[existingi].num) {
3782 break;
3783 }
3784
3785 ++existingi;
3786 ++gn;
3787 }
3788 result[i] = (gsc_GroupNum){.num=gn};
3789 }
3790 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(existing_groups);
3791}
3792
3800gsc_LabelID gsc_get_new_label_id( const gsc_SimData* d ) {
3801 // label_ids must be in sequential order
3802 gsc_LabelID new = {.id=1};
3803 GSC_ID_T i = 0;
3804
3805 while (i < d->n_labels) {
3806 if (new.id < d->label_ids[i].id) {
3807 break;
3808 }
3809
3810 ++i;
3811 ++(new.id);
3812 }
3813
3814 return new;
3815}
3816
3824gsc_EffectID gsc_get_new_eff_set_id( const gsc_SimData* d ) {
3825 // label_ids must be in sequential order
3826 gsc_EffectID new = { .id=1 };
3827 GSC_ID_T i = 0;
3828
3829 while (i < d->n_eff_sets) {
3830 if (new.id < d->eff_set_ids[i].id) {
3831 break;
3832 }
3833
3834 ++i;
3835 ++(new.id);
3836 }
3837
3838 return new;
3839}
3840
3848gsc_MapID gsc_get_new_map_id( const gsc_SimData* d) {
3849 // map IDs must be in sequential order
3850 gsc_MapID new = { .id=1 };
3851 GSC_ID_T i = 0;
3852
3853 while (i < d->genome.n_maps) {
3854 if (new.id < d->genome.map_ids[i].id) {
3855 break;
3856 }
3857
3858 ++i;
3859 ++(new.id);
3860 }
3861
3862 return new;
3863}
3864
3865
3874GSC_ID_T gsc_get_index_of_label( const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_LabelID label ) {
3875 if (d->n_labels == 0) { return GSC_NA_IDX; } // immediate fail
3876 if (d->n_labels == 1) { return (d->label_ids[0].id == label.id) ? 0 : GSC_NA_IDX ; }
3877
3878 // If there's at least two labels then we binary search.
3879 GSC_ID_T first = 0;
3880 GSC_ID_T last = d->n_labels;
3881 GSC_ID_T mid;
3882
3883 while (first <= last) {
3884 mid = (first + last) / 2;
3885
3886 if (d->label_ids[mid].id == label.id) {
3887 return mid;
3888 } else if (d->label_ids[mid].id < label.id) {
3889 first = mid + 1;
3890 } else {
3891 last = mid - 1;
3892 }
3893
3894 }
3895
3896 return GSC_NA_IDX;
3897}
3898
3906GSC_ID_T gsc_get_index_of_eff_set( const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_EffectID eff_set_id ) {
3907 if (d->n_eff_sets == 0) { return GSC_NA_IDX; } // immediate fail
3908 if (d->n_eff_sets == 1) { return (d->eff_set_ids[0].id == eff_set_id.id) ? 0 : GSC_NA_IDX ; }
3909
3910 // If there's at least two labels then we binary search.
3911 GSC_ID_T first = 0;
3912 GSC_ID_T last = d->n_eff_sets;
3913 GSC_ID_T mid;
3914
3915 while (first <= last) {
3916 mid = (first + last) / 2;
3917
3918 if (d->eff_set_ids[mid].id == eff_set_id.id) {
3919 return mid;
3920 } else if (d->eff_set_ids[mid].id < eff_set_id.id) {
3921 first = mid + 1;
3922 } else {
3923 last = mid - 1;
3924 }
3925
3926 }
3927
3928 return GSC_NA_IDX;
3929}
3930
3938GSC_ID_T gsc_get_index_of_map( const SimData* d, const gsc_MapID map ) {
3939 if (d->genome.n_maps == 0) { return GSC_NA_IDX; } // immediate fail
3940 if (d->genome.n_maps == 1) { return (d->genome.map_ids[0].id == map.id) ? 0 : GSC_NA_IDX ; }
3941
3942 // If there's at least two labels then we binary search.
3943 GSC_ID_T first = 0;
3944 GSC_ID_T last = d->genome.n_maps;
3945 GSC_ID_T mid;
3946
3947 while (first <= last) {
3948 mid = (first + last) / 2;
3949
3950 if (d->genome.map_ids[mid].id == map.id) {
3951 return mid;
3952 } else if (d->genome.map_ids[mid].id < map.id) {
3953 first = mid + 1;
3954 } else {
3955 last = mid - 1;
3956 }
3957
3958 }
3959
3960 return GSC_NA_IDX;
3961}
3962
3963//-----------------------------------Data Access-----------------------------------
3964
3979GSC_GLOBALX_T gsc_get_group_size( const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id) {
3980 if (group_id.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
3981 return 0; // it is not a group so it does not have a size
3982 }
3983 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
3984 GSC_GLOBALX_T size = 0;
3985 while (1) {
3986 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
3987 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
3988 ++size;
3989 }
3990 }
3991
3992 if (m->next == NULL) {
3993 return size;
3994 } else {
3995 m = m->next;
3996 }
3997 }
3998}
3999
4017GSC_GLOBALX_T gsc_get_group_genes(const gsc_SimData* d,
4018 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
4019 GSC_GLOBALX_T group_size,
4020 char** output) {
4021 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4022 GSC_GLOBALX_T outix = 0;
4023 while (1) {
4024 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
4025 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
4026 output[outix] = m->alleles[i];
4027 ++outix;
4028 if (outix == group_size) {
4029 return outix;
4030 }
4031 }
4032 }
4033
4034 if (m->next == NULL) {
4035 return outix;
4036 } else {
4037 m = m->next;
4038 }
4039 }
4040}
4041
4058GSC_GLOBALX_T gsc_get_group_names(const gsc_SimData* d,
4059 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
4060 GSC_GLOBALX_T group_size,
4061 char** output) {
4062 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4063 GSC_GLOBALX_T outix = 0;
4064 while (1) {
4065 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
4066 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
4067 output[outix] = m->names[i];
4068 ++outix;
4069 if (outix == group_size) {
4070 return outix;
4071 }
4072 }
4073 }
4074
4075 if (m->next == NULL) {
4076 return outix;
4077 } else {
4078 m = m->next;
4079 }
4080 }
4081}
4082
4099GSC_GLOBALX_T gsc_get_group_ids(const gsc_SimData* d,
4100 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
4101 GSC_GLOBALX_T group_size,
4102 gsc_PedigreeID *output) {
4103 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4104 GSC_GLOBALX_T outix = 0;
4105 while (1) {
4106 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
4107 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
4108 output[outix] = m->ids[i];
4109 ++outix;
4110 if (outix == group_size) {
4111 return outix;
4112 }
4113 }
4114 }
4115
4116 if (m->next == NULL) {
4117 return outix;
4118 } else {
4119 m = m->next;
4120 }
4121 }
4122}
4123
4140GSC_GLOBALX_T gsc_get_group_indexes(const gsc_SimData* d,
4141 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
4142 GSC_GLOBALX_T group_size,
4143 GSC_GLOBALX_T* output) {
4144 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4145 GSC_GLOBALX_T total_i = 0, outix = 0;
4146 while (1) {
4147 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i, ++total_i) {
4148 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
4149 output[outix] = total_i;
4150 ++outix;
4151 if (outix == group_size) {
4152 return outix;
4153 }
4154 }
4155 }
4156
4157 if (m->next == NULL) {
4158 return outix;
4159 } else {
4160 m = m->next;
4161 }
4162 }
4163}
4164
4182GSC_GLOBALX_T gsc_get_group_bvs(const gsc_SimData* d,
4183 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
4184 const gsc_EffectID effID,
4185 GSC_GLOBALX_T group_size,
4186 double* output) {
4187 gsc_DecimalMatrix dm_bvs = gsc_calculate_bvs(d, group_id, effID );
4188
4189 for (size_t i = 0; i < dm_bvs.cols; ++i) {
4190 output[i] = dm_bvs.matrix[0][i];
4191 if (i + 1 == group_size) {
4192 break;
4193 }
4194 }
4195
4196 gsc_delete_dmatrix(&dm_bvs);
4197
4198 return group_size;
4199}
4200
4220GSC_GLOBALX_T gsc_get_group_parent_ids(const gsc_SimData* d,
4221 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
4222 GSC_GLOBALX_T group_size,
4223 const int whichParent,
4224 gsc_PedigreeID* output) {
4225 if (!(whichParent == 1 || whichParent == 2)) {
4226 fprintf(stderr, "Value error: `parent` must be 1 or 2.");
4227 return GSC_NA_GLOBALX;
4228 }
4229 int parent = whichParent - 1;
4230
4231 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4232 GSC_GLOBALX_T outix = 0;
4233 while (1) {
4234 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
4235 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
4236 output[outix] = m->pedigrees[parent][i];
4237 ++outix;
4238 if (outix == group_size) {
4239 return outix;
4240 }
4241 }
4242 }
4243
4244 if (m->next == NULL) {
4245 return outix;
4246 } else {
4247 m = m->next;
4248 }
4249 }
4250}
4251
4271GSC_GLOBALX_T gsc_get_group_parent_names(const gsc_SimData* d,
4272 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
4273 GSC_GLOBALX_T group_size,
4274 const int whichParent,
4275 char** output) {
4276 if (!(whichParent == 1 || whichParent == 2)) {
4277 fprintf(stderr, "Value error: `parent` must be 1 or 2.");
4278 return GSC_NA_GLOBALX;
4279 }
4280 int parent = whichParent - 1;
4281
4282 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4283 GSC_GLOBALX_T outix = 0;
4284 while (1) {
4285 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
4286 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
4287 if (m->pedigrees[parent][i].id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
4288 output[outix] = gsc_get_name_of_id(d->m, m->pedigrees[parent][i]);
4289 } else {
4290 output[outix] = NULL;
4291 }
4292 ++outix;
4293 if (outix == group_size) {
4294 return outix;
4295 }
4296 }
4297 }
4298
4299 if (m->next == NULL) {
4300 return outix;
4301 } else {
4302 m = m->next;
4303 }
4304 }
4305}
4306
4336GSC_GLOBALX_T gsc_get_group_pedigrees(const gsc_SimData* d,
4337 const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
4338 GSC_GLOBALX_T group_size,
4339 char** output) {
4340 char* fname = "gS_gpptmp";
4341 gsc_save_pedigrees(fname,d,group_id,GSC_TRUE);
4342
4343 FILE* fp2;
4344 if ((fp2 = fopen(fname, "r")) == NULL) {
4345 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to use temporary file\n");
4346 return GSC_NA_GLOBALX;
4347 }
4348
4349 // Create the list that we will return
4350 if (group_size == 0 || group_size == GSC_NA_GLOBALX) {
4351 group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, group_id );
4352 if (group_size == 0) { return 0; }
4353 }
4354
4355 // read one line at a time
4356 //size_t n;
4357 //int line_len;
4358 unsigned int size;
4359 unsigned int index;
4360 int nextc;
4361 for (GSC_GLOBALX_T i = 0; i < group_size; ++i) {
4362 // getline is not available in MinGW it looks like (AUG 2021)
4363 /*gp_ped[i] = NULL;
4364 if ((line_len = getline(&(gp_ped[i]), &n, fp2)) == -1) {
4365 error("Failed to get %d th pedigree\n", i);
4366 }
4367 // remove the newline character
4368 if (gp_ped[i][line_len - 1] == '\n') {
4369 gp_ped[i][line_len - 1] = '\0';
4370 }*/
4371
4372 // a not-very-size-efficient, fgets-based line getter
4373 size = 50;
4374 index = 0;
4375 output[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * size,GSC_TRUE);
4376 while ((nextc = fgetc(fp2)) != '\n' && nextc != EOF) {
4377 output[i][index] = nextc;
4378 ++index;
4379
4380 if (index >= size) {
4381 size *= 2;
4382 char* temp = realloc(output[i], sizeof(char) * size);
4383 if (temp == NULL) {
4384 GSC_FREE(output[i]);
4385 fprintf(stderr, "Memory allocation of size %u failed.\n", size);
4386 output[i] = NULL;
4387 } else {
4388 output[i] = temp;
4389 }
4390 }
4391 }
4392 output[i][index] = '\0';
4393 }
4394
4395 fclose(fp2);
4396 remove(fname);
4397
4398 return group_size;
4399}
4400
4401/*---------------------- matrix-operations.c dregs -------------------*/
4402
4410gsc_DecimalMatrix gsc_generate_zero_dmatrix(const size_t r, const size_t c) {
4411 gsc_DecimalMatrix zeros;
4412 zeros.rows = r;
4413 zeros.cols = c;
4414
4415 zeros.matrix = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*zeros.matrix) * r,GSC_TRUE);
4416 for (size_t i = 0; i < r; ++i) {
4417 zeros.matrix[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*(zeros.matrix[i])) * c,GSC_TRUE);
4418 for (size_t j = 0; j < c; ++j) {
4419 zeros.matrix[i][j] = 0.0;
4420 }
4421 }
4422 return zeros;
4423}
4424
4440int gsc_add_matrixvector_product_to_dmatrix(gsc_DecimalMatrix* result,
4441 const gsc_DecimalMatrix* a,
4442 const double* b) {
4443 /*if (a->cols != b->rows) {
4444 fprintf(stderr, "Dimensions invalid for matrix multiplication."); exit(1);
4445 }*/
4446
4447 //if (result->rows != a->rows || result->cols != b->cols) {
4448 if (result->cols != a->rows) { //these dimensions make it so result is one heap array, using only first row.
4449 fprintf(stderr, "Dimensions invalid for adding to result: %lu does not fit in %lu\n",
4450 (long unsigned int) a->rows, (long unsigned int) result->cols);
4451 return 1;
4452 }
4453
4454 double cell;
4455
4456 for (size_t i = 0; i < result->cols; ++i) {
4457 cell = 0;
4458 for (size_t j = 0; j < a->cols; ++j) {
4459 // for each cell, we loop through each of the pairs adjacent to it.
4460 cell += (a->matrix[i][j]) * b[j];
4461 }
4462
4463 result->matrix[0][i] += cell;
4464 }
4465
4466 return 0;
4467
4468}
4469
4493int gsc_add_doublematrixvector_product_to_dmatrix(gsc_DecimalMatrix* result,
4494 const gsc_DecimalMatrix* amat,
4495 const double* avec,
4496 const gsc_DecimalMatrix* bmat,
4497 const double* bvec) {
4498
4499 if (result->cols != amat->rows) { //these dimensions make it so result is one heap array, using only first row.
4500 fprintf(stderr, "Dimensions invalid for adding to result: %lu does not fit in %lu\n",
4501 (long unsigned int) amat->rows, (long unsigned int) result->cols);
4502 return 1;
4503 }
4504 if (result->cols != bmat->rows) {
4505 fprintf(stderr, "Dimensions invalid for adding to result: %lu does not fit in %lu\n",
4506 (long unsigned int) bmat->rows, (long unsigned int) result->cols);
4507 return 1;
4508 }
4509 if (amat->cols != bmat->cols) {
4510 fprintf(stderr, "Dimensions of the two products are uneven: length %lu does not match length %lu\n",
4511 (long unsigned int) amat->cols, (long unsigned int) bmat->cols);
4512 return 1;
4513 }
4514
4515 double cell;
4516
4517 for (size_t i = 0; i < result->cols; ++i) {
4518 cell = 0;
4519 for (size_t j = 0; j < amat->cols; ++j) {
4520 // for each cell, we loop through each of the pairs adjacent to it.
4521 cell += (amat->matrix[i][j]) * avec[j];
4522 cell += (bmat->matrix[i][j]) * bvec[j];
4523 }
4524
4525 result->matrix[0][i] += cell;
4526 }
4527
4528 return 0;
4529}
4530
4531
4537void gsc_delete_dmatrix(gsc_DecimalMatrix* m) {
4538 if (m->matrix != NULL) {
4539 for (size_t i = 0; i < m->rows; i++) {
4540 if (m->matrix[i] != NULL) {
4541 GSC_FREE(m->matrix[i]);
4542 }
4543 }
4544 GSC_FREE(m->matrix);
4545 m->matrix = NULL;
4546 }
4547 m->cols = 0;
4548 m->rows = 0;
4549}
4550
4551
4552/*--------------------------------Deleting-----------------------------------*/
4553
4567void gsc_delete_group(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id) {
4568 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4569 GSC_GLOBALX_T total_deleted = 0;
4570 while (1) {
4571 GSC_LOCALX_T deleted = 0;
4572 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
4573 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
4574 // delete data
4575 if (m->names[i] != NULL) {
4576 GSC_FREE(m->names[i]);
4577 m->names[i] = NULL;
4578 }
4579 if (m->alleles[i] != NULL) {
4580 GSC_FREE(m->alleles[i]);
4581 m->alleles[i] = NULL;
4582 }
4583 m->ids[i] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
4584 m->pedigrees[0][i] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
4585 m->pedigrees[1][i] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
4586 m->groups[i] = GSC_NO_GROUP;
4587 ++deleted;
4588 }
4589 }
4590 m->n_genotypes -= deleted;
4591 total_deleted += deleted;
4592
4593 if (m->next == NULL) {
4594 gsc_condense_allele_matrix( d );
4595 printf("%lu genotypes were deleted\n", (long unsigned int) total_deleted);
4596 d->n_groups--;
4597 return;
4598 } else {
4599 m = m->next;
4600 }
4601 }
4602}
4603
4611void gsc_delete_eff_set(gsc_SimData* d, gsc_EffectID effID) {
4612 GSC_ID_T which_ix = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
4613 if (which_ix == GSC_NA_LOCALX) {
4614 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent effect set %lu\n", (long unsigned int) effID.id);
4615 return;
4616 }
4617
4618 if (d->n_eff_sets == 1) {
4619 gsc_delete_effect_matrix(d->e);
4620 d->n_eff_sets = 0;
4621 GSC_FREE(d->e);
4622 GSC_FREE(d->eff_set_ids);
4623 d->e = NULL;
4624 d->eff_set_ids = NULL;
4625 } else {
4626 d->n_eff_sets--;
4627
4628 gsc_delete_effect_matrix(d->e + which_ix);
4629 gsc_EffectMatrix* newE = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*d->e)*d->n_eff_sets,GSC_FALSE);
4630 if (newE == NULL) {
4631 gsc_EffectMatrix cleared = d->e[which_ix];
4632 for (GSC_ID_T i = which_ix; i < d->n_eff_sets-1; ++i) {
4633 d->e[i] = d->e[i+1];
4634 }
4635 d->e[d->n_eff_sets] = cleared;
4636 } else {
4637 memcpy(newE, d->e, sizeof(*d->e)*which_ix);
4638 memcpy(newE + which_ix, d->e + which_ix + 1, sizeof(*d->e)*(d->n_eff_sets - which_ix));
4639 GSC_FREE(d->e);
4640 d->e = newE;
4641 }
4642
4643 gsc_EffectID* newIDs = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*d->eff_set_ids)*d->n_eff_sets,GSC_FALSE);
4644 if (newIDs == NULL) {
4645 for (GSC_ID_T i = which_ix; i < d->n_eff_sets-1; ++i) {
4646 d->eff_set_ids[i] = d->eff_set_ids[i+1];
4647 }
4648 d->eff_set_ids[d->n_eff_sets] = NO_EFFECTSET;
4649 } else {
4650 memcpy(newIDs, d->eff_set_ids, sizeof(*d->eff_set_ids)*which_ix);
4651 memcpy(newIDs + which_ix, d->eff_set_ids + which_ix + 1, sizeof(*d->eff_set_ids)*(d->n_eff_sets - which_ix));
4652 GSC_FREE(d->eff_set_ids);
4653 d->eff_set_ids = newIDs;
4654 }
4655 }
4656}
4657
4665void gsc_delete_label(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_LabelID which_label) {
4666 GSC_ID_T label_ix;
4667 if (which_label.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id ||
4668 (label_ix = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, which_label)) == GSC_NA_LOCALX) {
4669 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %lu\n", (long unsigned int)which_label.id);
4670 return;
4671 }
4672
4673 if (d->n_labels == 1) {
4674 // Delete 'em all
4675 d->n_labels = 0;
4676 GSC_FREE(d->label_ids);
4677 d->label_ids = NULL;
4678 GSC_FREE(d->label_defaults);
4679 d->label_defaults = NULL;
4680
4681 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4682 do {
4683
4684 GSC_FREE(m->labels[0]);
4685 GSC_FREE(m->labels);
4686 m->labels = NULL;
4687
4688 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
4689
4690 } else {
4691 // Reduce the list of labels in the gsc_SimData
4692 gsc_LabelID* new_label_ids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_LabelID) * (d->n_labels - 1),GSC_FALSE);
4693 if (new_label_ids == NULL) {
4694 for (GSC_ID_T i = label_ix; i < d->n_labels - 1; ++i) {
4695 d->label_ids[i] = d->label_ids[i+1];
4696 }
4697 d->label_ids[d->n_labels] = GSC_NO_LABEL;
4698 } else {
4699 memcpy(new_label_ids,d->label_ids,sizeof(*d->label_ids)*label_ix);
4700 memcpy(new_label_ids + label_ix,d->label_ids + label_ix + 1, sizeof(*d->label_ids)*(d->n_labels - 1 - label_ix));
4701 GSC_FREE(d->label_ids);
4702 d->label_ids = new_label_ids;
4703 }
4704
4705 int* new_label_defaults = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * (d->n_labels - 1),GSC_FALSE);
4706 if (new_label_defaults == NULL) {
4707 for (GSC_ID_T i = label_ix; i < d->n_labels - 1; ++i) {
4708 d->label_defaults[i] = d->label_defaults[i+1];
4709 }
4710 // no need to overwrite default
4711 } else {
4712 memcpy(new_label_defaults,d->label_defaults,sizeof(*d->label_defaults)*label_ix);
4713 memcpy(new_label_defaults + label_ix,d->label_defaults + label_ix + 1, sizeof(*d->label_defaults)*(d->n_labels - 1 - label_ix));
4714 GSC_FREE(d->label_defaults);
4715 d->label_defaults = new_label_defaults;
4716 }
4717 d->n_labels --;
4718
4719 // Remove the label from the gsc_AlleleMatrix linked list
4720 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4721 do {
4722 GSC_FREE(m->labels[label_ix]);
4723
4724 m->n_labels = d->n_labels;
4725 int** new_label_lookups = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int*) * (m->n_labels),GSC_FALSE);
4726 if (new_label_lookups == NULL) {
4727 for (GSC_ID_T i = label_ix; i < m->n_labels; ++i) {
4728 m->labels[i] = m->labels[i+1];
4729 }
4730 m->labels[m->n_labels + 1] = NULL;
4731 } else {
4732 memcpy(new_label_lookups, m->labels, sizeof(*m->labels)*label_ix);
4733 memcpy(new_label_lookups + label_ix, m->labels + label_ix + 1, sizeof(*m->labels)*(m->n_labels - label_ix));
4734 GSC_FREE(m->labels);
4735 m->labels = new_label_lookups;
4736 }
4737 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
4738 }
4739}
4740
4747void gsc_delete_genome(gsc_KnownGenome* g) {
4748 if (g->marker_names != NULL) {
4749 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < g->n_markers; i++) {
4750 if (g->marker_names[i] != NULL) {
4751 GSC_FREE(g->marker_names[i]);
4752 }
4753 }
4754 GSC_FREE(g->marker_names);
4755 g->marker_names = NULL;
4756 }
4757 if (g->names_alphabetical != NULL) {
4758 GSC_FREE(g->names_alphabetical);
4759 g->names_alphabetical = NULL;
4760 }
4761 g->n_markers = 0;
4762
4763 if (g->map_ids != NULL) {
4764 GSC_FREE(g->map_ids);
4765 g->map_ids = NULL;
4766 }
4767
4768 if (g->maps != NULL) {
4769 for (GSC_ID_T i = 0; i < g->n_maps; ++i) {
4770 gsc_delete_recombination_map_nointegrity(g->maps + i);
4771 }
4772 GSC_FREE(g->maps);
4773 g->maps = NULL;
4774 }
4775 g->n_maps = 0;
4776}
4777
4785void gsc_delete_recombination_map(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_MapID which_map) {
4786 GSC_ID_T map_ix;
4787 if (which_map.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (map_ix = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, which_map)) == GSC_NA_IDX) {
4788 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent recombination map %lu\n", (long unsigned int) which_map.id);
4789 return;
4790 }
4791
4792 if (d->genome.n_maps == 1) {
4793 GSC_FREE(d->genome.map_ids);
4794 d->genome.map_ids = NULL;
4795 gsc_delete_recombination_map_nointegrity(&d->genome.maps[0]);
4796 GSC_FREE(d->genome.maps);
4797 d->genome.maps = NULL;
4798 d->genome.n_maps = 0;
4799 } else {
4800 d->genome.n_maps--;
4801 gsc_delete_recombination_map_nointegrity(&d->genome.maps[map_ix]);
4802 gsc_RecombinationMap* tmplist = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*d->genome.maps)*d->genome.n_maps, GSC_FALSE);
4803 if (tmplist == NULL) {
4804 gsc_RecombinationMap clearedmap = d->genome.maps[map_ix];
4805 for (GSC_ID_T i = map_ix; i < d->genome.n_maps - 1; ++i) {
4806 d->genome.maps[i] = d->genome.maps[i+1];
4807 }
4808 d->genome.maps[d->genome.n_maps] = clearedmap;
4809 } else {
4810 memcpy(tmplist, d->genome.maps, sizeof(*d->genome.maps)*map_ix);
4811 memcpy(tmplist + map_ix, d->genome.maps + map_ix + 1, sizeof(*d->genome.maps)*(d->genome.n_maps - map_ix));
4812 GSC_FREE(d->genome.maps);
4813 d->genome.maps = tmplist;
4814 }
4815
4816 gsc_MapID* tmpids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*d->genome.map_ids)*d->genome.n_maps, GSC_FALSE);
4817 if (tmpids == NULL) {
4818 for (GSC_ID_T i = map_ix; i < d->genome.n_maps - 1; ++i) {
4819 d->genome.map_ids[i] = d->genome.map_ids[i+1];
4820 }
4821 d->genome.map_ids[d->genome.n_maps] = NO_MAP;
4822 } else {
4823 memcpy(tmpids, d->genome.map_ids, sizeof(*d->genome.map_ids)*map_ix);
4824 memcpy(tmpids + map_ix, d->genome.map_ids + map_ix + 1, sizeof(*d->genome.map_ids)*(d->genome.n_maps - map_ix));
4825 GSC_FREE(d->genome.map_ids);
4826 d->genome.map_ids = tmpids;
4827 }
4828 }
4829}
4830
4840void gsc_delete_recombination_map_nointegrity(gsc_RecombinationMap* m) {
4841 if (m->chrs != NULL) {
4842 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < m->n_chr; ++i) {
4843 switch (m->chrs[i].type) {
4844 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE:
4845 m->chrs[i].map.simple.expected_n_crossovers = 0;
4846 m->chrs[i].map.simple.first_marker_index = 0;
4847 m->chrs[i].map.simple.n_markers = 0;
4848 if (m->chrs[i].map.simple.dists != NULL) {
4849 GSC_FREE(m->chrs[i].map.simple.dists);
4850 m->chrs[i].map.simple.dists = NULL;
4851 }
4852 break;
4853 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER:
4854 m->chrs[i].map.reorder.expected_n_crossovers = 0;
4855 m->chrs[i].map.reorder.n_markers = 0;
4856 if (m->chrs[i].map.reorder.dists != NULL) {
4857 GSC_FREE(m->chrs[i].map.reorder.dists);
4858 m->chrs[i].map.reorder.dists = NULL;
4859 }
4860 if (m->chrs[i].map.reorder.marker_indexes != NULL) {
4861 GSC_FREE(m->chrs[i].map.reorder.marker_indexes);
4862 m->chrs[i].map.reorder.marker_indexes = NULL;
4863 }
4864 break;
4865 }
4866 }
4867 GSC_FREE(m->chrs);
4868 m->chrs = NULL;
4869 }
4870}
4871
4880void gsc_delete_allele_matrix(gsc_AlleleMatrix* m) {
4881 if (m == NULL) {
4882 return;
4883 }
4884 gsc_AlleleMatrix* next;
4885 do {
4886 /* free the big data matrix */
4887 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < CONTIG_WIDTH; i++) {
4888 if (m->alleles[i] != NULL) {
4889 GSC_FREE(m->alleles[i]);
4890 }
4891
4892 }
4893
4894 // free names
4895 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < CONTIG_WIDTH; i++) {
4896 if (m->names[i] != NULL) {
4897 GSC_FREE(m->names[i]);
4898 }
4899 }
4900
4901 // free labels
4902 for (GSC_ID_T i = 0; i < m->n_labels; ++i) {
4903 if (m->labels[i] != NULL) {
4904 GSC_FREE(m->labels[i]);
4905 }
4906 }
4907 if (m->labels != NULL) {
4908 GSC_FREE(m->labels);
4909 }
4910
4911 next = m->next;
4912 GSC_FREE(m);
4913 } while ((m = next) != NULL);
4914}
4915
4923void gsc_delete_effect_matrix(gsc_EffectMatrix* m) {
4924 gsc_delete_dmatrix(&(m->effects));
4925 if (m->effect_names != NULL) {
4926 GSC_FREE(m->effect_names);
4927 }
4928 m->effect_names = NULL;
4929}
4930
4937void gsc_delete_simdata(gsc_SimData* m) {
4938 if (m == NULL) {
4939 return;
4940 }
4941
4942 gsc_delete_genome(&(m->genome));
4943
4944 if (m->n_eff_sets > 0) {
4945 GSC_FREE(m->eff_set_ids);
4946 for (GSC_ID_T i = 0; i < m->n_eff_sets; ++i) {
4947 gsc_delete_effect_matrix(&(m->e[i]));
4948 }
4949 GSC_FREE(m->e);
4950 }
4951
4952 gsc_delete_allele_matrix(m->m);
4953
4954 if (m->n_labels > 0) {
4955 if (m->label_ids != NULL) {
4956 GSC_FREE(m->label_ids);
4957 }
4958 if (m->label_defaults != NULL) {
4959 GSC_FREE(m->label_defaults);
4960 }
4961 }
4962
4963 if (m != NULL) {
4964 GSC_FREE(m);
4965 }
4966}
4967
4977void gsc_delete_markerblocks(gsc_MarkerBlocks* b) {
4978 for (GSC_ID_T i = 0; i < b->num_blocks; ++i) {
4979 GSC_FREE(b->markers_in_block[i]);
4980 }
4981 GSC_FREE(b->markers_in_block);
4982 b->markers_in_block = NULL;
4983 GSC_FREE(b->num_markers_in_block);
4984 b->num_markers_in_block = NULL;
4985 b->num_blocks = 0;
4986
4987 return;
4988}
4989
4990
5004void gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(gsc_BidirectionalIterator* it) {
5005 it->am = NULL;
5006 //it->group = GSC_NO_GROUP;
5007 it->localPos = GSC_NA_LOCALX;
5008 it->cachedAM = NULL;
5009 it->cachedAMIndex = UINT_MAX;
5010 it->atEnd = GSC_TRUE;
5011 it->atStart = GSC_TRUE;
5012}
5013
5025void gsc_delete_randomaccess_iter(gsc_RandomAccessIterator* it) {
5026 it->d = NULL;
5027 //it->group = GSC_NO_GROUP;
5028 if (it->cacheSize > 0) {
5029 GSC_FREE(it->cache);
5030 }
5031 it->cache = NULL;
5032 it->cacheSize = 0;
5033 it->largestCached = GSC_NA_GLOBALX;
5034 it->groupSize = 0;
5035}
5036
5037/*-------------------------------gsc_SimData loaders-----------------------------*/
5038
5043gsc_TableFileReader gsc_tablefilereader_create(const char* filename) {
5044 FILE* fp;
5045 if ((fp = fopen(filename, "r")) == NULL) {
5046 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s.\n", filename);
5047 }
5048
5049 gsc_TableFileReader tfr = { .fp = fp,
5050 .buf = { 0 },
5051 .buf_fill = 0,
5052 .cursor = 0,
5053 };
5054
5055 if (fp != NULL) {
5056 tfr.buf_fill = fread(tfr.buf,1,sizeof(tfr.buf),fp);
5057 }
5058 return tfr;
5059}
5060
5063void gsc_tablefilereader_close(gsc_TableFileReader* tbl) {
5064 if (tbl->fp != NULL) { fclose(tbl->fp); }
5065 tbl->fp = NULL;
5066}
5067
5075void gsc_helper_tablefilereader_refill_buffer(gsc_TableFileReader* tbl) {
5076 tbl->cursor = 0;
5077 if (tbl->fp != NULL) {
5078 tbl->buf_fill = fread(tbl->buf,1,sizeof(tbl->buf),tbl->fp);
5079 } else {
5080 tbl->buf_fill = 0;
5081 }
5082}
5083
5089enum gsc_TableFileCurrentStatus gsc_helper_tablefilereader_classify_char(gsc_TableFileReader* tbl) {
5090 if (tbl->buf_fill <= tbl->cursor) {
5091 if (tbl->buf_fill < sizeof(tbl->buf)) { // last read did not fill the entire buffer
5092 return GSC_TABLEFILE_ERROR_EOF;
5093 }
5094 return GSC_TABLEFILE_ERROR_EOBUF;
5095 }
5096
5097 switch (tbl->buf[tbl->cursor]) {
5098 case '\r': // allow '\r' or '\r\n' as end of lines. also allow '\n' as end of line (see following case)
5099 case '\n':
5100 return GSC_TABLEFILE_NEWLINE;
5101 case '\t':
5102 case ' ':
5103 case ',':
5104 return GSC_TABLEFILE_COLUMNGAP;
5105 default:
5106 return GSC_TABLEFILE_CONTENTS;
5107 }
5108}
5109
5118void gsc_tablefilecell_deep_copy(gsc_TableFileCell* c) {
5119 if (c->cell_len > 0 && c->isCellShallow) {
5120 char* deepcell = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char)*(c->cell_len+1), GSC_TRUE);
5121 memcpy(deepcell,c->cell,sizeof(char)*c->cell_len);
5122 deepcell[c->cell_len] = '\0';
5123 c->cell = deepcell;
5124 c->isCellShallow = GSC_FALSE;
5125 }
5126}
5127
5133gsc_TableFileCell gsc_tablefilereader_get_next_cell(gsc_TableFileReader* tbl) {
5134 gsc_TableFileCell cur = { .isCellShallow = GSC_TRUE, .cell = NULL, .cell_len = 0,
5135 .predCol = 0, .predNewline = 0, .eof = GSC_FALSE };
5136
5137 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(tmpcell,char,1);
5138 size_t tmpix = 0;
5139 size_t tblbuf_offset = 0;
5140 size_t tblbuf_len = 0;
5141 int predCarriageReturn = 0; // for detecting /r/n as a single "newline"
5142 _Bool warned = 0;
5143
5144 while (1) {
5145 enum gsc_TableFileCurrentStatus type = gsc_helper_tablefilereader_classify_char(tbl);
5146 if (0 < predCarriageReturn) { --predCarriageReturn; } // decremented each time step
5147
5148 if (0 == cur.cell_len) {
5149 switch (type) {
5150 case GSC_TABLEFILE_NEWLINE:
5151 if (tbl->buf[tbl->cursor] == '\r') {
5152 predCarriageReturn = 2; // will have value 1 at next loop iteration, then will fall back to 0
5153 }
5154 if (!(predCarriageReturn && tbl->buf[tbl->cursor] == '\n')) {
5155 ++cur.predNewline;
5156 }
5157 cur.predCol = 0;
5158 ++tbl->cursor;
5159 break;
5160
5161 case GSC_TABLEFILE_COLUMNGAP:
5162 ++tbl->cursor;
5163 ++cur.predCol;
5164 break;
5165
5166 case GSC_TABLEFILE_ERROR_EOBUF:
5167 // just refill as we have no contents we need to save yet
5168 gsc_helper_tablefilereader_refill_buffer(tbl);
5169 if (0 < predCarriageReturn) { ++predCarriageReturn; } // should not tick down the counter this loop iteration
5170 break;
5171
5172 case GSC_TABLEFILE_CONTENTS:
5173 tblbuf_offset = tbl->cursor; tblbuf_len = 1; // in case we need to make a deep copy later.
5174 cur.cell = tbl->buf + tbl->cursor;
5175 ++cur.cell_len;
5176 ++tbl->cursor;
5177 break;
5178
5179 default:
5180 ++tbl->cursor;
5181 cur.eof = GSC_TRUE;
5182 return cur;
5183 }
5184
5185 } else { // have found the cell, just need to read the rest of it
5186 switch (type) {
5187 case GSC_TABLEFILE_CONTENTS:
5188 ++tbl->cursor;
5189 ++tblbuf_len;
5190 ++cur.cell_len;
5191 break;
5192
5193 case GSC_TABLEFILE_ERROR_EOBUF:
5194 cur.isCellShallow = GSC_FALSE;
5195
5196 if (!warned && tblbuf_len > 8192) {
5197 warned = 1;
5198 fprintf(stderr,"Warning: very long cell identified beginning %c%c%c%c%c%c. Column separators may have failed to be recognised\n",
5199 tmpcell[0],tmpcell[1],tmpcell[2],tmpcell[3],tmpcell[4],tmpcell[5]);
5200 }
5201
5202 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(tmpcell,tmpix + tblbuf_len + 1);
5203 memcpy(tmpcell+tmpix,tbl->buf+tblbuf_offset,sizeof(char)*tblbuf_len);
5204 tmpix += tblbuf_len;
5205 tmpcell[tmpix] = '\0';
5206
5207 tblbuf_offset = 0; tblbuf_len = 0;
5208 gsc_helper_tablefilereader_refill_buffer(tbl);
5209 break;
5210
5211 case GSC_TABLEFILE_ERROR_EOF:
5212 ++tbl->cursor;
5213 cur.eof = GSC_TRUE;
5214 // fall through
5215 default: // newline or column gap or end of file discovered: save and return.
5216 if (!cur.isCellShallow) {
5217 cur.cell = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char)*(cur.cell_len + 1),GSC_TRUE);
5218 memcpy(cur.cell,tmpcell,sizeof(char)*tmpix);
5219 if (0 < tblbuf_len) {
5220 memcpy(cur.cell+tmpix,tbl->buf+tblbuf_offset,sizeof(char)*tblbuf_len);
5221 }
5222 cur.cell[cur.cell_len] = '\0';
5223 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(tmpcell);
5224 }
5225 return cur;
5226 }
5227 }
5228 }
5229}
5230
5240_Bool gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(const char* target,
5241 gsc_KnownGenome g,
5242 GSC_GENOLEN_T* out) {
5243 GSC_GENOLEN_T first = 0, last = g.n_markers - 1;
5244 GSC_GENOLEN_T index = (first + last) / 2;
5245 int comparison = strcmp(target,*(g.names_alphabetical[index]));
5246 while (comparison != 0 && first <= last) {
5247 if (comparison == 0) {
5248 if (out != NULL) *out = g.names_alphabetical[index] - g.marker_names;
5249 return 1;
5250 } else if (comparison > 0) {
5251 first = index + 1;
5252 if (first >= g.n_markers) { return 0; }
5253 } else {
5254 if (index == 0) { return 0; }
5255 last = index - 1;
5256 }
5257
5258 // index has been updated, no matter the branch.
5259 index = (first + last) / 2;
5260 comparison = strcmp(target, *(g.names_alphabetical[index]));
5261 }
5262
5263 if (first > last) {
5264 return 0;
5265 }
5266 if (out != NULL) *out = g.names_alphabetical[index] - g.marker_names;
5267 return 1;
5268}
5269
5279static gsc_TableFileCell gsc_helper_tablefilereader_get_next_cell_wqueue(gsc_TableFileReader* tf,
5280 gsc_TableFileCell** queue,
5281 size_t* queuesize) {
5282 gsc_TableFileCell ncell;
5283 if (*queuesize > 0) {
5284 ncell = *queue[0];
5285 /*for (int i = 1; i < *queuesize; ++i) { *queue[i-1] = *queue[i]; }*/
5286 ++*queue;
5287 --*queuesize;
5288 } else {
5289 ncell = gsc_tablefilereader_get_next_cell(tf);
5290 }
5291 return ncell;
5292}
5293
5324static GSC_LOGICVAL gsc_helper_parse_3cell_header(gsc_TableFileReader* tf,
5325 const char** canonical_titles,
5326 int* col_order,
5327 gsc_TableFileCell* unprocessedqueue,
5328 size_t* queuesize) {
5329 const int ncells = 3;
5330
5331 // assume unprocessedqueue has at least 4 spaces, titles has 3 entries and so does col_order
5332 size_t newest = 0;
5333 size_t onelinefile = GSC_FALSE;
5334 for (; newest < ncells; ++newest) {
5335 unprocessedqueue[newest] = gsc_tablefilereader_get_next_cell(tf);
5336 if ((unprocessedqueue[newest]).eof) {
5337 if (newest + 1 < ncells) {
5338 if (!((unprocessedqueue[newest]).isCellShallow)) { GSC_FREE((unprocessedqueue[newest]).cell); }
5339 *queuesize = newest; // newest does not exist in return group
5340 return GSC_NA;
5341 } else { // column 3 has eof at the end of it. That's okay.
5342 onelinefile = GSC_TRUE;
5343 *queuesize = newest + 1;
5344 }
5345 } else if ((unprocessedqueue[newest]).predNewline) {
5346 *queuesize = newest+1; // newest index included in return group
5347 return GSC_NA;
5348 }
5349 gsc_tablefilecell_deep_copy(unprocessedqueue + newest);
5350 }
5351 if (!onelinefile) {
5352 unprocessedqueue[newest] = gsc_tablefilereader_get_next_cell(tf); // four cell
5353 *queuesize = newest + 1;
5354 }
5355
5356 // Check which ordering of the three titles it is.
5357 for (int i1 = 0; i1 < ncells; ++i1) {
5358 if (strcmp((unprocessedqueue[i1]).cell,canonical_titles[0]) == 0) {
5359 for (int inc = 1; inc < ncells; ++inc) {
5360 int i2 = (i1 + inc) % ncells;
5361 int i3 = (i1 + (ncells - inc)) % ncells;
5362 if (strcmp((unprocessedqueue[i2]).cell,canonical_titles[1]) == 0 &&
5363 strcmp((unprocessedqueue[i3]).cell,canonical_titles[2]) == 0) {
5364 col_order[0] = i1 + 1;
5365 col_order[1] = i2 + 1;
5366 col_order[2] = i3 + 1;
5367 GSC_FREE((unprocessedqueue[0]).cell);
5368 GSC_FREE((unprocessedqueue[1]).cell);
5369 GSC_FREE((unprocessedqueue[2]).cell);
5370 unprocessedqueue[0] = unprocessedqueue[3];
5371 *queuesize = 1;
5372 return GSC_TRUE;
5373 }
5374 }
5375 }
5376 }
5377
5378 return GSC_FALSE;
5379}
5380
5414static size_t gsc_helper_parse_mapfile(const char* filename, struct gsc_MapfileUnit** out) {
5415 if (filename == NULL) return 0;
5416
5417 gsc_TableFileReader tf = gsc_tablefilereader_create(filename);
5418
5419 size_t row = 1;
5420 size_t col = 1;
5421
5422 gsc_TableFileCell cellsread[4] = { 0 };
5423 gsc_TableFileCell* cellqueue = cellsread;
5424 size_t queue_size;
5425 const char* titles[] = { "marker", "chr", "pos"};
5426 int colnums[] = { 1, 2, 3 };
5427 GSC_LOGICVAL header = gsc_helper_parse_3cell_header(&tf, titles, colnums, cellqueue, &queue_size);
5428 if (header == GSC_TRUE) {
5429 printf("(Loading %s) Format: map file with header\n", filename);
5430 } else if (header == GSC_FALSE) {
5431 printf("(Loading %s) Format: map file without header\n", filename);
5432 } else {
5433 printf("(Loading %s) Failure: Cannot identify the expected 3 columns of the map file\n", filename);
5434 gsc_tablefilereader_close(&tf);
5435 return 0;
5436 }
5437 int marker_colnum = colnums[0], chr_colnum = colnums[1], pos_colnum = colnums[2];
5438
5439 _Bool goodrow = (header) ? 0 : 1; // discard first row if it's a header, keep if it's not.
5440 size_t goodrow_counter = 0;
5441
5442 char* marker = NULL;
5443 unsigned long chr = 0;
5444 double pos = 0;
5445 char* conversionflag;
5446
5447 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(buffer,struct gsc_MapfileUnit,CONTIG_WIDTH);
5448
5449 gsc_TableFileCell ncell;
5450 do {
5451 ncell = gsc_helper_tablefilereader_get_next_cell_wqueue(&tf, &cellqueue, &queue_size);
5452
5453 // Update row/col position and save predecessor row
5454 if (ncell.cell != NULL) {
5455 if (ncell.predNewline) {
5456 if (goodrow) { // save predecessor row
5457 buffer[goodrow_counter].name = marker;
5458 buffer[goodrow_counter].chr = chr;
5459 buffer[goodrow_counter].pos = pos;
5460
5461 ++goodrow_counter;
5462 if (goodrow_counter >= buffercap) {
5463 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(buffer,2*row);
5464 }
5465 marker = NULL;
5466 } else if (marker != NULL) {
5467 GSC_FREE(marker);
5468 }
5469 row += ncell.predNewline;
5470 goodrow = 1;
5471 col = 1;
5472 }
5473 col += (ncell.predCol > 0) ? 1 : 0;
5474
5475 // Parse this cell
5476 if (ncell.cell_len == 0) {
5477 goodrow = 0;
5478 } if (col == marker_colnum) {
5479 gsc_tablefilecell_deep_copy(&ncell);
5480 marker = ncell.cell;
5481 ncell.isCellShallow = GSC_TRUE; // so it isn't freed.
5482
5483 } else if (col == chr_colnum) {
5484 char tmp = ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len]; ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = '\0';
5485 chr = strtoul(ncell.cell,&conversionflag,36);
5486 ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = tmp;
5487 if (conversionflag != ncell.cell + ncell.cell_len) { // unsuccessful read
5488 //fprintf(stderr,"Entry at row %i column %i of file %s could not be parsed as an integer or alphanumeric string\n", row, chr_colnum, filename);
5489 goodrow = 0;
5490 }
5491
5492 } else if (col == pos_colnum) {
5493 char tmp = ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len]; ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = '\0';
5494 pos = strtod(ncell.cell,&conversionflag);
5495 ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = tmp;
5496 if (conversionflag != ncell.cell + ncell.cell_len) { // unsuccessful read
5497 goodrow = 0;
5498 //fprintf(stderr,"Entry at row %i column %i of file %s could not be parsed as a numeric value\n", row, pos_colnum, filename);
5499 }
5500
5501 } else {
5502 goodrow = 0;
5503 }
5504
5505 // Reset to get next cell.
5506 if (!ncell.isCellShallow) { GSC_FREE(ncell.cell); }
5507 }
5508 } while (!ncell.eof);
5509
5510 if (col == 3) {
5511 if (goodrow) { // save predecessor row
5512 buffer[goodrow_counter].name = marker;
5513 buffer[goodrow_counter].chr = chr;
5514 buffer[goodrow_counter].pos = pos;
5515
5516 ++goodrow_counter;
5517 marker = NULL;
5518 } else if (marker != NULL) {
5519 GSC_FREE(marker);
5520 }
5521 }
5522 //row -= ncell.predNewline; // don't count trailing newlines in stats.
5523
5524 printf("(Loading %s) %u marker(s) with map positions were loaded. Failed to parse %u line(s).\n", filename, (unsigned int) goodrow_counter, (unsigned int) (row - header - goodrow_counter));
5525 gsc_tablefilereader_close(&tf);
5526
5527 // Check outputs. We don't delete the buffers because we want to leave them alive with our callers holding the handles.
5528 GSC_FINALISE_BUFFER(buffer,*out,goodrow_counter);
5529 return goodrow_counter;
5530}
5531
5532
5549static GSC_GENOLEN_T gsc_helper_str_markerlist_leftjoin(gsc_KnownGenome g,
5550 GSC_GENOLEN_T n_markers_in_list,
5551 struct gsc_MapfileUnit** markerlist) {
5552 struct gsc_MapfileUnit* rlist = *markerlist;
5553 GSC_GENOLEN_T n_joined = 0;
5554 /*size_t consecutivity_bias; // we cache the index of the last name we found and pre-check whether the next marker
5555 // in the list is the next marker in the genome. For the case where people organise their genotype file and genetic
5556 // map file in the same order. Edit: decided this is not likely enough a situation to build this in.*/
5557
5558 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < n_markers_in_list; ++i) {
5559 if (rlist[i].name != NULL) {
5560 GSC_GENOLEN_T nameix;
5561 if (gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(rlist[i].name, g, &nameix)) {
5562 if (n_joined != i) {
5563 rlist[n_joined] = rlist[i];
5564 }
5565 n_joined++;
5566
5567 } else { // discard this marker. n_joined lags behind i by one more step.
5568 GSC_FREE(rlist[i].name);
5569
5570 }
5571 }
5572 }
5573
5574 return n_joined;
5575}
5576
5577
5580static gsc_MapID gsc_helper_insert_recombmap_into_simdata(gsc_SimData* d, gsc_RecombinationMap map) {
5581 GSC_ID_T newmapindex = 0;
5582 if (d->genome.n_maps > 0) {
5583 newmapindex = d->genome.n_maps;
5584
5585 gsc_MapID* tmpMapIDs = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_MapID)*(newmapindex+1),GSC_TRUE);
5586 memcpy(tmpMapIDs,d->genome.map_ids,sizeof(gsc_MapID)*newmapindex);
5587 GSC_FREE(d->genome.map_ids);
5588 d->genome.map_ids = tmpMapIDs;
5589
5590 gsc_RecombinationMap* tmpMaps = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_RecombinationMap)*(newmapindex+1),GSC_TRUE);
5591 memcpy(tmpMaps,d->genome.maps,sizeof(gsc_RecombinationMap)*newmapindex);
5592 GSC_FREE(d->genome.maps);
5593 d->genome.maps = tmpMaps;
5594
5595 } else {
5596 d->genome.map_ids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_MapID)*1,GSC_TRUE);
5597 d->genome.maps = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_RecombinationMap)*1,GSC_TRUE);
5598 }
5599 d->genome.map_ids[newmapindex] = gsc_get_new_map_id(d);
5600 d->genome.n_maps++;
5601 d->genome.maps[newmapindex] = map;
5602
5603 return d->genome.map_ids[newmapindex];
5604}
5605
5608static gsc_EffectID gsc_helper_insert_eff_set_into_simdata(gsc_SimData* d, gsc_EffectMatrix effset) {
5609 GSC_ID_T neweffsetindex = 0;
5610 if (d->n_eff_sets > 0) {
5611 neweffsetindex = d->n_eff_sets;
5612
5613 gsc_EffectID* tmpIDs = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_EffectID)*(neweffsetindex+1),GSC_TRUE);
5614 memcpy(tmpIDs,d->eff_set_ids,sizeof(gsc_EffectID)*neweffsetindex);
5615 GSC_FREE(d->eff_set_ids);
5616 d->eff_set_ids = tmpIDs;
5617
5618 gsc_EffectMatrix* tmpMats = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_EffectMatrix)*(neweffsetindex+1),GSC_TRUE);
5619 memcpy(tmpMats,d->e,sizeof(gsc_EffectMatrix)*neweffsetindex);
5620 GSC_FREE(d->e);
5621 d->e = tmpMats;
5622
5623 } else {
5624 d->eff_set_ids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_EffectID)*1,GSC_TRUE);
5625 d->e = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_EffectMatrix)*1,GSC_TRUE);
5626 }
5627 d->eff_set_ids[neweffsetindex] = gsc_get_new_eff_set_id(d);
5628 d->n_eff_sets++;
5629 d->e[neweffsetindex] = effset;
5630
5631 return d->eff_set_ids[neweffsetindex];
5632}
5633
5640static void gsc_helper_sort_markerlist(GSC_GENOLEN_T n_markers, struct gsc_MapfileUnit* markerlist) {
5641 if (n_markers < 2) { return; }
5642
5643 // sort by linkage group
5644 qsort(markerlist,n_markers,sizeof(*markerlist),gsc_helper_mapfileunit_ascending_chr_comparer);
5645
5646 // sort each linkage group by pos
5647 //int n_chr = 1;
5648 GSC_GENOLEN_T chr_start = 0;
5649 unsigned long current_chr = markerlist[0].chr;
5650
5651 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 1; i < n_markers; ++i) {
5652 if (markerlist[i].chr != current_chr) { // found end of current chr
5653 //n_chr++;
5654 qsort(markerlist + chr_start, i - chr_start,
5655 sizeof(*markerlist), gsc_helper_mapfileunit_ascending_d_comparer);
5656
5657 chr_start = i;
5658 current_chr = markerlist[i].chr;
5659 }
5660 }
5661
5662 qsort(markerlist + chr_start, n_markers - chr_start,
5663 sizeof(*markerlist), gsc_helper_mapfileunit_ascending_d_comparer);
5664 //return n_chr;
5665}
5666
5680gsc_MapID gsc_create_recombmap_from_markerlist(gsc_SimData* d,
5681 GSC_GENOLEN_T n_markers,
5682 struct gsc_MapfileUnit* markerlist) {
5683 if (n_markers == 0) return NO_MAP;
5684
5685 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(chr_nmembers,GSC_GENOLEN_T,40);
5686 memset(chr_nmembers,0,sizeof(*chr_nmembers)*40);
5687 chr_nmembers[0] = 1;
5688 GSC_GENOLEN_T n_chr = 1;
5689 unsigned long current_chr = markerlist[0].chr;
5690 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 1; i < n_markers; ++i) {
5691 while (i < n_markers && markerlist[i].name == NULL) {
5692 ++i;
5693 }
5694 if (current_chr != markerlist[i].chr) {
5695 // First of next
5696 if (n_chr >= chr_nmemberscap) {
5697 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(chr_nmembers,2*n_chr);
5698 memset(chr_nmembers+n_chr,0,sizeof(*chr_nmembers)*n_chr);
5699 }
5700 ++n_chr;
5701 current_chr = markerlist[i].chr;
5702 chr_nmembers[n_chr-1] = 1;
5703 } else {
5704 ++(chr_nmembers[n_chr-1]);
5705 }
5706 }
5707
5708 gsc_RecombinationMap map = {.n_chr=n_chr, .chrs=gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_LinkageGroup) * n_chr, GSC_TRUE) };
5709
5710 // Populate the map. Each chr/linkage group may be "Simple" or "Reordered"
5711 GSC_GENOLEN_T could_not_match = 0;
5712 GSC_GENOLEN_T current_marker = 0;
5713 GSC_GENOLEN_T first_marker;
5714 GSC_GENOLEN_T n_bad_chr = 0;
5715 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T chr_ix = 0; chr_ix < map.n_chr; ++chr_ix) {
5716 first_marker = current_marker;
5717 double chrdist = markerlist[first_marker + chr_nmembers[chr_ix] - 1].pos - markerlist[first_marker].pos;
5718 double* lgdists = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(double)*(chr_nmembers[chr_ix]),GSC_TRUE);
5719
5720 char found_first = GSC_FALSE;
5721 // n_goodmembers == 0 is a guard on firsts_coord_in_genome, but we
5722 // still initialise it here (to a value too high to be reasonable)
5723 // because the compiler can't tell that.
5724 GSC_GENOLEN_T firsts_coord_in_genome = d->genome.n_markers;
5725 GSC_GENOLEN_T n_goodmembers = 0;
5726 GSC_GENOLEN_T* marker_coords = NULL;
5727
5728 GSC_GENOLEN_T endpt = first_marker + chr_nmembers[chr_ix];
5729 for (; current_marker < endpt; ++current_marker) { // simple recombination map, if possible
5730 if (markerlist[current_marker].name == NULL) {
5731 continue;
5732 }
5733
5734 if (!found_first) {
5735 GSC_GENOLEN_T coord;
5736 if (!gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(markerlist[current_marker].name, d->genome, &coord)) {
5737 could_not_match++;
5738 } else {
5739 found_first = GSC_TRUE;
5740 first_marker = current_marker;
5741 firsts_coord_in_genome = coord;
5742 lgdists[n_goodmembers] = (markerlist[current_marker].pos - markerlist[first_marker].pos) / chrdist;
5743 n_goodmembers++;
5744 }
5745 } else if (firsts_coord_in_genome + n_goodmembers < d->genome.n_markers &&
5746 strcmp(markerlist[current_marker].name, d->genome.marker_names[firsts_coord_in_genome + n_goodmembers]) == 0) {
5747 // we are a simple linkage group still so far.
5748 lgdists[n_goodmembers] = (markerlist[current_marker].pos - markerlist[first_marker].pos) / chrdist;
5749 n_goodmembers++;
5750 } else {
5751 // Just discovered we are a reordered linkage group. Copy over the marker indexes that were as expected.
5752 marker_coords = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*marker_coords)*(chr_nmembers[chr_ix]),GSC_TRUE);
5753 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T backfill = 0; backfill < n_goodmembers; ++backfill) {
5754 marker_coords[backfill] = firsts_coord_in_genome + backfill;
5755 }
5756 break;
5757 }
5758
5759 }
5760 for (; current_marker < endpt; ++current_marker) { // reordered recombination map, if previous failed.
5761 if (markerlist[current_marker].name == NULL) {
5762 continue;
5763 }
5764
5765 GSC_GENOLEN_T coord;
5766 if (!gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(markerlist[current_marker].name, d->genome, &coord)) {
5767 ++could_not_match;
5768 } else {
5769 marker_coords[n_goodmembers] = coord;
5770 lgdists[n_goodmembers] = (markerlist[current_marker].pos - markerlist[first_marker].pos) / chrdist;
5771 ++n_goodmembers;
5772 }
5773 }
5774
5775 if (n_goodmembers == 0) { // || firsts_coord_in_genome >= d->genome.n_markers) {
5776 n_bad_chr++;
5777 } else if (marker_coords == NULL) {
5778 GSC_GENOLEN_T chr_ix_actual = chr_ix-n_bad_chr;
5779 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].type = GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE;
5780 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.simple.expected_n_crossovers = chrdist / 100;
5781 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.simple.n_markers = n_goodmembers;
5782 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.simple.first_marker_index = firsts_coord_in_genome;
5783 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.simple.dists = lgdists;
5784 } else {
5785 GSC_GENOLEN_T chr_ix_actual = chr_ix-n_bad_chr;
5786 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].type = GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER;
5787 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.reorder.expected_n_crossovers = chrdist / 100;
5788 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.reorder.n_markers = n_goodmembers;
5789 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.reorder.marker_indexes = marker_coords;
5790 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.reorder.dists = lgdists;
5791 }
5792 }
5793 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(chr_nmembers);
5794 map.n_chr = map.n_chr-n_bad_chr;
5795 if (map.n_chr == 0) {
5796 GSC_FREE(map.chrs);
5797 return NO_MAP;
5798 }
5799 return gsc_helper_insert_recombmap_into_simdata(d, map);
5800}
5801
5802
5818gsc_MapID gsc_create_uniformspaced_recombmap(gsc_SimData* d,
5819 GSC_GENOLEN_T n_markers,
5820 char** markernames,
5821 double expected_n_recombinations) {
5822 gsc_RecombinationMap map = {.n_chr=1, .chrs=gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_LinkageGroup)*1, GSC_TRUE) };
5823
5824 if (markernames == NULL) {
5825 if (d->genome.n_markers == 0) return NO_MAP;
5826
5827 double* lgdists = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(double)*d->genome.n_markers,GSC_TRUE);
5828 double lgdist = 1./d->genome.n_markers;
5829 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < d->genome.n_markers; ++i) { lgdists[i] = lgdist; }
5830
5831 map.chrs[0].type = GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE;
5832 map.chrs[0].map.simple.expected_n_crossovers = expected_n_recombinations;
5833 map.chrs[0].map.simple.n_markers = d->genome.n_markers;
5834 map.chrs[0].map.simple.first_marker_index = 0;
5835 map.chrs[0].map.simple.dists = lgdists;
5836 } else {
5837 if (n_markers == 0) return NO_MAP;
5838
5839 // markernames could still be simple or reordered compared to the d->genome, so need to check that first.
5840 _Bool found_first = 0;
5841 GSC_GENOLEN_T could_not_match;
5842 GSC_GENOLEN_T firsts_coord_in_genome = d->genome.n_markers;
5843 GSC_GENOLEN_T chrmarker_ix = 0;
5844
5845 GSC_GENOLEN_T* marker_coords = NULL;
5846 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < n_markers; ++i) {
5847 if (!found_first || marker_coords != NULL) {
5848 // We are first or we are a reordered linkage group. Find what index in the genome the next marker is stored at.
5849 GSC_GENOLEN_T coord;
5850
5851 if (markernames[i] == NULL) {
5852 could_not_match++;
5853 } else if (!gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(markernames[i], d->genome, &coord )) {
5854 could_not_match++;
5855 } else if (!found_first) {
5856 found_first = 1;
5857 firsts_coord_in_genome = coord;
5858 chrmarker_ix++;
5859 } else { // must be the case that we have marker_coords != NULL and are a reordered linkage group
5860 marker_coords[chrmarker_ix] = coord;
5861 chrmarker_ix++;
5862 }
5863
5864 } else if (firsts_coord_in_genome < d->genome.n_markers &&
5865 strcmp(markernames[i], d->genome.marker_names[firsts_coord_in_genome + i]) == 0) {
5866 // are a simple linkage group still so far.
5867 chrmarker_ix++;
5868
5869 } else {
5870 // Just discovered we are a reordered linkage group. Copy over the marker indexes that were as expected.
5871 marker_coords = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*marker_coords)*n_markers,GSC_TRUE);
5872 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T backfill = 0; backfill < chrmarker_ix; ++backfill) {
5873 marker_coords[backfill] = firsts_coord_in_genome + backfill;
5874 }
5875
5876 if (markernames[i] == NULL) {
5877 could_not_match++;
5878 } else if (!gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(markernames[i], d->genome, &(marker_coords[chrmarker_ix]) )) {
5879 could_not_match++;
5880 } else {
5881 chrmarker_ix++;
5882 }
5883 }
5884 }
5885
5886 double* lgdists = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(double)*chrmarker_ix,GSC_TRUE);
5887 double lgdist = 1./n_markers;
5888 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < chrmarker_ix; ++i) { lgdists[i] = lgdist; }
5889
5890 if (marker_coords == NULL) {
5891 map.chrs[0].type = GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE;
5892 map.chrs[0].map.simple.expected_n_crossovers = expected_n_recombinations;
5893 map.chrs[0].map.simple.n_markers = chrmarker_ix;
5894 map.chrs[0].map.simple.first_marker_index = firsts_coord_in_genome;
5895 map.chrs[0].map.simple.dists = lgdists;
5896 } else {
5897 map.chrs[0].type = GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER;
5898 map.chrs[0].map.reorder.expected_n_crossovers = expected_n_recombinations;
5899 map.chrs[0].map.reorder.n_markers = chrmarker_ix;
5900 map.chrs[0].map.reorder.marker_indexes = marker_coords;
5901 map.chrs[0].map.reorder.dists = lgdists;
5902 }
5903 }
5904
5905 return gsc_helper_insert_recombmap_into_simdata(d,map);
5906}
5907
5945gsc_MapID gsc_load_mapfile(SimData* d, const char* filename) {
5946 if (filename == NULL) return NO_MAP;
5947
5948 struct gsc_MapfileUnit* mapcontents = NULL;
5949 size_t nrows = gsc_helper_parse_mapfile(filename,&mapcontents);
5950 if (nrows == 0 || mapcontents == NULL) {
5951 if (mapcontents != NULL) {
5952 GSC_FREE(mapcontents);
5953 }
5954 return NO_MAP;
5955 }
5956
5957 _Bool freeMapNames = 1;
5958 if (d->genome.n_markers > 0) {
5959 // if genome is already set, leftjoin on those markers.
5960 GSC_GENOLEN_T new_nrows = gsc_helper_str_markerlist_leftjoin(d->genome, nrows, &mapcontents);
5961 if (new_nrows < nrows) {
5962 printf("Discarded %lu markers when loading map %s because they do not appear in the primary map.\n", (long unsigned int) (nrows - new_nrows), filename);
5963 }
5964 nrows = new_nrows;
5965 gsc_helper_sort_markerlist(nrows,mapcontents);
5966 } else {
5967 // else set up the list of markers tracked by the simulation
5968 gsc_helper_sort_markerlist(nrows,mapcontents);
5969 d->genome = (gsc_KnownGenome){
5970 .n_markers = nrows,
5971 .marker_names = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char**)*nrows,GSC_TRUE),
5972 .names_alphabetical = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char**)*nrows,GSC_TRUE),
5973 .n_maps = 0,
5974 .map_ids = NULL,
5975 .maps = NULL
5976 };
5977 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < d->genome.n_markers; ++i) {
5978 d->genome.marker_names[i] = mapcontents[i].name;
5979 d->genome.names_alphabetical[i] = &(d->genome.marker_names[i]);
5980 }
5981 qsort(d->genome.names_alphabetical,d->genome.n_markers,sizeof(*d->genome.names_alphabetical),gsc_helper_indirect_alphabetical_str_comparer);
5982
5983 freeMapNames = 0;
5984 //printf( "Warning: loading genetic map before loading any founder genotypes. Many simulation operations will not yet run.\n");
5985 }
5986
5987 gsc_MapID map = gsc_create_recombmap_from_markerlist(d, nrows, mapcontents);
5988 if (freeMapNames) {
5989 for (size_t i = 0; i < nrows; ++i) {
5990 GSC_FREE(mapcontents[i].name);
5991 }
5992 }
5993 GSC_FREE(mapcontents);
5994
5995 return map;
5996}
5997
5998
6034gsc_EffectID gsc_load_effectfile(gsc_SimData* d, const char* filename) {
6035 if (filename == NULL) return GSC_NO_EFFECTSET;
6036 if (d->genome.n_markers == 0) return GSC_NO_EFFECTSET;
6037
6038 gsc_TableFileReader tf = gsc_tablefilereader_create(filename);
6039
6040 size_t row = 1;
6041 size_t col = 1;
6042
6043 gsc_TableFileCell cellsread[4] = { 0 };
6044 gsc_TableFileCell* cellqueue = cellsread;
6045 const char* titles[] = { "marker", "allele", "eff"};
6046 int colnums[] = { 1, 2, 3 };
6047 size_t queuesize;
6048 GSC_LOGICVAL header = gsc_helper_parse_3cell_header(&tf, titles, colnums, cellqueue, &queuesize);
6049 if (header == GSC_TRUE) {
6050 printf("(Loading %s) Format: effect file with header\n", filename);
6051 } else if (header == GSC_FALSE) {
6052 printf("(Loading %s) Format: effect file without header\n", filename);
6053 } else {
6054 printf("(Loading %s) Failure: Cannot identify the expected 3 columns of the effect file\n", filename);
6055 gsc_tablefilereader_close(&tf);
6056 return NO_EFFECTSET;
6057 }
6058 int marker_colnum = colnums[0], allele_colnum = colnums[1], eff_colnum = colnums[2];
6059
6060
6061 _Bool goodrow = (header) ? 0 : 1; // discard first row if it's a header, keep if it's not.
6062 size_t goodrow_counter = 0;
6063 GSC_ID_T allele_counter = 0;
6064
6065 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(effset_alleles,char,2);
6066 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(effset_rows,double*,2);
6067 GSC_ID_T n_effset_rows = 0;
6068
6069 GSC_GENOLEN_T markerix;
6070 char allele = '\0';
6071 GSC_ID_T alleleix = n_effset_rows + 1; // invalid value.
6072 double effect = 0;
6073 char* conversionflag;
6074
6075 gsc_TableFileCell ncell;
6076
6077 do {
6078 ncell = gsc_helper_tablefilereader_get_next_cell_wqueue(&tf, &cellqueue, &queuesize);
6079
6080 if (ncell.cell != NULL) { // so that we can cope with missing final newline
6081 // Update row/col position and save predecessor row
6082 if (ncell.predNewline) {
6083 if (goodrow && col >= 3) { // save predecessor row.
6084 if (alleleix == n_effset_rows) {
6085 ++allele_counter;
6086 ++n_effset_rows;
6087 if (effset_allelescap < n_effset_rows) {
6088 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(effset_alleles,2*n_effset_rows);
6089 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(effset_rows,2*n_effset_rows);
6090 }
6091 effset_alleles[alleleix] = allele;
6092 effset_rows[alleleix] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(double)*d->genome.n_markers,GSC_TRUE);
6093 memset(effset_rows[alleleix],0,sizeof(double)*d->genome.n_markers);
6094 }
6095 if (alleleix < n_effset_rows) { // this is specifically not an "else if"
6096 effset_rows[alleleix][markerix] = effect;
6097 ++goodrow_counter;
6098 }
6099 }
6100 row += ncell.predNewline;
6101 goodrow = 1;
6102 col = 1;
6103 }
6104 col += (ncell.predCol > 0) ? 1 : 0; // multiple column spacers treated as one
6105
6106 // Parse this cell
6107 if (ncell.cell_len == 0) {
6108 goodrow = 0;
6109 } else if (col == marker_colnum) {
6110 char tmp = ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len]; ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = '\0';
6111 _Bool validmarker = gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(ncell.cell,d->genome,&markerix);
6112 ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = tmp;
6113 if (!validmarker) {
6114 goodrow = 0;
6115 //fprintf(stderr,"Entry at row %i column %i of file %s does not match the name of a tracked marker\n", row, marker_colnum, filename);
6116 }
6117
6118 } else if (col == allele_colnum) {
6119 if (ncell.cell_len > 1) {
6120 goodrow = 0;
6121 //fprintf(stderr,"Entry at row %i column %i of file %s was too long to represent a single allele\n", row, allele_colnum, filename);
6122 }
6123 allele = ncell.cell[0];
6124 for (alleleix = 0; alleleix < n_effset_rows; ++alleleix) {
6125 if (effset_alleles[alleleix] == allele) {
6126 break;
6127 }
6128 } // leave this loop with alleleix set to match the allele, or equal to n_effset_rows if it's a new allele.
6129
6130 } else if (col == eff_colnum) {
6131 char tmp = ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len]; ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = '\0';
6132 effect = strtod(ncell.cell,&conversionflag);
6133 ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = tmp;
6134 if (conversionflag != ncell.cell + ncell.cell_len) { // unsuccessful read
6135 goodrow = 0;
6136 //fprintf(stderr,"Entry at row %i column %i of file %s could not be parsed as a numeric value\n", row, eff_colnum, filename);
6137 }
6138
6139 } else {
6140 goodrow = 0;
6141 }
6142
6143 // Reset
6144 if (!ncell.isCellShallow) { GSC_FREE(ncell.cell); }
6145 }
6146 } while (!ncell.eof);
6147
6148 if (col == 3 && goodrow) { // save predecessor row
6149 ++goodrow_counter;
6150 if (alleleix == n_effset_rows) {
6151 ++allele_counter;
6152 ++n_effset_rows;
6153 if (effset_allelescap < n_effset_rows) {
6154 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(effset_alleles,2*n_effset_rows);
6155 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(effset_rows,2*n_effset_rows);
6156 }
6157 effset_alleles[alleleix] = allele;
6158 effset_rows[alleleix] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(double)*d->genome.n_markers,GSC_TRUE);
6159 memset(effset_rows[alleleix],0,sizeof(double)*d->genome.n_markers);
6160 }
6161 effset_rows[alleleix][markerix] = effect;
6162 }
6163
6164 printf("(Loading %s) %lu effect value(s) spanning %lu allele(s) were loaded. Failed to parse %lu line(s).\n",
6165 filename, (long unsigned int) goodrow_counter, (long unsigned int) allele_counter, (long unsigned int) (row - header - goodrow_counter));
6166 gsc_tablefilereader_close(&tf);
6167
6168 if (n_effset_rows > 0) {
6169 gsc_EffectMatrix effset = { 0 };
6170 GSC_FINALISE_BUFFER(effset_alleles, effset.effect_names, n_effset_rows);
6171 GSC_FINALISE_BUFFER(effset_rows, effset.effects.matrix, n_effset_rows);
6172 effset.effects.rows = n_effset_rows;
6173 effset.effects.cols = d->genome.n_markers;
6174 return gsc_helper_insert_eff_set_into_simdata(d, effset);
6175 } else {
6176 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(effset_alleles);
6177 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(effset_rows);
6178 return GSC_NO_EFFECTSET;
6179 }
6180}
6181
6188static enum gsc_GenotypeFileCellStyle gsc_helper_genotype_matrix_identify_cell_style(gsc_TableFileCell c) {
6189 switch (c.cell_len) {
6190 case 1:
6191 switch (c.cell[0]) {
6192 case '0':
6193 case '1':
6194 case '2':
6195 return GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_COUNT;
6196 case 'G': // G
6197 case 'A': // A
6198 case 'T': // T
6199 case 'C': // C
6200 case 'R': // G/A
6201 case 'Y': // T/C
6202 case 'M': // A/C
6203 case 'K': // G/T
6204 case 'S': // G/C
6205 case 'W': // A/T
6206 case 'N': // any
6207 return GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_ENCODED;
6208 default:
6209 break;
6210 }
6211 break;
6212 case 2:
6213 if (c.cell[0] == 'm') { // m[numeric] case, which is probably a marker not an allele pair
6214 switch (c.cell[1]) {
6215 case '0':
6216 case '1':
6217 case '2':
6218 case '3':
6219 case '4':
6220 case '5':
6221 case '6':
6222 case '7':
6223 case '8':
6224 case '9':
6225 return GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_UNKNOWN;
6226 default:
6227 break;
6228 }
6229 }
6230 return GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_PAIR;
6231 case 3:
6232 if (c.cell[1] == '/') {
6233 return GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_SLASHPAIR;
6234 }
6235 break;
6236 default:
6237 break;
6238 }
6239 return GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_UNKNOWN;
6240}
6241
6247static void gsc_helper_genotypecell_to_allelematrix(GenoLocation loc,
6248 GSC_GENOLEN_T markerix,
6249 enum gsc_GenotypeFileCellStyle style,
6250 char* cell,
6251 gsc_SimData* forrng) {
6252 char* pos = loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos] + 2*markerix;
6253 int phase = 0;
6254 switch (style) {
6255 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_PAIR:
6256 pos[0] = cell[0];
6257 pos[1] = cell[1];
6258 break;
6259 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_SLASHPAIR:
6260 pos[0] = cell[0];
6261 pos[1] = cell[2];
6262 break;
6263 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_COUNT:
6264 switch (cell[0]) {
6265 case '0':
6266 pos[0] = 'T';
6267 pos[1] = 'T';
6268 break;
6269 case '1':
6270 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6271 pos[phase] = 'A';
6272 pos[1-phase] = 'T';
6273 break;
6274 case '2':
6275 pos[0] = 'A';
6276 pos[1] = 'A';
6277 break;
6278 }
6279 break;
6280 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_ENCODED:
6281 switch (cell[0]) {
6282 case 'G': // G
6283 pos[0] = 'G';
6284 pos[1] = 'G';
6285 break;
6286 case 'A': // A
6287 pos[0] = 'A';
6288 pos[1] = 'A';
6289 break;
6290 case 'T': // T
6291 pos[0] = 'T';
6292 pos[1] = 'T';
6293 break;
6294 case 'C': // C
6295 pos[0] = 'C';
6296 pos[1] = 'C';
6297 break;
6298 case 'R': // G/A
6299 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6300 pos[phase] = 'G';
6301 pos[1-phase] = 'A';
6302 break;
6303 case 'Y': // T/C
6304 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6305 pos[phase] = 'T';
6306 pos[1-phase] = 'C';
6307 break;
6308 case 'M': // A/C
6309 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6310 pos[phase] = 'A';
6311 pos[1-phase] = 'C';
6312 break;
6313 case 'K': // G/T
6314 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6315 pos[phase] = 'G';
6316 pos[1-phase] = 'T';
6317 break;
6318 case 'S': // G/C
6319 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6320 pos[phase] = 'G';
6321 pos[1-phase] = 'C';
6322 break;
6323 case 'W': // A/T
6324 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6325 pos[phase] = 'A';
6326 pos[1-phase] = 'T';
6327 break;
6328 default:
6329 break;
6330 }
6331 break;
6332 default: break;
6333 }
6334}
6335
6339static struct gsc_EmptyListNavigator gsc_create_emptylistnavigator(gsc_SimData* d,
6340 gsc_GroupNum allocation_group) {
6341 struct gsc_EmptyListNavigator me = { .d=d,
6342 .localPos = 0,
6343 .alloctogroup = allocation_group,
6344 .currentid = d->current_id };
6345 me.firstAM = gsc_create_empty_allelematrix(me.d->genome.n_markers,
6346 me.d->n_labels,
6347 me.d->label_defaults, 0);
6348 me.localAM = me.firstAM;
6349 return me;
6350}
6351
6356static gsc_GenoLocation gsc_emptylistnavigator_get_first(struct gsc_EmptyListNavigator* it) {
6357 it->localAM = it->firstAM;
6358 it->localPos = 0;
6359 if (1 > it->localAM->n_genotypes) {
6360 it->localAM->n_genotypes = 1;
6361 it->localAM->alleles[0] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * (it->localAM->n_markers<<1),GSC_TRUE);
6362 memset(it->localAM->alleles[0], 0, sizeof(char) * (it->localAM->n_markers<<1));
6363 it->localAM->names[0] = NULL;
6364 it->localAM->groups[0] = it->alloctogroup;
6365 ++(it->currentid.id);
6366 it->localAM->ids[0] = it->currentid;
6367 }
6368 return (gsc_GenoLocation){.localAM=it->localAM, .localPos =it->localPos};
6369}
6370
6375static gsc_GenoLocation gsc_emptylistnavigator_get_next(struct gsc_EmptyListNavigator* it) {
6376 if (CONTIG_WIDTH - 1 == it->localPos) {
6377 if (NULL == it->localAM->next) {
6378 gsc_AlleleMatrix* next = gsc_create_empty_allelematrix(it->d->genome.n_markers,
6379 it->d->n_labels,
6380 it->d->label_defaults, 0);
6381 it->localAM->next = next;
6382 it->localAM = next;
6383 it->localPos = 0;
6384 } else {
6385 it->localAM = it->localAM->next;
6386 it->localPos = 0;
6387 }
6388 } else {
6389 ++(it->localPos);
6390 }
6391
6392 if (it->localAM->n_genotypes <= it->localPos) {
6393 if (1 < it->localPos - it->localAM->n_genotypes) {
6394 fprintf(stderr,"EmptyListNavigator invalid\n");
6395 return INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
6396 }
6397 ++(it->localAM->n_genotypes);
6398
6399 it->localAM->alleles[it->localPos] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * (it->localAM->n_markers<<1),GSC_TRUE);
6400 memset(it->localAM->alleles[it->localPos], 0, sizeof(char) * (it->localAM->n_markers<<1));
6401 it->localAM->names[it->localPos] = NULL;
6402 it->localAM->groups[it->localPos] = it->alloctogroup;
6403 ++(it->currentid.id);
6404 it->localAM->ids[it->localPos] = it->currentid;
6405 }
6406
6407 return (gsc_GenoLocation){.localAM=it->localAM, .localPos =it->localPos};
6408}
6409
6414static void gsc_emptylistnavigator_finaliselist(struct gsc_EmptyListNavigator* it) {
6415 if (NULL == it->d->m) {
6416 it->d->m = it->firstAM;
6417 } else {
6418 gsc_AlleleMatrix* listend = it->d->m;
6419 while (NULL != listend->next) {
6420 listend = listend->next;
6421 }
6422 listend->next = it->firstAM;
6423 gsc_condense_allele_matrix(it->d);
6424 }
6425 it->d->current_id = it->currentid;
6426}
6427
6454static struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_detect_orientation(
6455 const SimData* d,
6456 const gsc_TableFileCell* cellqueue,
6457 const size_t firstrowlen,
6458 const size_t queuelen,
6459 struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat format,
6460 const char* filenameforlog) {
6461
6462 if (format.markers_as_rows == GSC_TRUE || format.markers_as_rows == GSC_FALSE) {
6463 // pass
6464 } else if (d->genome.n_maps == 0) {
6465 // If there is no genetic map, we cannot check the row/column headers to see if any of them match the marker names..
6466 // Default to markers being rows
6467
6468 printf("(Loading %s) Format axis: genetic markers are -rows-, founder lines are |columns| (by assumption when no genetic map is loaded)\n", filenameforlog);
6469 printf("(Loading %s) No genetic map is loaded, will invent a map with equal spacing of these genetic markers (1cM apart)\n", filenameforlog);
6470 format.markers_as_rows = GSC_TRUE;
6471
6472 } else if (format.has_header == GSC_FALSE) {
6473 printf("(Loading %s) Format axis: genetic markers are -rows-, founder lines are |columns| "
6474 "(by assumption when matrix has no header row)\n", filenameforlog);
6475 format.markers_as_rows = GSC_TRUE;
6476
6477 } else {
6478 // Note: by here, either the user has told us there is a header row, or we get to detect whether there is one. So will investigate it by comparing names to what's in our map
6479 // taken from older function gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_check_markers_are_rows
6480 int firstsafeheaderindex = -1;
6481 if (firstrowlen > 1) {
6482 firstsafeheaderindex = 1;
6483 } else if (firstrowlen == 1 && queuelen > firstrowlen + 1) { // second row has more than one cell read.
6484 firstsafeheaderindex = 0; // assume there's no corner cell
6485 format.has_header = GSC_TRUE;
6486 }
6487
6488 if (firstsafeheaderindex >= 0) {
6489 // Don't check the "first" cell. It might be a corner cell between the two headers, whose value should be ignored
6490 // Check the next cell in the first row.
6491 if (gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(cellqueue[firstsafeheaderindex].cell, d->genome, NULL)) {
6492 printf("(Loading %s) Format axis: genetic markers are |columns|, founder lines are -rows-\n", filenameforlog);
6493 format.markers_as_rows = GSC_FALSE;
6494 format.has_header = GSC_TRUE;
6495 return format;
6496 }
6497
6498 // If that wasn't a match, check the first row header, if it exists:
6499 if (queuelen > firstrowlen && !cellqueue[firstrowlen].eof &&
6500 gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(cellqueue[firstrowlen].cell, d->genome, NULL)) {
6501 printf("(Loading %s) Format axis: genetic markers are -rows-, founder lines are |columns|\n", filenameforlog);
6502 format.markers_as_rows = GSC_TRUE;
6503 return format;
6504 }
6505
6506 // Check remaining column headers
6507 for (size_t i = firstsafeheaderindex + 1; i < firstrowlen; ++i) {
6508 if (gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(cellqueue[i].cell, d->genome, NULL)) {
6509 printf("(Loading %s) Format axis: genetic markers are |columns|, founder lines are -rows-\n", filenameforlog);
6510 format.markers_as_rows = GSC_FALSE;
6511 format.has_header = GSC_TRUE;
6512 return format;
6513 }
6514 }
6515
6516 }
6517 printf("(Loading %s) Format axis: genetic markers are -rows-, founder lines are |columns| (by default file format)\n", filenameforlog);
6518 format.markers_as_rows = GSC_TRUE;
6519 }
6520 return format;
6521
6522}
6523
6535static struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_detect_cellstyle(
6536 const gsc_TableFileCell* cellqueue,
6537 const size_t firstrowlen,
6538 const size_t queuelen,
6539 struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat format,
6540 const char* filenameforlog) {
6541
6542 _Bool style_detected = 0;
6543 _Bool single_col_file = 0;
6544 // 1. Detect format if not yet provided.
6545 if (format.cell_style == GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_UNKNOWN) {
6546 style_detected = 1;
6547
6548 if (firstrowlen == queuelen || cellqueue[firstrowlen].eof) { // There is only one row. Short-circuiting necessary
6549 // if there is also only one column, we have no body cells to detect the style of
6550 if (firstrowlen > 1) {
6551 // Detection path for a single-line file. If it has a header, then this value might end up ignored
6552 format.cell_style = gsc_helper_genotype_matrix_identify_cell_style(cellqueue[1]);
6553 } else {
6554 single_col_file = 1; // one-cell file. needs the warning.
6555 }
6556 } else { // there is more than one row
6557 // If there is only one column, there are no body cells with style to detect
6558 if (firstrowlen + 1 < queuelen && cellqueue[firstrowlen+1].predNewline < 1) {
6559 // Detection path. There exists a second cell on the second line that we can read
6560 format.cell_style = gsc_helper_genotype_matrix_identify_cell_style(cellqueue[firstrowlen+1]);
6561 } else {
6562 single_col_file = 1;
6563 }
6564 }
6565 }
6566
6567 // 2. Print cell style detection logs
6568 if (style_detected) {
6569 switch(format.cell_style) {
6570 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_PAIR: printf("(Loading %s) Allele format: phased allele pairs\n", filenameforlog); break;
6571 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_SLASHPAIR: printf("(Loading %s) Allele format: phased allele pairs (slash-separated)\n", filenameforlog); break;
6572 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_COUNT: printf("(Loading %s) Allele format: reference allele counts (phase will be randomised)\n", filenameforlog); break;
6573 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_ENCODED: printf("(Loading %s) Allele format: IUPAC encoded pair (phase will be randomised)\n", filenameforlog); break;
6574 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_UNKNOWN:
6575 if (single_col_file || firstrowlen == queuelen ||
6576 (firstrowlen + 1 == queuelen && cellqueue[firstrowlen].eof && cellqueue[firstrowlen].cell_len == 0)) {
6577 printf("(Loading %s) Warning: empty genotype matrix. No genotypes will be loaded.\n", filenameforlog);
6578 } else {
6579 fprintf(stderr,"(Loading %s) Failure: Unable to determine the formatting of pairs of alleles."
6580 " Check genomicSimulation manual for accepted allele pair encodings\n", filenameforlog);
6581 }
6582 }
6583 }
6584
6585 return format;
6586}
6587
6615static struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_detect_header(
6616 const gsc_TableFileCell* cellqueue,
6617 const size_t firstrowlen,
6618 const size_t queuelen,
6619 struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat format,
6620 const char* filenameforlog) {
6621 // Validity check: if genetic markers are columns, header row is mandatory
6622 if (format.has_header == GSC_FALSE && format.markers_as_rows == GSC_FALSE) {
6623 printf("(Loading %s) Failure: genetic markers cannot be represented by columns when matrix has no header row\n", filenameforlog);
6624 format.has_header = GSC_NA;
6625 return format;
6626 }
6627
6628 // Detect header if we need to detect it.
6629 if (format.has_header != GSC_FALSE && format.has_header != GSC_TRUE) {
6630 if (firstrowlen == 1) {
6631 // we could have a single-column file (no header assumed), or
6632 // we could be a two-column file with no corner cell (must have a header)
6633 if (queuelen > 2) {
6634 if (cellqueue[2].eof || cellqueue[2].predNewline) {
6635 format.has_header = GSC_FALSE; // single column file
6636 } else {
6637 format.has_header = GSC_TRUE;
6638 }
6639 } // else can't draw any conclusions.
6640
6641 } else if (format.cell_style != GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_UNKNOWN) {
6642 // Idea: if we find a cell in the first row that doesn't match the expected cell style, then that first row is probably a header
6643 format.has_header = GSC_FALSE;
6644 for (size_t i = 1; i < firstrowlen; ++i) { // ignore first cell in row, it could be a corner cell or row header
6645 if (gsc_helper_genotype_matrix_identify_cell_style(cellqueue[i]) != format.cell_style) {
6646 format.has_header = GSC_TRUE;
6647 break;
6648 }
6649 }
6650 } // else don't know how to detect.
6651
6652 switch (format.has_header) {
6653 case GSC_FALSE: printf("(Loading %s) Format: genotype matrix without header row\n", filenameforlog); break;
6654 case GSC_TRUE: printf("(Loading %s) Format: genotype matrix with header row\n", filenameforlog); break;
6655 default: fprintf(stderr,"(Loading %s) Failure: Unable to determine whether file has header row\n", filenameforlog); break;
6656 }
6657 }
6658
6659 return format;
6660}
6661
6677static GSC_LOGICVAL gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_detect_cornercell_presence(
6678 const size_t ncellsfirstrow,
6679 const size_t ncellssecondrow,
6680 const _Bool secondrowheaderisempty) {
6681 if (ncellssecondrow == ncellsfirstrow + 1) {
6682 return GSC_FALSE;
6683 } else if (ncellssecondrow == ncellsfirstrow) {
6684 if (secondrowheaderisempty) {
6685 return GSC_FALSE; //genotype name is simply empty, making the second row look one column shorter than reality
6686 } else {
6687 return GSC_TRUE;
6688 }
6689 } else if (ncellssecondrow == ncellsfirstrow - 1 && secondrowheaderisempty) {
6690 return GSC_TRUE; // genotype name on row 2 is empty but corner cell is not
6691 } else {
6692 return GSC_NA;
6693 }
6694}
6695
6721gsc_FileFormatSpec gsc_define_matrix_format_details(const GSC_LOGICVAL has_header,
6722 const GSC_LOGICVAL markers_as_rows,
6723 const enum gsc_GenotypeFileCellStyle cell_style) {
6724 return (FileFormatSpec){.filetype=GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_MATRIX,
6725 .spec={(struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat){.cell_style=cell_style,
6726 .has_header=has_header,
6727 .markers_as_rows=markers_as_rows}}};
6728}
6729
6745static gsc_GroupNum gsc_load_genotypefile_matrix(gsc_SimData* d,
6746 const char* filename,
6747 const gsc_FileFormatSpec format) {
6748 if (filename == NULL) return NO_GROUP;
6749 if (format.filetype != GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_MATRIX && format.filetype != GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_UNKNOWN) {
6750 fprintf(stderr,"Non-genotype-matrix format specification provided to genotype matrix file loader function\n");
