9563 // identify the index of this marker and save it in the temporary marker buffer `markerbuffer`
9564 GSC_GENOLEN_T markerindex;
9565 if (gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(markername, d->genome, &markerindex)) {
9566 ++(blocks.num_markers_in_block[bi]);
9567 markerbuffer[mi] = markerindex;
9568 ++mi;
9569 }
9570
9571 ni = 0;
9572 } else {
9573 markername[ni] = c;
9574 ++ni;
9575 }
9576 }
9577
9578 // copy the markers belonging to this block into the struct
9579 blocks.markers_in_block[bi] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(GSC_GENOLEN_T) * mi,GSC_TRUE);
9580 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < mi; ++i) {
9581 blocks.markers_in_block[bi][i] = markerbuffer[i];
9582 }
9583
9584 ++bi;
9585 }
9586
9587 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(markerbuffer);
9588 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(markername);
9589 fclose(infile);
9590 return blocks;
9591}
9592
9621void gsc_calculate_group_local_bvs(const gsc_SimData* d,
9622 const gsc_MarkerBlocks b,
9623 const gsc_EffectID effID,
9624 const char* output_file,
9625 const gsc_GroupNum group) {
9626 const GSC_ID_T effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
9627 if (effIndex == GSC_NA_IDX) {
9628 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %lu\n", (long unsigned int) effID.id);
9629 return;
9630 }
9631 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
9632
9633 FILE* outfile;
9634 if ((outfile = fopen(output_file, "w")) == NULL) {
9635 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s.\n", output_file); exit(1);
9636 }
9637
9638 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(buffer,char,CONTIG_WIDTH);
9639
9640 GSC_GLOBALX_T gsize = gsc_get_group_size(d, group);
9641 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(ggenos,char*,gsize);
9642 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(gnames,char*,gsize);
9643 gsc_get_group_genes(d, group, gsize, ggenos);
9644 gsc_get_group_names(d, group, gsize, gnames);
9645 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(gids,gsc_PedigreeID,gsize);
9646 gsc_get_group_ids(d,group,gsize,gids);
9647
9648 double beffect;
9649
9650 // for each group member
9651 for (GSC_GLOBALX_T i = 0; i < gsize; ++i) {
9652 // for each block
9653 if (gnames[i] != NULL) {
9654 sprintf(buffer, "%s_1", gnames[i]);
9655 } else {
9656 sprintf(buffer, "%lu_1", (long unsigned int) gids[i].id);
9657 }
9658 fwrite(buffer, sizeof(char), strlen(buffer), outfile);
9659
9660 // for each block
9661 for (GSC_ID_T j = 0; j < b.num_blocks; ++j) {
9662 beffect = 0;
9663
9664 // calculate the local BV
9665 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T k = 0; k < b.num_markers_in_block[j]; ++k) {
9666 for (int q = 0; q < e.effects.rows; ++q) {
9667 if (ggenos[i][2 * b.markers_in_block[j][k]] == e.effect_names[q]) {
9668 beffect += e.effects.matrix[q][b.markers_in_block[j][k]];
9669 }
9670 }
9671 }
9672
9673 // print the local BV
9674 fprintf(outfile, " %lf", beffect);
9675 fflush(outfile);
9676 }
9677
9678 if (gnames[i] != NULL) {
9679 sprintf(buffer, "\n%s_2", gnames[i]);
9680 } else {
9681 sprintf(buffer, "\n%lu_2", (long unsigned int) gids[i].id);
9682 }
9683 fwrite(buffer, sizeof(char), strlen(buffer), outfile);
9684
9685 // for each block for the second haplotype
9686 for (GSC_ID_T j = 0; j < b.num_blocks; ++j) {
9687 beffect = 0;
9688 // calculate the local BV
9689 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T k = 0; k < b.num_markers_in_block[j]; ++k) {
9690 for (int q = 0; q < e.effects.rows; ++q) {
9691 if (ggenos[i][2 * b.markers_in_block[j][k] + 1] == e.effect_names[q]) {
9692 beffect += e.effects.matrix[q][b.markers_in_block[j][k]];
9693 }
9694 }
9695 }
9696
9697 // print the local BV
9698 fprintf(outfile, " %lf", beffect);
9699 fflush(outfile);
9700 }
9701 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, outfile);
9702 }
9703
9704 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(ggenos);
9705 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(gnames);
9706 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(gids);
9707 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(buffer);
9708 fflush(outfile);
9709 fclose(outfile);
9710}
9711
9738void gsc_calculate_local_bvs(const gsc_SimData* d,
9739 const gsc_MarkerBlocks b,
9740 const gsc_EffectID effID,
9741 const char* output_file) {
9742 const GSC_ID_T effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
9743 if (effIndex == GSC_NA_IDX) {
9744 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %lu\n", (long unsigned int) effID.id);
9745 return;
9746 }
9747 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
9748
9749 FILE* outfile;
9750 if ((outfile = fopen(output_file, "w")) == NULL) {
9751 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s.\n", output_file); exit(1);
9752 }
9753
9754 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(buffer,char,CONTIG_WIDTH);
9755
9756 double beffect;
9757
9758 // for each group member
9759 AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
9760 GSC_GLOBALX_T total_i = 0;
9761 do {
9762 for (GSC_LOCALX_T i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i, ++total_i) {
9763 // for each group member
9764 if (m->names[i] != NULL) {
9765 sprintf(buffer, "%s_1", m->names[i]);
9766 } else {
9767 sprintf(buffer, "%lu_1", (long unsigned int) m->ids[i].id);
9768 }
9769 fwrite(buffer, sizeof(char), strlen(buffer), outfile);
9770
9771 // for each block
9772 for (GSC_ID_T j = 0; j < b.num_blocks; ++j) {
9773 beffect = 0;
9774
9775 // calculate the local BV
9776 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T k = 0; k < b.num_markers_in_block[j]; ++k) {
9777 for (int q = 0; q < e.effects.rows; ++q) {
9778 if (m->alleles[i][2 * b.markers_in_block[j][k]] == e.effect_names[q]) {
9779 beffect += e.effects.matrix[q][b.markers_in_block[j][k]];
9780 }
9781 }
9782 }
9783
9784 // print the local BV
9785 fprintf(outfile, " %lf", beffect);
9786 fflush(outfile);
9787 }
9788
9789 if (m->names[i] != NULL) {
9790 sprintf(buffer, "\n%s_2", m->names[i]);
9791 } else {
9792 sprintf(buffer, "\n%lu_2", (long unsigned int) m->ids[i].id);
9793 }
9794 fwrite(buffer, sizeof(char), strlen(buffer), outfile);
9795
9796 // for each block for the second haplotype
9797 for (GSC_ID_T j = 0; j < b.num_blocks; ++j) {
9798 beffect = 0;
9799 // calculate the local BV
9800 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T k = 0; k < b.num_markers_in_block[j]; ++k) {
9801 for (int q = 0; q < e.effects.rows; ++q) {
9802 if (m->alleles[i][2 * b.markers_in_block[j][k] + 1] == e.effect_names[q]) {
9803 beffect += e.effects.matrix[q][b.markers_in_block[j][k]];
9804 }
9805 }
9806 }
9807
9808 // print the local BV
9809 fprintf(outfile, " %lf", beffect);
9810 fflush(outfile);
9811 }
9812 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, outfile);
9813 }
9814 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
9815
9816 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(buffer);
9817 fflush(outfile);
9818 fclose(outfile);
9819}
9820
9837char* gsc_calculate_optimal_haplotype(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_EffectID effID) {
9838 const GSC_ID_T effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
9839 if (effIndex == GSC_NA_IDX) {
9840 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %lu\n", (long unsigned int) effID.id);
9841 return NULL;
9842 }
9843 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
9844
9845 char* optimal = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*optimal)* (d->genome.n_markers + 1),GSC_TRUE);
9846
9847 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < d->genome.n_markers; ++i) {
9848 char best_allele = e.effect_names[0];
9849 double best_score = e.effects.matrix[0][i];
9850 for (int a = 1; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
9851 if (e.effects.matrix[a][i] > best_score) {
9852 best_score = e.effects.matrix[a][i];
9853 best_allele = e.effect_names[a];
9854 }
9855 }
9856 optimal[i] = best_allele;
9857 }
9858 optimal[d->genome.n_markers] = '\0';
9859 return optimal;
9860}
9861
9862
9878char* gsc_calculate_optimal_possible_haplotype(const gsc_SimData* d,
9879 const gsc_GroupNum group,
9880 const gsc_EffectID effID) {
9881 const GSC_ID_T effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
9882 if (effIndex == GSC_NA_IDX) {
9883 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %lu\n", (long unsigned int) effID.id);
9884 return NULL;
9885 }
9886 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
9887 // assumes no alleles in the matrix are spaces.
9888
9889 GSC_GLOBALX_T gsize = gsc_get_group_size(d, group);
9890 if (gsize == 0) {
9891 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent group %lu\n", (long unsigned int) group.num);
9892 return NULL;
9893 }
9894 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(ggenes,char*,gsize);
9895 gsc_get_group_genes(d, group, gsize, ggenes);
9896
9897 char* optimal = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*optimal)* (d->genome.n_markers + 1),GSC_TRUE);
9898
9899 // for each locus
9900 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T j = 0; j < d->genome.n_markers; ++j) {
9901 char best_allele = '\0';
9902 double best_score;
9903 for (GSC_GLOBALX_T i = 0; i < gsize; ++i) {
9904
9905 // If the allele is different to the previous best (guaranteed if best_allele is not initialised)
9906 if (ggenes[i][2*j] != best_allele) {
9907 // Find it and see if it scores better.
9908 for (int a = 0; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
9909
9910 if (e.effect_names[a] == ggenes[i][2*j] &&
9911 (best_allele == '\0' || e.effects.matrix[a][j] > best_score)) { // if it scores better than current best
9912
9913 best_allele = ggenes[i][2*j];
9914 best_score = e.effects.matrix[a][j];
9915
9916 break;
9917 }
9918
9919 }
9920 }
9921
9922 // Repeat for second allele of the group member at that locus
9923 if (ggenes[i][2*j + 1] != best_allele) {
9924 // Find it and see if it scores better.
9925 for (int a = 0; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
9926
9927 if (e.effect_names[a] == ggenes[i][2*j + 1] &&
9928 (best_allele == '\0' || e.effects.matrix[a][j] > best_score)) { // if it scores better than current best
9929
9930 best_allele = ggenes[i][2*j + 1];
9931 best_score = e.effects.matrix[a][j];
9932
9933 break;
9934 }
9935
9936 }
9937 }
9938 }
9939 optimal[j] = best_allele;
9940 }
9941
9942 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(ggenes);
9943 optimal[d->genome.n_markers] = '\0';
9944 return optimal;
9945}
9946
9947
9959double gsc_calculate_optimal_bv(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_EffectID effID) {
9960 const GSC_ID_T effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
9961 if (effIndex == GSC_NA_IDX) {
9962 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %lu\n", (long unsigned int) effID.id);
9963 return 0;
9964 }
9965 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
9966
9967 double best_gebv = 0;
9968
9969 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < d->genome.n_markers; ++i) {
9970 // Find the allele with the highest effect
9971 double best_score = e.effects.matrix[0][i];
9972 for (int a = 1; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
9973 if (e.effects.matrix[a][i] > best_score) {
9974 best_score = e.effects.matrix[a][i];
9975 }
9976 }
9977
9978 // add that highest allele to the score twice over
9979 best_gebv += (2*best_score);
9980 }
9981
9982 return best_gebv;
9983}
9984
10001double gsc_calculate_optimal_possible_bv(const gsc_SimData* d,
10002 const gsc_GroupNum group,
10003 const gsc_EffectID effID) {
10004 const GSC_ID_T effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
10005 if (effIndex == GSC_NA_IDX) {
10006 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %lu\n", (long unsigned int) effID.id);
10007 return 0;
10008 }
10009 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
10010
10011 // assumes no alleles in the matrix are spaces.
10012
10013 GSC_GLOBALX_T gsize = gsc_get_group_size(d, group);
10014 if (gsize == 0) {
10015 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent group %lu\n", (long unsigned int) group.num);
10016 return 0;
10017 }
10018 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(ggenes,char*,gsize);
10019 gsc_get_group_genes(d, group, gsize, ggenes);
10020
10021 double total_score = 0;
10022 char best_allele;
10023 double best_score;
10024
10025 // for each locus
10026 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T j = 0; j < d->genome.n_markers; ++j) {
10027 best_allele = '\0';
10028 best_score = 0;
10029 for (GSC_GLOBALX_T i = 0; i < gsize; ++i) {
10030
10031 // If the allele is different to the previous best (guaranteed if best_allele is not initialised)
10032 if (ggenes[i][2*j] != best_allele) {
10033 // Find it and see if it scores better.
10034 for (int a = 0; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
10035
10036 if (e.effect_names[a] == ggenes[i][2*j] &&
10037 (best_allele == '\0' || e.effects.matrix[a][j] > best_score)) { // if it scores better than current best
10038
10039 best_allele = ggenes[i][2*j];
10040 best_score = e.effects.matrix[a][j];
10041
10042 break;
10043 }
10044
10045 }
10046 }
10047
10048 // Repeat for second allele of the group member at that locus
10049 if (ggenes[i][2*j + 1] != best_allele) {
10050 // Find it and see if it scores better.
10051 for (int a = 0; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
10052
10053 if (e.effect_names[a] == ggenes[i][2*j + 1] &&
10054 (best_allele == '\0' || e.effects.matrix[a][j] > best_score)) { // if it scores better than current best
10055
10056 best_allele = ggenes[i][2*j + 1];
10057 best_score = e.effects.matrix[a][j];
10058
10059 break;
10060 }
10061
10062 }
10063 }
10064 }
10065 total_score += (2*best_score);
10066 }
10067
10068 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(ggenes);
10069 return total_score;
10070}
10071
10083double gsc_calculate_minimal_bv(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_EffectID effID) {
10084 const GSC_ID_T effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
10085 if (effIndex == GSC_NA_IDX) {
10086 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %lu\n", (long unsigned int) effID.id);
10087 return 0;
10088 }
10089 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
10090
10091 double worst_gebv = 0;
10092 double worst_score;
10093
10094 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < d->genome.n_markers; ++i) {
10095 // Find the allele with the highest effect
10096 worst_score = e.effects.matrix[0][i];
10097 for (int a = 1; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
10098 if (e.effects.matrix[a][i] < worst_score) {
10099 worst_score = e.effects.matrix[a][i];
10100 }
10101 }
10102
10103 // add that highest allele to the score twice over
10104 worst_gebv += (2*worst_score);
10105 }
10106
10107 return worst_gebv;
10108}
10109
10110/*--------------------------------Saving-----------------------------------*/
10111
10129void gsc_save_markerblocks(const char* fname,
10130 const gsc_SimData* d,
10131 const gsc_MarkerBlocks b,
10132 const gsc_MapID labelMapID) {
10133 FILE* f;
10134 if ((f = fopen(fname, "w")) == NULL) {
10135 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s for writing output\n", fname); return;
10136 }
10137
10138 GSC_ID_T mapix;
10139 if (labelMapID.id == NO_MAP.id || (mapix = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, labelMapID)) == GSC_NA_IDX) {
10140 gsc_save_utility_markerblocks(f, b, d->genome.n_markers, d->genome.marker_names, NULL);
10141 } else {
10142 gsc_save_utility_markerblocks(f, b, d->genome.n_markers, d->genome.marker_names, &d->genome.maps[mapix]);
10143 }
10144}
10145
10165void gsc_save_genotypes(const char* fname,
10166 const gsc_SimData* d,
10167 const gsc_GroupNum groupID,
10168 const _Bool markers_as_rows) {
10169 FILE* f;
10170 if ((f = fopen(fname, "w")) == NULL) {
10171 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s for writing output\n", fname); return;
10172 }
10173
10174 // casing away const but I promise not to use the iterator to change anything
10175 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter((gsc_SimData*) d, groupID);
10176
10177 gsc_save_utility_genotypes(f, &it, d->genome.n_markers, d->genome.marker_names, markers_as_rows);
10178
10179 delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
10180 fclose(f);
10181}
10182
10203void gsc_save_allele_counts(const char* fname,
10204 const gsc_SimData* d,
10205 const gsc_GroupNum groupID,
10206 const char allele,
10207 const _Bool markers_as_rows) {
10208 FILE* f;
10209 if ((f = fopen(fname, "w")) == NULL) {
10210 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s for writing output\n", fname); return;
10211 }
10212
10213 // casing away const but I promise not to use the iterator to change anything
10214 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter((gsc_SimData*) d, groupID);
10215
10216 gsc_save_utility_allele_counts(f, &it, d->genome.n_markers, d->genome.marker_names,
10217 markers_as_rows, allele);
10218
10219 delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
10220 fclose(f);
10221}
10222
10244void gsc_save_pedigrees(const char* fname,
10245 const gsc_SimData* d,
10246 const gsc_GroupNum groupID,
10247 const _Bool full_pedigree) {
10248 FILE* f;
10249 if ((f = fopen(fname, "w")) == NULL) {
10250 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s for writing output\n", fname); return;
10251 }
10252
10253 // casing away const but I promise not to use the iterator to change anything
10254 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter((gsc_SimData*) d, groupID);
10255
10256 gsc_save_utility_pedigrees(f, &it, full_pedigree, d->m);
10257
10258 delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
10259 fclose(f);
10260}
10261
10277void gsc_save_bvs(const char* fname,
10278 const gsc_SimData* d,
10279 const gsc_GroupNum groupID,
10280 const gsc_EffectID effID) {
10281 FILE* f;
10282 if ((f = fopen(fname, "w")) == NULL) {
10283 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s for writing output\n", fname); return;
10284 }
10285
10286 GSC_ID_T effix = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
10287 if (effix == GSC_NA_IDX) {
10288 fprintf(stderr, "Marker effect set %lu does not exist: cannot calculate breeding values\n", (long unsigned int) effID.id); return;
10289 }
10290
10291 // casing away const but I promise not to use the iterator to change anything
10292 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter((gsc_SimData*) d, groupID);
10293
10294 gsc_save_utility_bvs(f, &it, &d->e[effix]);
10295
10296 delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
10297 fclose(f);
10298}
10299
10302static GSC_LOGICVAL gsc_helper_is_marker_in_chr(const GSC_GENOLEN_T markerix,
10303 const gsc_LinkageGroup chr,
10304 double* pos) {
10305 GSC_GENOLEN_T offset;
10306 switch (chr.type) {
10307 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE:
10308 offset = markerix - chr.map.simple.first_marker_index;
10309 if (offset >= 0 && offset < chr.map.simple.n_markers) {
10310 if (pos != NULL && chr.map.simple.n_markers > 1) {
10311 *pos = chr.map.simple.dists[offset] * chr.map.simple.expected_n_crossovers;
10312 } else {
10313 *pos = 0; // if there is only one marker on chromosome
10314 }
10315 return GSC_TRUE;
10316 } else {
10317 return GSC_FALSE;
10318 }
10319 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER:
10320 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < chr.map.reorder.n_markers; ++i) {
10321 if (markerix == chr.map.reorder.marker_indexes[i]) {
10322 if (pos != NULL) {
10323 *pos = chr.map.reorder.dists[i] * chr.map.reorder.expected_n_crossovers;
10324 }
10325 return GSC_TRUE;
10326 }
10327 }
10328 return GSC_FALSE;
10329 }
10330 return GSC_NA;
10331}
10332
10390void gsc_save_utility_markerblocks(FILE* f,
10391 const gsc_MarkerBlocks b,
10392 const GSC_GENOLEN_T n_markers,
10393 char** const marker_names,
10394 const RecombinationMap* map) {
10395
10396 // Header only gets printed if there are multiple columns.
10397 // (If no map is provided, we print only the third column (markers in each block))
10398 if (map != NULL) {
10399 const char header[] = "Chrom\tLen\tMarkers\n";
10400 fwrite(header, sizeof(char)*strlen(header), 1, f);
10401 }
10402
10403 for (GSC_ID_T i = 0; i < b.num_blocks; ++i) {
10404 if (map != NULL) {
10405 // If we are provided a map, then try to find and print the length of each block
10406 int isonchr = -1;
10407 double len = 0;
10408 if (b.num_markers_in_block[i] > 0) {
10409 double minpos = 0;
10410 double maxpos = 0;
10411 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T chrix = 0; chrix < map->n_chr; ++chrix) {
10412 if (gsc_helper_is_marker_in_chr(b.markers_in_block[i][0],
10413 map->chrs[chrix],&minpos)) {
10414 isonchr = chrix;
10415 maxpos = minpos;
10416 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T j = 1; j < b.num_markers_in_block[i]; ++j) {
10417 double pos;
10418 if (gsc_helper_is_marker_in_chr(b.markers_in_block[i][j],
10419 map->chrs[chrix],&pos)) {
10420 maxpos = (pos > maxpos) ? pos : maxpos;
10421 minpos = (pos < minpos) ? pos : minpos;
10422 } else {
10423 isonchr = -1;
10424 break;
10425 }
10426 }
10427 len = maxpos - minpos;
10428 break;
10429 }
10430 }
10431 }
10432
10433 if (isonchr >= 0) {
10434 fprintf(f,"%lu\t%lf\t",(long unsigned int)isonchr,len*100);
10435 } else {
10436 const char colns[] = "-\t-\t";
10437 fwrite(colns, sizeof(char)*strlen(colns), 1, f);
10438 }
10439 }
10440
10441 // Print the markers contained in the block
10442 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T j = 0; j < b.num_markers_in_block[i]; ++j) {
10443 GSC_GENOLEN_T k = b.markers_in_block[i][j];
10444 if (k <= n_markers) {
10445 fwrite(marker_names[k], sizeof(char)*strlen(marker_names[k]), 1, f);
10446 } else {
10447 fprintf(f,"%lu",(long unsigned int)k);
10448 }
10449 fputc(';',f);
10450 }
10451
10452 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10453 }
10454
10455 fflush(f);
10456 return;
10457}
10458
10465static void gsc_scaffold_save_genotype_info(FILE* f,
10466 gsc_BidirectionalIterator* targets,
10467 GSC_GENOLEN_T n_markers,
10468 char** const marker_names,
10469 const _Bool markers_as_rows,
10470 void (*bodycell_printer)(FILE*,
10471 gsc_GenoLocation,
10472 GSC_GENOLEN_T,
10473 void*),
10474 void* bodycell_printer_data) {
10475
10476 // legacy feature: if printing a specific group's members, put the group number in
10477 // the top left corner cell
10478 if (targets != NULL && targets->group.num != NO_GROUP.num) {
10479 fprintf(f,"%lu",(long unsigned int) targets->group.num);
10480 }
10481
10482 GSC_GLOBALX_T ntargets;
10483 if (markers_as_rows) {
10484 ntargets = 0;
10485 // Header row (genotype names)
10486 if (targets != NULL) {
10487 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets);
10488 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10489 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10490 ++ntargets;
10491 char* n = gsc_get_name(loc);
10492 if (n != NULL) {
10493 fwrite(n, sizeof(char)*strlen(n), 1, f);
10494 } else {
10495 fprintf(f, "%lu", (long unsigned int) gsc_get_id(loc).id);
10496 }
10497
10498 loc = gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10499 }
10500 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10501 }
10502
10503 // Body (genotypes and genotype names)
10504 // - This is our row counter
10505 GSC_GENOLEN_T row = 0;
10506 gsc_GenoLocation* genos = NULL;
10507 // - This is our genotype position cache, because BidirectionalIterator does not have a built-in cache
10508 if (ntargets > 0 && ((row < n_markers || (ntargets > 0 && row < targets->cachedAM->n_markers)))) {
10509 genos = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*genos)*ntargets, GSC_FALSE);
10510 if (genos != NULL) {
10511 genos[0] = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets);
10512 for (GSC_GLOBALX_T i = 1; i < ntargets; ++i) {
10513 genos[i] = gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10514 }
10515 }
10516 }
10517 while (row < n_markers || (ntargets > 0 && row < targets->cachedAM->n_markers)) {
10518 // Row header
10519 if (row < n_markers) {
10520 if (marker_names[row] != NULL) {
10521 fwrite(marker_names[row], sizeof(char)*strlen(marker_names[row]), 1, f);
10522 }
10523 }
10524
10525 // Row body
10526 for (GSC_GLOBALX_T i = 0; i < ntargets; ++i) {
10527 gsc_GenoLocation loc;
10528 if (genos != NULL) {
10529 loc = genos[i];
10530 } else {
10531 loc = (i == 0) ? gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets) :
10532 gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10533 }
10534
10535 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10536 bodycell_printer(f,loc,row,bodycell_printer_data);
10537 }
10538
10539 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10540 ++row;
10541 }
10542 if (genos != NULL) { GSC_FREE(genos); }
10543
10544 } else { // markers as rows = false
10545 // Header row (marker names)
10546 if (marker_names != NULL) {
10547 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < n_markers; ++i) {
10548 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10549 if (marker_names[i] != NULL) {
10550 fwrite(marker_names[i], sizeof(char)*strlen(marker_names[i]), 1, f);
10551 }
10552 }
10553 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10554 }
10555
10556 // Body (genotypes and genotype names)
10557 if (targets != NULL) {
10558 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets);
10559 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10560 // Row header
10561 char* n = gsc_get_name(loc);
10562 if (n != NULL) {
10563 fwrite(n, sizeof(char)*strlen(n), 1, f);
10564 } else {
10565 fprintf(f, "%lu", (long unsigned int) gsc_get_id(loc).id);
10566 }
10567
10568 // Row body
10569 for (GSC_GENOLEN_T i = 0; i < targets->cachedAM->n_markers; ++i) {
10570 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10571 bodycell_printer(f,loc,i,bodycell_printer_data);
10572 }
10573 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10574
10575 loc = gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10576 }
10577 }
10578 }
10579
10580 fflush(f);
10581 return;
10582}
10583
10586static void gsc_helper_output_genotypematrix_cell(FILE* f,
10587 gsc_GenoLocation loc,
10588 GSC_GENOLEN_T markerix,
10589 void* NA) {
10590 if (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10591 fwrite(gsc_get_alleles(loc) + 2*markerix, sizeof(char)*2, 1, f);
10592 }
10593}
10594
10597static void gsc_helper_output_countmatrix_cell(FILE* f,
10598 gsc_GenoLocation loc,
10599 GSC_GENOLEN_T markerix,
10600 void* data) {
10601 if (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10602 char allele = *(char*) data;
10603 int count = 0;
10604 if (get_alleles(loc)[2*markerix] == allele) { ++count; }
10605 if (get_alleles(loc)[2*markerix + 1] == allele) { ++count; }
10606 char out = '0' + count;
10607 fwrite(&out, sizeof(char), 1, f);
10608 }
10609}
10610
10658void gsc_save_utility_genotypes(FILE* f,
10659 gsc_BidirectionalIterator* targets,
10660 GSC_GENOLEN_T n_markers,
10661 char** const marker_names,
10662 const _Bool markers_as_rows) {
10663 gsc_scaffold_save_genotype_info(f, targets, n_markers, marker_names, markers_as_rows,
10664 &gsc_helper_output_genotypematrix_cell, NULL);
10665}
10666
10715void gsc_save_utility_allele_counts(FILE* f,
10716 gsc_BidirectionalIterator* targets,
10717 GSC_GENOLEN_T n_markers,
10718 char** const marker_names,
10719 const _Bool markers_as_rows,
10720 const char allele) {
10721 gsc_scaffold_save_genotype_info(f, targets, n_markers, marker_names, markers_as_rows,
10722 &gsc_helper_output_countmatrix_cell, (void*)&allele);
10723}
10724
10731static void gsc_scaffold_save_ancestry_of(const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m,
10732 gsc_PedigreeID p1,
10733 gsc_PedigreeID p2,
10734 void (*strprinter)(char*, size_t, void*),
10735 void (*intprinter)(long unsigned int, void*),
10736 void* printer_data) {
10737 gsc_PedigreeID pedigree[2];
10738
10739 // open brackets
10740 strprinter("=(", sizeof(char)*2,printer_data);
10741 char* name;
10742
10743 // enables us to print only the known parent if one is unknown
10744 if (p1.id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id || p2.id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
10745 p1.id = (p1.id >= p2.id) ? p1.id : p2.id; //max of the two
10746 p2.id = p1.id;
10747 }
10748
10749 if (p1.id == p2.id) {
10750 if (p1.id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) { //print nothing if both are unknown.
10751 // Selfed parent
10752 name = gsc_get_name_of_id( m, p1);
10753 if (name != NULL) {
10754 strprinter(name, sizeof(char)*strlen(name), printer_data);
10755 } else if (p1.id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
10756 intprinter((long unsigned int) p1.id,printer_data);
10757 }
10758
10759 if (gsc_get_parents_of_id(m, p1, pedigree) == 0) {
10760 gsc_scaffold_save_ancestry_of(m, pedigree[0], pedigree[1],strprinter,intprinter,printer_data);
10761 }
10762 }
10763 } else {
10764 // Parent 1
10765 name = gsc_get_name_of_id( m, p1);
10766 if (name != NULL) {
10767 strprinter(name, sizeof(char)*strlen(name),printer_data);
10768 } else if (p1.id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
10769 intprinter((long unsigned int) p1.id,printer_data);
10770 }
10771 if (gsc_get_parents_of_id(m, p1, pedigree) == 0) {
10772 gsc_scaffold_save_ancestry_of(m, pedigree[0], pedigree[1],strprinter,intprinter,printer_data);
10773 }
10774
10775 // separator
10776 strprinter(",", sizeof(char),printer_data);
10777
10778 // Parent 2
10779 name = gsc_get_name_of_id( m, p2);
10780 if (name != NULL) {
10781 strprinter(name, sizeof(char)*strlen(name),printer_data);
10782 } else if (p2.id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
10783 intprinter((long unsigned int) p2.id,printer_data);
10784 }
10785
10786 if (gsc_get_parents_of_id(m, p2, pedigree) == 0) {
10787 gsc_scaffold_save_ancestry_of(m, pedigree[0], pedigree[1],strprinter,intprinter,printer_data);
10788 }
10789
10790 }
10791
10792 // close brackets
10793 strprinter(")", sizeof(char),printer_data);
10794}
10795
10798static void gsc_helper_ancestry_strprinter_file(char* str, size_t strlen, void* data) {
10799 FILE* f = (FILE*) data;
10800 fwrite(str, strlen, 1, f);
10801}
10802
10805static void gsc_helper_ancestry_intprinter_file(long unsigned int i, void* data) {
10806 FILE* f = (FILE*) data;
10807 fprintf(f, "%lu", i);
10808}
10809
10869void gsc_save_utility_pedigrees(FILE* f,
10870 gsc_BidirectionalIterator* targets,
10871 const _Bool full_pedigree,
10872 const AlleleMatrix* parent_pedigree_store) {
10873
10874 if (targets == NULL) { return; }
10875
10876 gsc_GenoLocation loc;
10877 switch (full_pedigree) {
10878 case 0:
10879 loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets);
10880 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10881 // Offspring
10882 char* n = gsc_get_name(loc);
10883 if (n != NULL) {
10884 fwrite(n, sizeof(char)*strlen(n), 1, f);
10885 } else {
10886 fprintf(f, "%lu", (long unsigned int) gsc_get_id(loc).id);
10887 }
10888
10889 // Parents
10890 for (int parent = 0; parent < 2; ++parent) {
10891 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10892 n = NULL;
10893 gsc_PedigreeID p = (parent == 0) ? gsc_get_first_parent(loc) : gsc_get_second_parent(loc);
10894 if (p.id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id && parent_pedigree_store != NULL) {
10895 n = gsc_get_name_of_id(parent_pedigree_store, p);
10896 }
10897 if (n != NULL) {
10898 fwrite(n, sizeof(char)*strlen(n), 1, f);
10899 } else if (p.id != NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
10900 fprintf(f, "%lu", (long unsigned int) p.id);
10901 }
10902 }
10903
10904 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10905 loc = gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10906 }
10907
10908 break;
10909 case 1:
10910 loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets);
10911 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10912 // Offspring
10913 fprintf(f, "%lu\t", (long unsigned int) gsc_get_id(loc).id);
10914 char* n = gsc_get_name(loc);
10915 if (n != NULL) {
10916 fwrite(n, sizeof(char)*strlen(n), 1, f);
10917 }
10918
10919 // Parents (recursively)
10920 if ((gsc_get_first_parent(loc).id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id ||
10921 gsc_get_second_parent(loc).id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id)
10922 && parent_pedigree_store != NULL) {
10923 gsc_scaffold_save_ancestry_of(parent_pedigree_store,
10924 gsc_get_first_parent(loc), gsc_get_second_parent(loc),
10925 gsc_helper_ancestry_strprinter_file, gsc_helper_ancestry_intprinter_file, (void*) f);
10926 }
10927
10928 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10929 loc = gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10930 }
10931
10932 break;
10933 }
10934
10935 fflush(f);
10936 return;
10937}
10938
10959void gsc_save_utility_bvs(FILE* f,
10960 gsc_BidirectionalIterator* targets,
10961 const gsc_EffectMatrix* eff) {
10962 if (targets == NULL || eff == NULL) { return; }
10963
10964 gsc_DecimalMatrix bvs = gsc_calculate_utility_bvs(targets, eff);
10965 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets);
10966
10967 for (size_t i = 0; i < bvs.cols; ++i) {
10968 if (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10969 fprintf(f, "%lu", (long unsigned int) gsc_get_id(loc).id);
10970 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10971 char* n = gsc_get_name(loc);
10972 if (n != NULL) {
10973 fwrite(n, sizeof(char), strlen(n), f);
10974 }
10975 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10976 } else {
10977 fwrite("\t\t", sizeof(char)*2, 1, f);
10978 }
10979
10980 fprintf(f, "%lf", bvs.matrix[0][i]);
10981 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10982
10983 loc = gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10984 }
10985
10986 gsc_delete_dmatrix(&bvs);
10987 fflush(f);
10988 return;
10989}

10991
10992#endif
